quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Heritage Hotel Phoenix Sprint Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Givemethebeatboys took a little blow inside the last and he'll improve plenty for that, so it's all systems go now for the Group 1 Sprint Cup at Haydock next month - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Space Traveller Irish EBF Committed Stakes (Listed)
quotes.quote: Givemethebeatboys was good with his penalty. He was fresh early on and took a blow a furlong out, but once he got rolling again he was always going to get there. He'll go to Naas and then the Commonwealth Cup - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Keeneland Phoenix Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: The ground was probably a little bit slow for Givemethebeatboys. We might step him up to seven - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Coventry Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Givemethebeatboys ran a great race and tried his heart out. As far as he was concerned he was second - he didn't see the others. We'll probably go for the Phoenix Stakes - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN Marble Hill Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Givemethebeatboys was very professional and he outbattled them to the line. He learned a lot at Navan and he will be even more competitive when we go to Ascot - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and has wintered very well, I'm very happy with him. We're planning to go to Navan with him for the Committed Stakes on Saturday week but I'm not sure the ground will be dry enough for him. Hopefully he'll get back to Royal Ascot this year after finishing fourth in the Coventry last season. He ran very well in the Phoenix Stakes and Middle Park on his final two starts. 24-04-24

quotes.race: Tattersalls Sovereign Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Mighty Ulysses is very good. He wasn't beaten far in the St James's Palace Stakes last year and he's verging on being a Group 1 performer. I don't know where we'll go from here, but John will have something planned. He'd come on well since his first run of the season and better ground doesn't hurt him - Philip Robinson, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Edmondson Hall Solicitors Sir Henry Cecil Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The plan was to take a lead but we wound up in front but Mighty Ulysses ran very well and we are delighted. I thought he ran a blinder (in the St James's Palace Stakes). He was wide and made a lovely run but coming from so wide around the field it just petered out the last 40 or 50 yards after he had come to win it. I couldn't be more happy. He will stay at this trip now we know a mile and a quarter is not viable. If we do anything we will go to Goodwood where there is a three-year-old only Group 3 and look at that. That would be a logical place to go and stay with the three-year-olds - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mighty Ulysses missed the break which helped as there was no pace on and he was able to work his way into the race. He's always shown plenty of ability at home - Robert Havlin, jockey.

quotes.quote: We thought the filly that was second would take a hell of a lot of beating and we'd have been delighted to finish second or third. But Queues Likely is improving and she's a big filly, nearly 17 hands, and she was ticking all the right boxes at home. She's in the German Guineas at the end of next month and we came here thinking she needed to be in the first three to warrant coming back. Like all fillies, once she gets a bit of sun on her back, she'll improve that little bit - Stan Moore, trainer.

runners.owner: Mrs B E Porter, T N Porter Et Al

quotes.race: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We always thought Kitty Rose was a nice filly. She won impressively at Naas and was impressive again today. When she picks up, she just keeps galloping and she's very, very honest. The lads were looking at the 1,000 Guineas. Next year she will be a stronger filly and she won't have any problems with a mile. We'll see how she comes out of this race and talk to the owners. We would like to give her a bit of time over the winter as she's a big filly and will benefit from a winter break - Natalia Lupini, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Kitty Rose is a filly we liked a lot at home. She's a nice big filly and will progress plenty. She likes to go forward and she will be better as she goes up in trip. The Ingabelle at Leopardstown might be a race to suit her - Craig Bryson, assistant trainer.

8:48.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
8:48.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Haptics
runners.comment: Four wins at up to 1m4f in France; back in form when encouraging 4th on recent comeback
runners.spotlight: Four wins at 1m2f-1m4f in France during 2023 but he made a slow start for this yard in the autumn; however, he travelled well for a long way, albeit in a slowly run race, over 1m4f here a fortnight ago and the way he finished suggested he's worth a go over further; trainer won this last year.

runners.name: Ruler Legend
runners.comment: Failed to go on over hurdles; doubtful whether he's worth his current mark back on Flat
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner in Ireland but Flat career petered out and he seems to have gone off the idea over hurdles after a successful handicap debut for this yard in March 2024 (first-time cheekpieces latest, now blinkers); unlikely he's worth his current mark back on Flat; limited appeal.

quotes.race: Discover Whats Trending rhino.bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ruler Legend wasn't going anywhere at the third last but then his stamina kicked in as he was a stayer on the Flat. I was happy with how he picked up the leader at the last and he was going away at the finish - Richie McLernon, jockey.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Trials And Ladies Day May 15th Rated Race
quotes.quote: I thought Ruler Legend did it well. He ran well here last year and likes a dig in the ground. He's a big galloper and will probably get 1m4f. He could be an Ulster Derby horse or something like that. All he does is stay, he's resolute and keeps galloping. He probably ran into quite a nice horse of Joseph's [O'Brien's, Ghasham) in Cork the last day - Fozzy Stack, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been progressing along nicely. We could have a think about the Queen's Vase or possibly a handicap like the King George V Stakes. 09-06-22

runners.name: Cock And Bull
runners.owner: Wayne And Sarah Dale And Ian Foster
runners.comment: Suited by step up to 1m6f in 2024, winning twice; successful return to turf latest; up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Suited by the step up to 1m6f in 2024, winning twice at Sandown (good to firm and good); never involved on AW return but he produced his trademark strong finish when winning at Nottingham recently and looks sure to go well off just 2lb higher, for yard with excellent strike-rate in 2025.

runners.name: Clockmaker
runners.comment: Maiden; unsteerable on one occasion but ran promisingly over 2m on AW in December
runners.spotlight: Maiden who was unsteerable on handicap debut at Goodwood last summer but he should have some potential over 1m6f back on turf, having shaped quite promisingly over 2m on Tapeta in December.

stable_tour.quote: He's a frustrating horse. He would not go around the bend at Goodwood last time out. He's so straightforward at home but it's like something switches when he goes to the racecourse. He becomes tricky but he's a talented horse who wants to stay and that's his game. I'll probably keep him busy this autumn and get him racing regularly to teach him how to race. I think a mile and a half is ideal and as long as there are no extremes in the ground I think he'll be fine anywhere in the middle. 04-09-24

runners.name: Road To Wembley
runners.comment: Three AW wins in 2024; 0-3 on turf but handles the surface; can be competitive
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in 2024; 0-3 on turf but his run behind a Prescott improver at Newbury (2m, good to firm; off this mark) last July shows he acts on grass; perhaps 2m would have suited better but still competitive.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Haydock last time. In hindsight we might have gone a stride too quick, but there's another one in him over 2m. 18-09-24

runners.name: Rock N Roll Pinkie
runners.comment: Wide-margin 1m6f win in November; suited by soft; came on for reappearance in 2024
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with wide-margin win at Nottingham (1m6f, soft) but this quicker ground might not suit so well and she didn't return in good form from a similar break early in 2024; shade to prove.

7:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Pals Battalion
runners.comment: Did well on AW over the winter and ran well on his recent return to turf; contender
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW over the winter and he has carried it on to turf, second of ten at Thirsk two weeks ago (6f, good); another 2lb higher but likely to make another bold bid.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: As I was angling out the race in front of me came that way so I switched off heels then I got carried a little bit but Pals Battalion won really comfortably - David Nolan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Twilight Romance
runners.comment: Everything clicked at Leicester last month (6f, good); big player despite a 6lb rise
runners.spotlight: He had been threatening something bigger earlier in the year and things finally clicked when the well-backed winner of a Leicester handicap three weeks ago (6f, good); hasn't been missed with a 6lb rise but there aren't many pace influences in the field and he should go very well again.

quotes.race: Reg Griffin Appreciation ebfstallions.com Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Haydock race Twilight Romance ran in worked out well. He looked a little bit green there and still looked as though he would improve further today. We'll probably work back from the 300,000GBP sales race here in August - Sean Quinn, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He ran very well in a good race at Haydock first time out last year, then won impressively at York. He was third favourite for the sales race at the Ebor meeting but got very upset in the preliminaries and had run his race before the stalls opened. We decided to geld him and put him away and I wouldn't be surprised if he built on that York win this year. He's one for the good three-year-old sprint handicaps. 20-03-24

runners.name: Gressington
runners.comment: Disappointing on reappearance, even allowing for poor draw; new headgear tried today
runners.spotlight: Benefitted from blinkers and a drop to 6f when winning a Redcar handicap last September; less good twice since and his reappearance last month was underwhelming, even allowing for the draw; needs the new headgear to give him a lift.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Restricted Novice Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (Bands B-D) (GBB)(Div II)
quotes.quote: Gressington was green in the preliminaries and he will improve a bundle. It was a nice debut he can improve from and I feel there were some smart types in the race, so hopefully the form has a bit of substance to it - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Almarada Prince
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark if sharper for last month's C&D return/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb higher than for his last-gasp success at Wolverhampton in December; gelded later that month; unable to land a blow over C&D on his stable debut three weeks ago but better is expected today.

runners.name: Jenever
runners.comment: Probably best at 5f but not handicapped out of things; ran well in one previous visit here
runners.spotlight: Saw off 13 rivals when winning at Sandown last summer (5f, good); generally held his form since and he ran a cracker on his only visit here in 2023; not ruled out.

runners.name: Rock Opera
runners.comment: C&D win last summer; 2nd at Pontefract last time; not sure this will be run to suit though
runners.spotlight: C&D win last summer came off just 1lb lower; well suited by coming from off a strong pace and that isn't guaranteed here; more promise at Pontefract last month though and he appeals as one who'll be winning soon.

runners.name: Hectic
runners.breeder: Miss Nell Kent & Miss Sophie Bates
runners.comment: Needs to bounce back from a quiet run at Musselburgh and others bring stronger claims
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Southwell on final run for Roger Fell (visored first time); headgear absent for new yard, showing fair form at Wolverhampton before a lesser effort at Musselburgh five weeks ago; others look stronger.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Hectic is very straightforward, he trains himself. We've made a lot of entries for him and when we've gone to declare we haven't. He was there to be shot at in front and there's a lot of improvement to come. Dobby loved him and said the ground didn't feel that quick on him; I'd say the ground's lovely. You might look at something like the Acomb, and he's very nice. He's a heavy-set, strong lad, so we'll have to be careful and I'd say he'd get seven furlongs no problem. That was probably quite a smart race - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We struggled to get him back last year after he failed mentally to handle his second outing at York. He ran a super race in a Newbury handicap over seven furlongs on soft ground on his reappearance, though, and I think he'll be a lot better on a sounder surface and with that run under his belt. I was disappointed he went up 6lb, but I think he'll still be very competitive in good handicaps on his way to the Britannia. 02-05-23

Some of the horses just aren't getting their heads in front and this guy is one. He's taken a couple of runs to get fit this year but he's got them under his belt now. He ran a massive race to finish fourth at York last month under Hollie Doyle and we were pleased with that. Unfortunately at Doncaster on his next start, Kieran O'Neill dropped his reins in the last 100 yards and we were just beaten in a photo-finish by Silver Samurai. He might go to Pontefract on Sunday and he'll be a solid handicapper who'll go to the likes of York and be competitive - he was a good fifth there last weekend. 21-06-24

7:48.race_name: Racing Welfare Supporting Racing's Workforce Handicap
7:48.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Mission Command
runners.comment: Two 5f wins last year; never dangerous at Chester on recent return; 6f still a query
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f last season; never in the hunt at Chester on his return to action ten days ago; eased in class but still to prove as effective at this trip.

quotes.race: Dacre Arms Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Mission Command is very uncomplicated and Callum had him in the perfect position. When the other horse came to him, he looked to kick again. He's a lovely, fun horse for the remainder of the season. We'll probably have to stay away from softer ground, he has that real fast-ground action. Five furlongs looks his bag and he'll stay over that trip. He'll go up a few pounds but we'll go up in grade at some stage - George Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Balzarini
runners.comment: 5f looked too sharp on his return last month; others appeal as being better treated
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Windsor for Stuart Williams last summer; looked to find that trip inadequate back from a break (stable debut) at Thirsk last month; doesn't look obviously well handicapped.

runners.name: Mythical Composer
runners.comment: Could leave his reappearance behind him and not yet exposed at 6f
runners.spotlight: Shaped okay at Southwell behind a runaway winner on his return to action three weeks ago; this is a lower grade and he could come on for the run; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to our top sprinter Tis Marvellous and made a really good start to his career last year. He won at Bath in the summer, then ran a great race in the Super Sprint before finishing with a solid third at York. That was on soft ground, and his win had come on firm, so he's versatile. We're very happy with his work and we'll be getting cracking with him shortly. 17-04-25

runners.name: Cayman Tai
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.comment: Ran well on his reappearance but failed to back it up at Newmarket; down in class today
runners.spotlight: Ran well at Pontefract on last month's reappearance but he failed to back it up at Newmarket eight days later; this is a drop in class and he won't mind getting back on faster ground; each-way shout.

runners.name: Tawasol
runners.comment: Made all to win a 6f Brighton maiden in good style 18 days ago; opening mark fair
runners.spotlight: Chased home a notable opponent at Wolverhampton in December (7f); beaten at odds-on at Catterick on his return to action but he made no mistake dropped to 6f at Brighton 18 days ago; more on his plate in a handicap but could well have more to offer.

runners.name: Alpha Magic
runners.comment: A win and a fine third in two novice runs; effective over C&D; unexposed and strong claims
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 40-1 surprise in a Thirsk novice last summer (6f, good to soft); better form when a close third in a hot C&D novice three weeks ago; still unexposed and he's a strong contender.

runners.name: Lord Roxby
runners.owner: N Skinner D Jenkins T Goodair J Glover
runners.comment: 5f win as a 2yo; promising return at Ripon last month (solid form); not fully exposed
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Beverley last summer; promising fourth at Ripon on his seasonal return (solid form); this looks deeper but he's not fully exposed.

runners.name: Dothan
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall
runners.comment: Last-gasp 5f win here on his handicap debut/reappearance; open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Improved with each 2yo run and he made a winning handicap debut here (5f, good to firm) three weeks ago, taking a while to pick up but strong in the final furlong; return to 6f should be fine and he's a key player despite the 2lb rise.

runners.name: Ay Gee Ell
runners.comment: Second in 3 of his 6 starts, the latest a Hamilton novice (5f) two weeks ago; needs more
runners.spotlight: Ran as well as he ever has when second of five in a Hamilton novice (5f, good to firm) a fortnight ago; should be fine back at 6f but this looks competitive.

runners.name: Mcintosh
runners.comment: Second at Windsor 12 days ago and the winner scored at York on Wednesday; new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Couldn't cope with Rare Change at Windsor 12 days ago (6f, good to firm) but that form was given a big boost at York on Wednesday; cheekpieces now added; shortlisted.

runners.name: Dark Rosa
runners.comment: Close 3rd on her stable debut over C&D three weeks ago; more required taking on males
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden win for George Boughey in September (good to soft); ran well on her stable debut over C&D three weeks ago; more on her plate taking on male opponents but clearly on a competitive mark.

6:42.race_name: Yates Drywall Ltd Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
6:42.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Believeinmenow
runners.comment: Very promising start when clear Thirsk second; sure to take a step forward; big player
runners.spotlight: 8-1, made a very promising start when a clear second of ten in maiden at Thirsk (5f, good) two weeks ago, travelling strongly long way but collared late on; this well-related son of Ubettabelieveit seems sure to take a step forward; big player.

runners.name: Go Victor
runners.comment: Cut little ice in Pontefract novice and Chester maiden (both over 5f) this spring
runners.spotlight: Son of Victor Ludorum has cut little ice in Pontefract novice and Chester maiden (both over 5f) this spring; he may still do better in the longer term.

runners.name: Kamakameleon
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, M Broughton & T Elphick
runners.comment: Encouraging C&D debut sixth; this son of Kameko can take a step forward now
runners.spotlight: 9-2, encouraging sixth of 17 in novice over C&D (good to soft) in March, fading last 1f; this son of Kameko can take a step forward now.

runners.name: Sporting Light
runners.owner: Sporting Life Racing Club - R Fahey
runners.comment: Encouraging debut fourth at Pontefract; son of Calyx can make his presence felt
runners.spotlight: 7-1 and green, encouraging fourth of seven in maiden at Pontefract (5f, good) on his debut 17 days ago; this son of Calyx can make his presence felt with better to come.

runners.name: Call Me By My Name
runners.comment: Second in maiden at Chester nine days ago; he may do better still so can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Son of Cable Bay took a big step forward from his debut when second of ten in 5.5f maiden at Chester nine days ago; he may do better still so can't be discounted.

runners.name: Sands Of Seve
runners.comment: Sands Of Mali colt; this newcomer can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Sands Of Mali colt; half-brother to winners Miss Mai Tai (6f/7f; RPR 89) and Miss Woo Woo (6f/6.5f; RPR 76); dam, once-raced, is a half-sister to Swedish 5f-1m winner Sweet Loreen; newcomer can't be ruled out.

runners.name: U S S Charleston
runners.comment: Son of U S Navy Flag; the market can guide for this newcomer
runners.spotlight: Son of U S Navy Flag; dam, 6f AW winner (RPR 70), is a half-sister to useful 1m winner Lord Campari, out of 6f Listed winner Blanche Dubawi; the market can guide for this newcomer.

runners.name: U Turn
runners.comment: Hinted at promise when debut sixth at Pontefract; Land Force colt should build on it here
runners.spotlight: 25-1, hinted at promise when a debut sixth of eight in novice at Pontefract (5f, good) last month; this Land Force colt should build on it here.

runners.name: Dinamo
runners.comment: Daughter of Dandy Man is in good hands and must enter calculations on her debut
runners.spotlight: 37,000gns yearling; dam, 1m AW winner (RPR 70), is a half-sister to winners Go Angellica (1m 2yo Listed) and Southern Belle (useful 5f/6f); this daughter of Dandy Man is in good hands and must enter calculations on her debut.

runners.name: Echoofmymind
runners.comment: Showcasing filly is a half-sister to four winners so she's a considered newcomer
runners.spotlight: £36,000 yearling; Showcasing filly is a half-sister to four winners, including Alpha Zulu (6f AW; RPR 83) and Stage Winner (7f AW; RPR 81); dam 6f winner (Group 3; RPR 111); a considered newcomer.

runners.name: Wateen
runners.comment: Shaped well when debut second at Ayr; has more to offer and can go well again
runners.spotlight: 5-1, shaped well when a debut second of five in maiden at Ayr (5f, good) 19 days ago, edged out only late on; this Profitable filly has more to offer and she can go well again.

runners.name: Corniche Girl
runners.owner: C Munro, Mrs M Gander And Partner
runners.comment: Promising debut Brighton fifth; Dandy Man filly can improve fair bit for the experience
runners.spotlight: 9-1 and green, promising fifth of nine in maiden at Brighton (5.5f, good to firm) last month, keeping on late after a tardy start; this daughter of Dandy Man can improve a fair bit for the initial experience.

runners.name: Sayidah Poets
runners.comment: Too free in pair of 5f novices at Bath/Goodwood; capable of better if settling better
runners.spotlight: Earthlight filly has gone too freely and failed to last home in a pair of 5f novices at Bath and Goodwood this spring; she's capable of better if becoming more tractable.

8:18.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
8:18.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Mini Mac
runners.comment: Lacks consistency and there are risks under a 7lb claimer but he's capable upped 3lb
runners.spotlight: Often fluffed the start and/or pulled hard but hadn't had much luck for this yard prior to ending a losing run at Nottingham (1m, good to firm; 33-1) a week ago; lacks consistency and there are risks under an inexperienced 7lb claimer but he's capable back up 3lb.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D, No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Mini Mac loves the soft ground but hated the track. Had it been a more conventional course he'd have won it more cosily - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

runners.name: Canvas
runners.comment: Pulled hard when better was expected over C&D latest; no forlorn hope if more amenable
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who's with his third yard already (firmly back among the winners lately); again pulled hard when better was expected over C&D a fortnight ago and is no forlorn hope if he's more amenable.

runners.name: Queen Of Good News
runners.comment: Blinkers had a positive effect when third here latest (four of these behind); player
runners.spotlight: First-time blinkers had a positive effect when third in a similar handicap here three weeks ago (four of these behind); the step back up from 7f will suit on that evidence and she's one to consider.

runners.name: Pay Attention
runners.comment: Two solid runs in similar races this spring; again likely to be dropped in from stall 11
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last year but two solid efforts in similar races this spring, tending to be ridden patiently and may be again from this draw.

runners.name: Dimension Of Scale
runners.comment: Trip no certainty to suit on pedigree; off for eight months; would want to see support
runners.spotlight: Nothing exciting in three runs for Craig Lidster last summer, her third coming in a four-runner 6f novice here; this trip is no certainty to suit on pedigree; eight months off and considered only if she's been backed.

runners.name: Pearly Squirrel
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow

prev_owners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow

runners.comment: Behind two of these here latest; needs to improve for extra furlong (possible on pedigree)
runners.spotlight: Ran three times for Craig Lidster last year before moving; nothing exciting about her comeback behind two of these here three weeks ago and she needs to improve for the extra furlong (possible on pedigree).

runners.name: Testimonial
runners.comment: Well held on soft ground latterly; landed wide stall on his comeback from seven months off
runners.spotlight: Fared better on his nursery debut in first-time blinkers last autumn (1m, good) before well held in one more start on soft/heavy ground; landed a wide stall on his comeback from seven months off.

runners.name: Atomic Mass
runners.comment: Well held on comeback here; tries this far for the first time and stall 13 won't help
runners.spotlight: Kept to slow turf/Tapeta last year and hung left when behind four of tonight's rivals on 7f course comeback recently (among the favourites); tries this far for the first time and stall 13 won't help conserve stamina.

runners.name: Blue Train
runners.comment: Much better in tonight's headgear combination last time, when a clear second; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard when favourite on comeback and fared much better in tonight's hood/cheekpieces last time, when a clear second (1m, good to firm); there can't be any complaints about a 2lb rise and he's shortlisted.

runners.name: Eighteen Fourteen
runners.comment: Behind three of these over 7f here three weeks ago; gone the wrong way since handicapping
runners.spotlight: Blew the start and pulled hard in first-time cheekpieces (removed tonight) behind three of these over 7f here three weeks ago; can do better but has gone the wrong way since handicapping.

runners.name: Homeland
runners.comment: Showed much more on his comeback behind a progressive winner; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Well held in three runs last year but gelded since and is well related; offered much more on his comeback at Redcar (1m, good to firm) behind a progressive winner and holds leading claims upped 2lb.

runners.name: Dovey Moon
runners.comment: More exposed than some and will need to find a bit more for the stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Three solid efforts off this mark over 7f since handicapping this spring, including here three weeks ago; more exposed than some, though, and will need to find a bit more for the stiffer test.

runners.name: Dollys Delight
runners.comment: Not obviously fancied from stall 14 back from seven months off
runners.spotlight: Well held in three 6f runs for Michael Bell last year and again on her nursery debut for this yard latterly; not obviously fancied from stall 14 back from seven months off.

runners.name: Oselton
runners.comment: Pulled away his chances upped to this trip on his recent comeback and can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in four runs for Mark Walford (6f-7f) last year; pulled away his chance upped to this trip eight days ago; yard runs three.

5:35.race_name: Proudly Supporting Mental Health Awareness Week Apprentice Handicap
5:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Mariner

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Marriott
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: On a roll but often been inclined to pull hard and stamina is the question up another 3lb
runners.spotlight: Took 17 runs before finally getting off the mark but has now developed the winning habit, with victories here (1m) and at Ripon (9.8f) lately; often been inclined to pull hard, including in one previous try over C&D, and stamina is the question up another 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run for us over hurdles at Musselburgh last week and did okay, finishing fourth. He'll go back on the Flat now and is probably very well handicapped. He's the type who'll be winning at the back end of January in a 0-65 over a mile at Wolverhampton. 05-12-24

runners.name: Fast Fred
runners.comment: Could have used some rain; 4lb above his highest successful mark, so needs a career-best
runners.spotlight: Wins last autumn came on soft ground/Tapeta and he could surely have used some rain going back to turf after a short break; remains 4lb above his highest successful mark, so will need a career-best.

runners.name: Selwan
runners.comment: Goes for another new yard after six months off; regressive since undergoing wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner in France (soft ground/AW) who goes for another new yard back from six months off; regressive since undergoing wind surgery and would want to see some market interest before considering him.

stable_tour.quote: He had issues with his feet when he arrived from France. We thought we'd 10-11-23

runners.name: Leagle Aid
runners.comment: Resumes on a workable mark having bumped into one when last seen; high on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Just a small-field novice win to his name last year but was generally consistent in handicaps and resumes on a workable mark having bumped into one when last seen; high on the shortlist.

runners.name: Ocean Heights
runners.comment: Seems the years are catching up and he's some way down the pecking order
runners.spotlight: Dual Polytrack winner who's regressed in recent times, including back on turf late last month; seems the years are catching up and he's some way down the pecking order.

runners.name: V Twelve
runners.breeder: C Weld, R Kavanagh & D Hannigan

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr J D Gordon

runners.comment: Often made the running under both codes and may again; on a competitive mark
runners.spotlight: Often made the running under both codes and may again, having been below par under a more patient ride over hurdles latterly; softer ground would perhaps have been optimal but he handles these conditions and is on a competitive mark.

quotes.race: Bosch Home Appliances At Maxwell's Northallerton Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: V Twelve is a nice, big horse and I hope he'll progress - William Maggs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a flirtation with hurdling and showed ability at it. I've never hadajumps winner but my assistant Jack is mad keen on it, and it was a good idea as he's got a future in that code. He ran poorly on his return to the Flat at Bath - we'll give him another run but he's been on the go for a long time and may be due a break. 27-04-23

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Struggled since returned to the Flat; returning visor and step back up in trip should help
runners.spotlight: Has done most winning, mainly over hurdles, in the autumn months, and has struggled since returned to the Flat this spring; returning visor and step back up in trip should help down another 3lb under promising 5lb claimer Mason Paetel.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

6:07.race_name: Harrison College Your Future Your Choice Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
6:07.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watered)

runners.name: Chief Of State
runners.comment: Little show in a pair of 5f maidens in Ireland; has plenty to prove for his new stable
runners.spotlight: Little show in a pair of 5f maidens in Ireland, tried in cheekpieces at Navan in October; since changed hands for 1,200gns and has plenty to prove for his new stable.

runners.name: Storm Passage
runners.owner: Y O R C Syndicate 1 & Partner
runners.comment: Tenth in novice over C&D on debut; could still do better in the longer term
runners.spotlight: 50-1, never-dangerous tenth of 13 in novice over C&D (good to firm) on his debut 22 days ago; this son of Night Of Thunder could still do better in the longer term.

runners.name: Fast Track Harry
runners.comment: Won at Newbury before stiff task when fifth in Listed race over C&D; leading form claims
runners.spotlight: Harry Angel colt made a winning debut in 6f Newbury maiden in September but faced a stiff task when a well-held fifth of eight in Listed race over C&D following month; has since had a wind op and he holds leading form claims on his return.

stable_tour.quote: He showed promise last year when he made a winning debut at Newbury, then found the ground a little too soft when we ran him in a Listed race at Doncaster. He's a big, strong horse and is coming to the boil nicely now. We're looking forward to seeing him again. 17-04-25

runners.name: Big Apple Jack
runners.comment: Modest form in a pair of novices last month; he may do better once handicapping
runners.spotlight: Son of Mayson showed modest form in a pair of novices at Pontefract (6f) and over C&D last month, slowly away each time; he may do better once handicapping.

runners.name: Brave Bob
runners.comment: Beat only one in maiden here in October; needs to take a major step forward on return
runners.spotlight: 80-1, beat only one on his debut in 16-runner maiden here (7f, soft) in October; this son of Oasis Dream needs to take a major step forward on his return.

runners.name: Canaria Sun
runners.comment: In need of experience when fifth at Redcar last time; could do better once handicapping
runners.spotlight: Poor form shown in a pair of novices this spring, though he still looked in need of the experience when fifth of eight at Redcar (7f) on latter occasion; this son of Twilight Son could do better once handicapping.

runners.name: Implied Volatility
runners.comment: Son of Siyouni needs considering on his debut, especially if market vibes are positive
runners.spotlight: 200,000euros yearling, 20,000gns 2yo; brother to 1m4f AW winner Let Life Happen (RPR 85) and a half-brother to four other winners, including Tucson Cloud (1m2f; RPR 87) and Farout (1m2f, RPR 86); dam unraced; this son of Siyouni needs considering on his debut, especially if the market vibes are positive.

runners.name: Twilight Ice
runners.comment: Twilight Son colt; noteworthy newcomer who is worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 68,000gns foal, £160,000 yearling; Twilight son colt; dam, 7f winner (RPR 98), is a half-sister to winners Queen Of Ice (1m4f Listed) and Gone Dutch (useful 1m-1m3f); a noteworthy newcomer who is worth a market check.

runners.name: Zubaru
runners.comment: Shaped well when debut second at Newmarket in November; a likely player on his return
runners.spotlight: Sent off 33-1 for his debut in novice at Newmarket (6f, good to soft) in November but this son of Zoustar shaped well when a staying-on second of 11; that form has been well advertised since so he's very much one to consider on his return with tongue tie added.

runners.name: Alfa Sea Breeze
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Syps (Uk) Ltd
runners.comment: Debut Southwell fifth in November for Craig Lidster; can take step forward for new yard
runners.spotlight: 33-1, hinted at promise when a debut fifth of ten in 5f maiden at Southwell in November for Craig Lidster; she can take a step forward for her new yard.

runners.name: Glamorous Angela
runners.comment: Well-related Showcasing filly; considered newcomer who is worth monitoring in the betting.
runners.spotlight: Showcasing filly is closely related to winners Doctor Khan Junior (6f/7f; RPR 108) and Margot Robbie (7f; RPR 56) and a half-brother to 6f winner Pocklington (RPR 99); dam, 5f-6f winner (Listed/Group 3; RPR 111), is a sister to high-class sprinter Hoof It; a considered newcomer who is worth monitoring in the betting.

runners.name: Minshaar
runners.comment: Green when a debut sixth at Pontefract; this daughter of Mohaather can build on it here
runners.spotlight: 11-1 and green when a never-dangerous sixth of eight in novice at Pontefract (6f, good) on her debut last month; this daughter of Mohaather can build on it here.

runners.name: Checkandchallenge
runners.comment: No match for Dancing Gemini at Doncaster in March; still has unimpressive strike-rate
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of very useful form; however, proved no match for Dancing Gemini at Doncaster in March and still has an unimpressive strike-rate, underlined by just one win in last 20 runs; record of 0-6 in Group 1 races includes a defeat (eighth of 12) in this race two years ago.

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud James Seymour Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Checkandchallenge has run in some hot races this year and I don't think he has actually run a bad race in any of them. Dropping back into a Listed race today it was just nice to get his head back in front. I know the distance between them was a long way at Ascot the other day, but he was fourth in a Group One and he picked up a good bit of prize money and he had some nice horses behind him. I think a mile and a quarter is right for him. We went back for the stiff mile at Ascot as we felt on that track it was going to suit him and he got his just rewards. He can cope with those extremes out there today where a lot of other horses can't. He is in the Hong Kong Mile, but I think he deserves a nice break. There will be plenty of options for him next year. Horses like him can turn up in those Group One races that cut up a bit and pick up a bit of money. We might also look at those Group Three and Group Two races in France again next year - William Knight, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Burradon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely delighted and excited with the manner in which Checkandchallenge has done it in what looked a competitive field. He had to go and win today to warrant a run in the Guineas and that's still on the agenda. It looked like there was a bit left there, which there needs to be to be competitive in the Guineas. There's improvement still to come from him, it wasn't all about today. The big challenge is he's got to convert his all-weather form across to turf, but there's no reason why he can't. He did a nice bit of work on the grass gallops last week which pleased us and made us feel he was definitely above average - William Knight, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who won his first two races and earned a place in the 2,000 Guineas. His second start when bolting up in Listed company at Newcastle had plenty of people talking about him and I must be honest I thought he'd win but not in the manner he did. We decided he had to take his place in the 2,000 Guineas but he never got a chance to show his true colours. He got wiped out at the start, which caused him to lose his action, and from there on things never went right. Unfortunately he came back sore, having knocked a joint. It has been hard work getting him back but he's there now and ready to go again. I looked at Royal Ascot but he had a slightly dirty scope before and you must be 100 per cent for that meeting. He heads to Newmarket for the July meeting, where we'll aim for the Listed Sir Henry Cecil Stakes over a mile and then we'll look to the Thoroughbred Stakes at Glorious Goodwood. He'll run at Newmarket as long as they get nice ground and hopefully we can get him back to where he was before the Guineas. He'll have to carry a penalty there for his Listed win but it's a lesser race and hopefully it'll help him get his confidence back. We're all very excited about getting him out again. Further down the line we could look to step him up to 1m2f. 30-06-22

runners.name: Dancing Gemini
runners.comment: Two from two this term, both times impressing with the way he travelled and quickened
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile ground-wise; very similar type to last year's star miler Charyn, having drawn a blank as a 3yo (still showed some good form) but commenced his 4yo season with wins in the Doncaster Mile (Listed) and bet365 Mile (Group 2) at Sandown, both times impressing with the way he travelled and quickened smartly; promises to take even higher rank in this division; connections have secured world-class Ryan Moore for the ride in this important next step; strongly respected.

quotes.race: bet365 Mile (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We always thought Dancing Gemini could do what he has done today and that is why we were pitching him in all the Group races last year. Unfortunately, it was such a wet summer last year and we never got a chance. Everyone kept labelling him a soft ground horse but he's not a soft ground horse. I was delighted to see him win like that again today. I know some of the field will improve for today but Mr Fabre's horse was fit and he's no mug - he was third behind us in the French Guineas when we were runner-up. Haatem is also a serious horse. The Lockinge and the Prix d'Ispahan are the options now. We've got to get him a Group 1 and we'll do what is best for him so it's not decided yet. We'll see how the dust settles after today - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Doncaster Mile Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dancing Gemini likes this track! I'm absolutely delighted. We've always had high hopes for this horse, doing what he did there in a quality field I'm very excited. We thought we'd start at a mile. He's bred for further and he's got that blistering turn of foot - sometimes if it's not broken don't fix it. We've got some talking to do now because there's the Group Two at Sandown he could go to but he could just go straight to Newbury - and it's local! - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Dancing Gemini ran well. I rode him to finish and he just emptied out. He'll be better back in trip - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Poulains (Group 1) (3yo Colts) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We'll let the dust settle and then we'll have a discussion. Whether Dancing Gemini will stay a mile and a half around Epsom or maybe do you come back here over a mile and a quarter - there's lots to discuss. He's always had that kick and maybe he might have too much speed for a mile and a half, and coming here might be the wise thing. He'll have come on for today and he's had no prep - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Flying Scotsman Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was really impressive. We've held Dancing Gemini in high regard all year and he did a piece of work last week that was breathtaking. I knew we had him in good shape coming into today and I said to Lewis if he can back up that bit of work you'll be going pass that lollipop in front. It was a very nice performance. We won this with Tip Two Win and he could possibly be as good. He's got a similar profile, he's got speed, he's got a turn of foot and he's got a good cruising gear. He's in the Futurity here but we'll play it by ear, we'll see how he comes out of today. If all's well and the owner is happy we might take a punt on it. If not we'll leave him for next year, maybe do a trial and go on to the Guineas - Roger Teal, trainer.

quotes.race: Chapel Down British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dancing Gemini in probably one of the nicest two-year-olds already. We don't get many but we know when we've got a good horse and I've got a lot of butterflies about this horse. He's still a tad green but he went away nicely and he was very professional - Roger Teal, trainer.

runners.name: Lead Artist
runners.comment: Largely progressive last term but flopped behind Dancing Gemini on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Largely progressive in his first season last year, winning two Group 3 events and looking the type to improve again this term; however, folded tamely and finished last of eight at Sandown (behind Dancing Gemini) on reappearance; may rebound but is hard to support on the back of that effort.

quotes.race: Space Blues Darley Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Lead Artist has always been a high-class horse and the form of his second at Doncaster time stacked up when the winner Kinross ran so well at Longchamp last weekend. As he now has this kind of trip on his compass, this opens up other options for next year - Barry Mahon, racing manager to owners Juddmonte.

quotes.race: Bonhams Thoroughbred Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: When you're drawn one here and the cutaway is gone you'd better get out and get a position so you don't get boxed in. Lead Artist controlled the race, dominated it very well and has improved greatly. He didn't like the ground at Newmarket because it was too soft. Hopefully he's good enough to come back to the Celebration Mile here. He missed all of last year. His first start was in the Wood Ditton. He's a horse on the upward curve and there's plenty of racing to come. If he gets better and better he could be a lovely four-year-old too - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Darley EBF Novice Stakes (For horses With No More Than Two Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lead Artist is a good-looking horse, we've always liked him but we couldn't run him last year. He's come on from the Wood Ditton. The last furlong was his best furlong and I think a stiff mile is his game right now - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Notable Speech
runners.comment: Successful in the 2,000 Guineas (beat Rosallion) and Sussex Stakes in 2024; big player
runners.spotlight: Record of 5-8 in his first season last year featured wins in the 2,000 Guineas (turf debut; beat Rosallion) and Sussex Stakes; disappointing behind Rosallion at Royal Ascot in between but is set for a fascinating rematch, with the scoreline between them 1-1 and nothing in it on ratings; respectable third in the Breeders' Cup Mile when last seen; big player.

quotes.race: Prix du Moulin de Longchamp (Group 1) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Charlie [Appleby] is very philosophical and it's all now geared towards the Breeders' Cup, where Notable Speech will get the ground he needs. We all saw at Goodwood and Newmarket that he has fantastic acceleration on the right surface - Hugh Anderson, Godolphin chief executive.

quotes.race: Qatar Sussex Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Notable Speech was firing on all cylinders coming in here today. He's a brilliant Guineas winner, with a very rare turn of foot. He showed that again today and I'm delighted. Full credit to Charlie and the whole team, they've done such a good job with him to get him back after a disappointing run in the St James's Palace where he was obviously too bad to be true. He's such a brilliant horse. He's a horse that really excites you and it's a real privilege to be riding him - William Buick, jockey, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: St James's Palace Stakes (Group 1) (Colts) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It's disappointing. That's obviously not the horse we know from Newmarket. Notable Speech relaxed nicely and I thought everything was going how I expected. Take nothing away from the winner, who has danced every dance, but we've not run anywhere near what we can do - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Qipco 2000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Notable Speech really was impressive. He's the kind of horse who I've not known for that long. I came back from Dubai and rode him in February and here we are. I've not very often believed in a horse as much as this guy. I've had that much belief in him and sometimes you go home at night and think 'have I lost the plot all together?' because that's how he does things, he does it so easily and his change of gear is incredible. The race couldn't have worked out any better, fair play to the team he was in great form today. He's done nothing but improve. He's an out-and-out miler, he's all about speed. He's got a strong mind, I really think he's a horse who is going to keep improving - William Buick, jockey, speaking to ITV.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily British EBF Conditions Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I was very pleased with how well Notable Speech has done physically since the last time I rode him. He's really filled out and I think he's grown a little as well, which is always nice to see. I couldn't be more happy with him. I tested him a little bit today and he had it covered in a stride. I had to try and pick a path with him but he's genuine and easy to deal with and he's got a bright future ahead of him. Obviously at the moment it's all wet [on the grass] so this was a nice opportunity for him to have another run on this surface. He'd handle a little bit of cut in the ground but he's a very fast horse with a low action, so he would like decent ground. He's a speedy miler. It was a really good performance and he deserves to go up in grade now. I thought this was a warm race and he gave away weight to all of them, so I'm delighted - William Buick, jockey.

runners.name: Persica
runners.comment: Gained last four wins over longer trips; faces a stiffer task returned to 1m
runners.spotlight: Generally progressive colt who bagged Group 3 honours at Newmarket (1m1f) most recently, adding to his 1m2f wins (handicap/Listed) last term; faces a stiffer task in this field and hasn't raced over 1m since being beaten by Notable Speech at Kempton one month before that colt won the Guineas.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Persica will go to Newbury [for the Lockinge] if it's soft, but he could have a good one in him later on. The owners love the game and turned down a lot of money for him, so it's a nice outcome - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: LiveScore Bet Doonside Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Persica could have done it better and my hand was forced a little bit. I was going wide and I could see Jim Crowley going to have a dream run coming through, it forced me to go when I didn't really want to. He's lasted out to the line but I wonder how fully this horse stays a mile and a quarter. He doesn't lack speed. Maybe his optimum is actually coming back a furlong. He's a nice three-year-old and he'll make a nice 4yo - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Hong Kong Jockey Club Lester Piggott Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica was drawn 11 which was always going to be hard. We always thought he was a very good horse and he's definitely upwardly mobile. He was able to do it his way today, which was a massive advantage. He's a bit fragile mentally. I didn't think it would suit him here with the crowd and atmosphere. He's a little inexperienced but I hope as he grows up he can turn into a Group horse - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica is quite big but has plenty of ability. He stuck his head out when the other horse came to him and I didn't have to get very serious. He wasn't getting beat. When you look at him you'd say he's a miler all day long. He's one for next year - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his win in the Earl of Sefton. I think a mile and a quarter is his optimum but a fast-run mile will suit him as well, and if we get soft ground in the Lockinge I think he'll run very well. We have other horses for these big races as well but he'll do more than just fill in the gaps. He's a very, very good horse and he'll win a big one somewhere down the line. 22-04-25

runners.name: Prague
runners.owner: A Dal Pos, L Zanin, R Zanin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Recorded a Group 2 win prior to well beaten in the QEII; needs to resume progress
runners.spotlight: Won well last June on belated debut and took his form to a very smart level in Group 2 at Newmarket (1m, soft) in September, prompting a supplementary entry for the QEII where he was well beaten having been kept away from the others for most of the way; needs to resume progress.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Joel Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We may have to think about supplementing Prague for the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes on Champions Day. We knew he would be competitive after he worked nicely on the watered gallop next to the track the other day - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

quotes.race: Darley British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Prague was in the horses in training sale at the end of the year and we bought him for ten grand. I don't know how good he could be. He's not done much at home. I've only been training five and ten grand horses so for me to get one formerly trained by Aidan O'Brien proves what we could do with real horses but we're just not getting them. He's a big colt and we've just taken our time. The best thing about it is he's owned by our best lad, who walked around the sale for days and eventually found him. He's the best looked after horse in the yard - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

runners.name: Rosallion
runners.comment: Sparkled in a truncated 2024 campaign; leading contender provided he returns in same form
runners.spotlight: Talented colt who travels and quickens and is suited by good ground or firmer; record is 5-7; sparkled in a truncated 2024 campaign that comprised a good second behind race-fit Notable Speech in the 2,000 Guineas then wins, looking better than the bare form, in the Irish equivalent and the St James's Palace Stakes at Royal Ascot; subsequently met with a setback that has kept him out of action until this eagerly awaited return; leading contender provided he picks up where he left off.

quotes.race: St James's Palace Stakes (Group 1) (Colts) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I knew it was going to be a bit tactical. Rosallion had to be good today and I just knew the stiff track would suit me, and boy was he good. He travelled so well and he picked up strongly - when he has something to aim at he tries. I'm hoping one day they go a really good gallop and he gets to show his true potential because at the moment he's shown how versatile he is - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Irish 2,000 Guineas (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Rosallion was a bit keen early. It took him a bit of time to pick him up, but he's such a hyped horse, he's not going to please everybody. It's on to Ascot now for the St James's Palace and hopefully he will be in training next year. These days are very rare, we will enjoy it. Haatem is so brave, he has run such a lovely race. He didn't really deserve to get beat but his day will come. I just love him, he's really smashing and a pleasure to have. If anything he has emerged with maybe more credit than the winner and his day will come. I think he will stay further - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco 2000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Rosallion travelled so well and he got to the front and looked like he was going to win. I don't think he needed it - he hasn't blown up as he has done loads of work. He's still an extremely good horse and I'd love to take the winner on again around a bend at Royal Ascot in the St James's Palace Stakes and we'll also look at going to Ireland. I think this is probably the best Guineas we have seen in ten years - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere (Grand Criterium) (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (New Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It took a lot of braveness to bring Rosallion here on the back of a disappointing run last time. We always thought he was good and felt the soft ground was the reason he ran like he did last time. We were worried about the draw and he's done really well to win from there (stall ten). We've been going through this year with next year's Guineas in mind; that's the belief we have in him - Sean Levey, rider.

quotes.race: Get A Run For Your Money At BetVictor Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rosallion is a lovely colt. The ground was plenty quick enough for him and he'll get further, but he's a very nice horse for next year and this year. We'll see how he comes out of this as regards to Ascot, but I think he's very nice - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A flag-bearer for us last year with his wins in the Irish Guineas and St James's Palace. Unfortunately, he had some form of near pneumonia but he's come back looking fantastic and Timmy Murphy, who rides him every day, says he's in the best form he's ever been in. The proof only comes when we start racing, though, and the plan is the Lockinge - although he won't go anywhere near soft ground - then Queen Anne and Sussex, before we start thinking about the end of the season. 22-04-25

runners.name: Fallen Angel
runners.comment: Smart filly but has shown her peak form outside of Britain; something to find
runners.spotlight: Smart filly but has shown her peak form outside of Britain, notably for Group 1 wins in Ireland in 2023/2024 (including the Irish 1,000 Guineas) and when a creditable fourth in French Group 1 on last appearance; matters of location aside, has something to find on the figures in this field.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Irish 1,000 Guineas (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We were disappointed with the Guineas. We sent Fallen Angel to Newmarket fit and she didn't blow that much afterwards. The ground maybe was a bit quick on the undulations, but that's looking for excuses, we were beaten fair and square on the day. She just sparked up in the last week, and physically she looked fantastic today - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Moyglare Stud Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Fallen Angel jumped great and is a very straightforward ride. You can put her where you want in a race, she stays very well and I thought the last furlong would be her best furlong - Danny Tudhope, rider.

quotes.race: Aspall Cyder 1728 Sweet Solera Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We were very confident coming here today. Fallen Angel is so laidback and travelled so well in the race. She hit the line strong and will go another furlong no problem. We've always liked her at home and she's quite versatile as regards ground - Daniel Tudhope, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's high-class and will start off in the Lockinge. She'll have an entry in the Queen Anne at Royal Ascot but, depending on what happens at Newbury, she could easily end up in the Duke of Cambridge. She didn't quite see out the ten furlongs on slowish ground in the Opera at the end of last season but I'm sure we'll give her another go at that trip at some stage. 11-04-25

runners.name: Tamfana
runners.breeder: Gestut Etzean U H H Rodenburg
runners.comment: Won last year's Sun Chariot; ties in with Dancing Gemini on reappearance form; solid
runners.spotlight: Very smart filly whose record of 141132 over 1m features a success in the Sun Chariot and a placed effort in the QEII last year; ran creditably, beaten just under 2l, behind Dancing Gemini at Sandown on reappearance when carrying a penalty; now gets a 5lb pull with that opponent and appears to have a fighting chance in the rematch; consistent and holds solid claims.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Sun Chariot Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Tamfana did exactly what we hoped she would. We kept it simple, I said to Colin (Keane) she travels well and quickens so respect the filly because she'll take you there. For once everything went smoothly and she really deserves this. She really does - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Atalanta Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted and Tamfana did it with style. Despite the fact she's had a break and she was in need of the run, that's how she should have won the race. She's entered in the Sun Chariot over a mile and the Opera over a mile and a quarter the next day, so we have the choice and won't make the call right now. She's also entered in the QEII, so that is on the radar - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix de Diane Longines (Group 1) (3yo Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm very proud because Tamfana ran her heart out. She had every chance and she's done the hard work at the front. I'm proud because she did what she could, but I'm disappointed because she looked like the winner - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Tamfana was the best one and she was the unluckiest one, but what can you do? The plan was the [Prix de] Diane and she'll go there, and she'd have a very good chance in that race. You could run that race a hundred times and she would win ninety nine of them, but that's racing here. Jamie was in the spot, he was where the winner came from yesterday, and he was travelling better than anything and it was just a matter of getting gaps but he didn't; that's just the way it is. It's just a matter of going away and licking our wounds, eh? I'd like to be happy but it's hard - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Imprudence (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Tamfana has been beaten by two speed horses and when they challenged, she took a big gulp of air before really sticking with it. I wouldn't swap my filly and while the Prix de Diane is her main target, she'll take in either the 1,000 Guineas or the Poule first - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Miesque (Group 3) (2yo Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Tamfana is my best two-year-old filly and so I expected that. Today was a bit on the sharp side for her, she's more a filly for a mile or a mile and a quarter. It certainly wasn't a surprise when you saw how she won the other day. You need to have some talent to win at Kempton by nearly ten lengths. She'll be entered in the Poule d'Essai and the Diane next year as well as all the good races in England - David Menuisier, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's already a Group 3 winner and an exciting filly. She started this season on Tuesday with a good third at Deauville in the Prix Imprudence. I was hopeful rather than confident, given the heavy ground, but it was a trial and she will benefit from it. Her main target is the Prix de Diane as the trip will be ideal. She's entered in the Oaks, but 7f was a good starting point and now she could go for one of the 1,000 Guineas, either in Britain or France. 11-04-24

12:50.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Aston Park Stakes (Group 3)

runners.name: Al Aasy
runners.comment: Won Sandown Group 3 three weeks ago and has excellent record here; very solid claims
runners.spotlight: 8yo who has an excellent record here, winning this race in 2021 (good to soft) and the Group 3 Geoffrey Freer (1m5f, good to firm) last August; reappeared with a win in the Group 3 Gordon Richards at Sandown (1m2f, good) three weeks ago and he holds very solid claims despite a 3lb penalty.

quotes.race: bet365 Gordon Richards Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We knew Al Aasy was in good form and he has looked great all winter. He is paying us back for looking after him in his earlier years and is just a lovely horse to have about. I think Jim [Crowley, jockey] has really got the hang of him by just waiting and waiting and the mile and a quarter pace suited him better. I was worried he might be too fresh but Jim gave him a beautiful ride. I think a both a stiff mile and a quarter and a mile and a half suit him. We'll look around and find something for him - Maureen Haggas, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: BetVictor Geoffrey Freer Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Al Aasy has always been talented and has probably been better since being gelded. It was great for him there, it was easy. He's a dude at home now. It's only four weeks since he had his first run here, with Goodwood in between, which is a big ask, especially having had some time off like he has but you couldn't have passed up an opportunity like this. He's seven-years-old and it's time to get to work really.  He enjoyed it today. It was a good pace, which he enjoys. He's run over all sorts of trips, from a mile and a quarter up to a mile and five furlongs. He likes a good pace. He used to be very keen at home. He's not as keen but can still be strong when he wants to - Maureen Haggas, wife of trainer William.

quotes.race: Coral Glorious Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was a messy race. We went very steady. I got a bit closer at the top of the hill and then I was quite happy when he was in a pocket. William [Haggas, trainer] said to ride him for luck and, if it opens up, it opens up. We just needed that gap and I was very fortunate to have got up the rail. There wasn't a lot of room up the rail but Al Aasy was very brave. Once he was in there, it was game over really. He's just as good over this trip as he is over a mile and a half. He's been a bit unlucky because that's his run style. He's been called a few names in the past for not being a battler. He's just one of those horses who has to be produced at the last minute - Jim Crowley, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Rose Of Lancaster Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Al Aasy has always been a talented horse and bringing him back to a mile and a quarter has been a good thing, he gets the trip well and he travels really well. He looked as though he was enjoying himself today. The horse has been unfairly criticised, since he's been gelded we've never really classed him as ungenuine, he's been unfortunate once or twice. Although he's old he's a bit like Hamish, there aren't many miles on the clock - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: bet365 Stakes (Registered As The Steventon Stakes) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That's very satisfying for everyone involved with Al Aasy. They badgered me to run him over a mile and a quarter. I wouldn't do it but I finally succumbed and clearly, now aged six, that's his trip. They go a bit faster and that helps him to relax. He did it comfortably today. Physically, he's been a battle, and mentally he's not straightforward either. He's had a couple of injuries but he's coming. He still doesn't look right in his skin but he's coming. He'll go for the Rose of Lancaster at Haydock, a Group 3 over a mile and a quarter on August 12, next - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Carey Group Buckhounds Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: You could say that Al Aasy should have won the way he won because he's only just been beaten in a Group 1, but I thought Dane [O'Neill, jockey] gave him a brilliant ride and he did it nicely. He had a nice, easy run around and it'll have done his confidence the world of good because that's what he needs. That's half the battle with him really because he's got stacks of talent. In terms of where we go next, that'll be a discussion we have but he's got options - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: I'm sorry that Al Aasy never ran at all - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Rayyan Stakes (Registered As The Aston Park Stakes) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Al Aasy won very well and liked the ground. He settled well and I can't really say anything else because he looks like that at home. He's a talented horse. He's done well this year and we'll find out in the Coronation Cup, which is where he'll run next. He's in everything and we've put him in the Arc, but that's a long way to go. I fancy a mile-two, but I'm not sure, and there are some fantastic races at a mile and a half. If he's going to run in the Arc he'll need a break and I wasn't planning to run him after the John Porter until Epsom, but he was too well - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Bahrain Trophy Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: William has always liked Al Aasy - he's a beautiful horse, and he's bred to be a good horse. He ran really well first time last year and we were really disappointed when he ran like he did at Newmarket and we don't know why, perhaps it was rustiness. He did what he needed to do last time and he's improving and learning. When he won last time this was the race William wanted to go for, but I don't know what's next. I'd think a well-run mile and a half would suit him best, he's not slow, and ideally faster ground than today. I think the Great Voltigeur would be the likely next step - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

runners.name: Courage Mon Ami
runners.comment: 2023 Ascot Gold Cup winner; returns from long absence over a trip short of his optimum
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 6yo who won the 2m4f Group 1 Ascot Gold Cup (good to firm) in June 2023; runner-up in Lonsdale Cup at York (2m, good to firm) that August and absent since; he was a class act but, even if retaining all of his ability, he may find this comeback trip to be on the short side.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Courage Mon Ami ran a nice race but he ran out of track. Look at the form of the Gold Cup and he had a 3lb penalty - and 3lb over two miles. That was the difference. A little more distance would have suited him too. All being well he'll go to the Prix du Cadran at Longchamp, back up to two and a half miles, which is his favourite. Then we'll put him away and if all goes well, he'll be back for the Gold Cup next year - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: You can't practice two and a half miles at home, but he (Frankie Dettori) stayed cool and rode him cool in the dark down the inside, saving every inch. I saw he went to go outside turning into the straight and they said no, go back in, and luckily he managed to wriggle through and found a great run. Courage Mon Ami is a gelding by Frankel, he's unbeaten, but he's gone from the all-weather to Goodwood to here, so full achievement to the horse - John Gosden, talking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Tony Barrett Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: It was an unsatisfactory race to ride in because we went very slowly and Courage Mon Ami has only won two novices, but I think we can step him up in trip because he was flat to the metal for 5f and kept going. He looks a nice horse and has come on leaps and bounds for each run, so let's hope he can keep doing the same - Robert Havlin, jockey.

runners.name: El Cordobes
runners.comment: Won Newmarket handicap in fine style; up in grade today but could be up to the task
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who returned to Britain with a career-best performance to win a handicap at Newmarket (1m4f, good) a fortnight ago by about 3l; goes up in grade today but this progressive Frankel gelding, who cost 2,000,000gns in 2022 and is in top hands, could be up to the task.

quotes.race: Lay And Wheeler Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: El Cordobes stays very well and and we could look at the Duke Of Edinburgh Stakes if he's not pushed him out of it, otherwise the Aston Park Stakes at Newbury - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Eydon
runners.comment: Has run some good races since returning from long absence, but others have stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Good fourth in 2,000 Guineas in 2022, then absent for nearly two years; close second in Listed contest at Ayr (1m2f, good to firm) last September and has run some respectable races in defeat since; it's possible he has some untapped potential at this trip but others have more substance to their claims.

quotes.race: Qipco 2000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Eydon has run a massive race as that was only his second run on turf and the three in front of him were Group winners. He's in two Derbys and we may go up in trip with him but whether it's up to a mile and a half, we'll see - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well on debut but I don't think he quite backed it up last time, which was probably trainer error. He's working really well at the moment and is on course for Thursday's Feilden Stakes. 13-04-22

A lovely colt who caught many an eye when easily winning the Listed Feilden Stakes at Newmarket in the spring. On the back of that he ran in the 2,000 Guineas when an eyecatching fourth to Coroebus, and we had hopes for him as a Derby contender but unfortunately he suffered a setback and has not run since. I hope next year he will get the chance to show what I think he is capable of. 17-08-22

runners.name: Kings Gambit
runners.comment: Strong Group-race form last summer; gelded since last seen; could still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Won the London Gold Cup on this card last year and strong form when going close in Group races on next three starts (1m2f-1m4f, good to firm); respectable fourth in Qatar Group 3 (11.5f, good) in February and gelded since; could still have more to offer and he's respected in first-time blinkers.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I thought King's Gambit ran a lovely race. William [Buick, jockey] just thought he stays a mile and a half but that was more like a mile and six the way they rode it. He was just slightly running on empty at the line. He's a ten or 12-furlong horse but 12 in less extreme circumstances - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Hampton Court Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It looked like a disaster from furlong one - we were in the worst possible position on this round course, and King's Gambit has run monstrously well to get anywhere near them. You can see how good he is, and we'll enjoy him down the line - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Trade Nation London Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: When you do that off a handicap mark of 93, it's hard to argue that you're not pretty good. I'd say around 80 per cent of the previous winners of this race are stallions now and it's a proper race. We always thought King's Gambit was a proper horse but he was exceptionally raw last season. William said the Hampton Court would be his sort of race and that's where Time Test went after this - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Benny Hutchins Memorial EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The first time King's Gambit ran, he went up in the air and missed the break. I thought he'd step forward. I wasn't sure about the ground, but I guess some Saxon Warriors go on the soft. He's always been a nice horse. I was a bit disappointed first time and I wasn't surprised this time - I think the only surprising thing was the price. We won't be in a rush because he's immature physically and mentally, and he's not going to jump up a huge grade next time, but Trevor said he couldn't pull him up, which is a good sign - Roger Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Raja Raja
runners.comment: Comfortable win on AW debut in December but off a mark of just 73; up against it today
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who showed improved form to comfortably win a 1m4f handicap at Southwell in December on his AW debut; however, that came off a mark of just 73 and there's a firm suspicion he'll be out of his depth today.

stable_tour.quote: He's had three runs in decent maidens. He's got a mark of 77 and we've just been waiting for a bit of juice in the ground. He's a big Nathaniel horse, very raw, and I think he'll be one we'll look forward to running this autumn. 04-09-24

runners.name: Sunway
runners.owner: Guy Pariente Holding & Qatar Racing Ltd
runners.comment: 2nd in Irish Derby and 3rd in St Leger; could improve for last month's reappearance here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Irish Derby (1m4f, good) last June and another fine Group 1 performance when third in the St Leger (14.5f, good) in September; below best when third on last month's reappearance here but could improve for the run and he's high on the list based on last season's evidence.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
