quotes.quote: Sunway ran an absolute stormer. As usual, he ran his heart out. He just found a couple of better ones today. He could run again, we gave him a break so I assume he'll keep on going but I'm not sure where he'll run - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish Derby (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: That's the third Classic I've lost by less than a length this season so I'm used to it now! I'm delighted with Sunway, we've always thought the world of him. People lost faith in the horse and today he vindicated himself and showed that he's a really classy act - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Greffulhe (Group 3) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Sunway hung in there because of his talent, but I think he's run a long way below form. The reason for that I just don't know. I know the form of the horses he's been working with and even compared to a horse like Tamfana, it's night and day. They don't work together, but Oisin came to work this horse and Devil's Point the other day, and we both know that Sunway has enormous potential. I may not have won 50 Group 1s, but I know a good horse - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Criterium International (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's a lovely story and goes back to May, when Oisin came down to ride Sunway. When he came back from cantering him, he didn't say a word. I was beginning to worry I'd been mistaken about how good he was, but then Oisin said, 'He's the best 2yo I've ridden this year.' Bearing in mind he's sat on 2yos, I've thought ever since that we had a proper one. I was worried about Alcantor, but on this ground he was maybe a little less decisive in terms of his acceleration. Going forward, I think Sunway is a colt for the Classics and he should stay a mile and a quarter and perhaps a mile and a half - David Menuisier, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's extremely well. I opted to start him in the Prix La Force over 1m1f on Sunday, but I think there were a few circumstances that got him beaten. Oisin [Murphy] was kind of kicking himself, he thinks he should have gone in front and ensured a proper tempo. When they changed gears he was a bit rusty and when he found his stride, Oisin wasn't too hard on him. It was only a trial and he got tired in the last furlong. We've not made any decisions about what comes next. He'll either go for the Poule d'Essai des Poulains or for the [Prix] Greffulhe next month, or for the Dante, for which he has an entry. I think this horse needs pace, like he got in the Criterium last year, but he'll bounce back. He'll come on loads for the run, too. His main target is the Prix du Jockey Club and I really hope we can aim towards there. 11-04-24

runners.name: Tabletalk
runners.comment: Short-headed in C&D Group 3 on reappearance; further improvement needed in hotter race
runners.spotlight: Won the competitive Melrose Handicap at York (1m6f, good to firm) last August and reappeared with short-head defeat in Group 3 over this C&D (good) last month; has raced only seven times and could still have more left in the tank, but such improvement is needed today in a hotter race.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Melrose Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: That was extremely pleasing. Tabletalk looked the winner the whole way round. He'd been shaping up nicely at home and he seems to be improving.  I was thrilled to see him handle the ground so well, as that was a slight question mark for me, and he stayed on strong over the trip.  He's a very exciting prospect. It's great for the whole team at home who've worked very hard. He ran in the Derby and that was a really tough experience so we gave him a bit of time, he's a big horse and I think he'll make up into a lovely four-year-old.  He has a very patient owner who let me train him where we wanted to go. He ran a very good race at Ascot last time and he's come to himself nicely - Tom Clover, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran huge at Newbury on his latest start in the John Porter, just getting touched off by Divina Grace. He's in the Yorkshire Cup but he's also in the Aston Park Stakes back over the course and distance where he ran so well last time. Being a Group 3, that might be a more sensible option than York. The 1m6f at York is quite sharp and he'd see that out fine but he isn't short of speed. He was only just beaten over 1m4f at Newbury on his first start of the year and he's entitled to come on for that run. I hope he can be versatile. 14-05-25

2:00.race_name: Trade Nation London Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Nebras
runners.comment: Runner-up in Listed grade last time; bred to do better still; likely player
runners.spotlight: Raced only four times and is bred to do better still, being half-brother to a triple Group 1 scorer for his connections; runner-up to notable rival in Listed grade at Newmarket (upped to 1m2f; good) most recently; likely player, even off top weight.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John and Thady Gosden expected Nebras to finish second or third, so he's surprised us a bit. Whether he runs again this year we don't yet know - Teddy Grimthorpe, racing manager to the owner.

runners.name: Genealogy
runners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & P M Brant
runners.comment: Ballydoyle colt whose final 2yo effort has been advertised by the winner since
runners.spotlight: Ballydoyle colt whose promise over 1m last term featured a Punchestown maiden win (on good ground) and creditable effort in Newmarket Group 3 won by smart stablemate Delacroix who has developed into a major Derby contender; could be well treated and commands respect.

quotes.race: William Hill Betting Done Properly Maiden
quotes.quote: Genealogy had a good run first day at the Curragh. Ryan gave him a fantastic ride here from a bad draw. He's a massive horse and whatever he does this year will be a bonus. He could be one for the Eyrefield Stakes or the Criterium de Saint Cloud late in the year - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden at Punchestown before finishing fifth in the Autumn Stakes at Newmarket. He's ready to start at a mile or a mile and a quarter and we think he could get further in time. 07-04-25

runners.name: Saddadd
runners.comment: Solid start to career; ran well in useful novice event over C&D most recently
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 132 reflect a solid start to his career, most recently running well under a penalty in useful novice event over C&D (good) switched to turf from AW; looks the type to do well in handicaps and this looks a good starting point, being kept to Newbury; strong credentials.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. I thought Saddadd would be a bit green early on, which he was jumping out and finding his stride, but I got into a nice rhythm, a nice sort of pocket to teach him a bit about having horses either side of him. He took a little bit of winding up, but once he did get into top gear, and I had the rail to just help me out a bit, the penny started to drop late on and he finished off good - Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be a better horse on turf and definitely wants to be going ten furlongs. How he runs at Newbury on Friday, in what is always a good race, will tell us if he's a horse to run in a Derby trial or look at something like the London Gold Cup. I've liked him for a while and hope he can be a solid horse. 11-04-25

runners.name: Ernst Blofeld
runners.comment: Ties in with stablemate Nebras on latest effort; should still improve further
runners.spotlight: Late foal who made his debut in April; won at Kempton (1m2f, AW) next time and subsequent Newmarket Listed effort ties him in with stablemate Nebras; looks the type who should still be capable of further improvement; enters calculations.

runners.name: Quai De Bethune
runners.comment: Ties in with Saddadd but that rival has less to prove in this scenario
runners.spotlight: Showed promise over 7f in sole turf run (debut); ties in with Saddadd on penultimate AW effort (1m) but that rival has less to prove in this scenario; pedigree suggests he's not guaranteed to improve for this new trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Law Of Design
runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in two races since novice win; opposed
runners.spotlight: Registered a novice win at Ascot (7f, soft) last September; has failed to beat a rival in two races (Group 2 and Listed) over 1m/1m1f at Newmarket since; enough to prove in this good handicap upped further in trip.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was great. I'm delighted with Law Of Design. He's always shown a lot at home and is a big horse so we'll take stock and decide next week what the next step is. I thought this might be a week too soon, but the ground attracted me and he worked really well this week so I thought we'd get on with it. He's a proper horse I'd say - Brian Meehan, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Wave Rider
runners.comment: Moving in the right direction; Charlton yard has a good record in this race
runners.spotlight: Has moved in the right direction (form figures 432) in 7f novice events, finishing strongly at Wolverhampton (AW) most recently; dam's side suggests this new trip will suit, and the Charlton stable has a good record in this race; hood applied; interesting handicap debutant.

runners.name: Circus Of Rome
runners.comment: Ran respectably last time but needs improvement to land this prize
runners.spotlight: Opened his account in most recent AW attempt, then posted a respectable midfield effort in Sandown handicap (1m2f, good) on the switch to turf; not fully exposed but improvement is certainly needed to land this prize.

runners.name: Asmen Warrior
runners.comment: Runner-up in both outings this season; turn looks near; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Turn looks near, having finished second at Redcar and Leicester this term, both over 1m2f on good ground; goes into deeper waters at this level but is open to progress now handicapping and one to consider.

runners.name: Lightening Mann
runners.comment: Record this year is 1231; upped further in grade but he's steadily progressive
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 1231 (on AW/turf) this year, the latest performance in Class 3 handicap at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm); upped further in grade but he's steadily progressive and receives weight all round; could go well.

quotes.race: Nyetimber Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: We rode Lightening Mann wrong and disappointed him at Beverley last time so we made more use of him here. He's a promising type who will get further - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Lightening Mann will improve lots too. He's still got to iron out a few things, but we've always liked him, and after running at Doncaster in July last year we gelded him and gave him a break with this year in mind - Jack Channon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I'm really happy with him and he won over a mile at Lingfield on his reappearance. The distance was probably too short for him, so we stepped him up to 1m2f at Chelmsford last week and he was second in his first ­handicap. He could be a ­really nice ­handicapper for the year. He could even get 1m4f in time. We like him and we think he can go through the ­divisions. 02-04-25

4:20.race_name: Boylesports Home Of The Early Payout Handicap

runners.name: Ancient Rome

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Regularly runs at Pattern level; sole handicap attempt resulted in a win off this mark
runners.spotlight: Regularly runs at Pattern level and is a Group/Grade 3 winner; has a doubt over current form but sole handicap attempt resulted in Glorious Goodwood success off this mark in 2023; one to consider.

quotes.race: Mint Millions Stakes (Grade 3) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: To be fair, Dr Hay picked this race out even before he purchased Ancient Rome. He's Kentucky-bred so it fitted in well. I think he went well on the [firm] ground today and he's pretty adaptable when it comes to surfaces. He ran in softer conditions a lot of the time in France and last time [at Goodwood] it was soft, but he's a War Front and they go on fast turf - Jamie Spencer, quoted by Bloodhorse.

quotes.race: Coral Chesterfield Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: They did go a good gallop, which was quite tiring in dead ground, and the race fell into his lap in the last furlong. I always thought I was going to be involved; maybe outside the three-furlong pole, he was moving up easily enough and I was following Tom Marquand [on Millebosc], who was kind of dying so we went round him. Ancient Rome is a very lazy horse - you ask him and he'll go for three or four strides, then he's lazy again. Even right at the line he pricked his ears and kind of jammed [the brakes] on, so he's a hard horse to assess. I just planned to drop out, stay on the outside, get cover and come down the outside. Dr Jim said, just ride like Richard Hughes! He's a smart horse and I thought he was a stakes horse, so I'm sure he will be capable of at least Listed company - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had an injury at the backend of last season and has had some time off. He's a big horse who takes a bit of getting ready but he's undoubtedly talented. He's not a certain starter in the Wolferton but if he does take his chance, I think he's well up to that class. 13-06-24

runners.name: Witch Hunter
runners.comment: Landed the Hungerford Stakes here in 2023 and is well handicapped on that form
runners.spotlight: Finished seventh of 17 in the Victoria Cup last Saturday; landed the Hungerford Stakes here (7f) in 2023 and is well handicapped on that form; has made the frame several times over 1m; not ruled out.

quotes.race: BetVictor Hungerford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I was intending to run Witch Hunter in the Great St Wilfrid but I put him in this as well as with the rain coming I thought I might not run Chindit and it might open up for him. I ran Chindit and it still opened up for him so I'm delighted.  He was unlucky not to win at the All-Weather Championships at Lingfield which I thought was his Derby. He's improved all year - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for William (Stobart, owner) - he rang me one day and said he'd like to buy a horse to go to Royal Ascot; we got here, 100/1, no chance, and he looked like he had no chance, sitting last, and he's gone and won. It does happen to nice people sometimes. Jamie's given him a lovely ride - I hate the way he rides, why does he keep doing that to us?! He gave Witch Hunter a super ride and the horse kind of enjoyed that. When he passes one he gets his momentum. And when they pass him, sometimes he just goes, sod it, I'll go another day. He's a very good horse on his day and I don't care what price he is - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: If it's a Saturday, he's probably running in a good race somewhere. He's been a star for us and, if he has an odd bad day, he soon bounces back. I used to think he needed to be held up off a fast pace on a straight track to be at his best, but that's not so rigid anymore, as he's shown us he can do different things and be ridden different ways, including in decent races on the all-weather. He ran moderately in the Doncaster Mile last time but he'll bounce back. 22-04-25

runners.name: Crown Board
runners.comment: Lightly raced; has done well in two attempts at about 1m; interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo; two attempts at about 1m have resulted in his debut success (AW) and good fourth in Sandown Listed event; interesting back down in distance on handicap debut.

runners.name: Epictetus
runners.comment: Smart on his day for the Gosdens but form dipped sharply last year; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Smart on his day (Group 3 winner) for the Gosdens but form dipped sharply in two runs last term; sold for 80,000gns in October; the betting may prove best guide on stable/seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Bonhams Thoroughbred Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It took us three attempts at 1m2f to work out that he wants a mile! Epictetus showed plenty of speed over a mile at two, and we thought he was a horse who'd progress to 1m2f this year obviously that did not pan out - he has run good races but not what we thought that he was capable of. Dropping down in trip on ground that suited him worked today. Obviously there is a mile race back here, the Celebration Mile, which fits in well - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Blue Riband Trial (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The ground was deep and Epictetus has not trained on anything like that this year. This has been the plan for him all year and we'll go to the Dante Stakes next. He may well be more of a Prix du Jockey Club horse but we'll see. Frankie said they went a good clip and he's shown a really good attitude We're still only getting ideas at this stage of the season and you can't judge him on that ground - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Vertem Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: I thought they might go that way, I was walking the track with Aidan and I told Frankie be careful, they're going to turn right out of the gate and use the stands' rail. Epictetus has run great. He's still an immature horse, he's still on the weak side and the ground found him out but he's a grand horse for next year. We'll start him out at a mile and a quarter in a trial, something like the Dante - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys British EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Epictetus wasn't wound up for the race and we have to be absolutely overjoyed with him. He was very professional and Martin (Harley) gave him a lovely ride. We'll probably go for another novice with him to gain some more experience. He'll be very comfortable over a mile - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: English Oak
runners.comment: Won over 7f at Royal Ascot last year, continuing his progress; inconsistent since
runners.spotlight: Landed the 7f handicap at Royal Ascot last year, continuing his progress; however, inconsistent since and was always behind in the Victoria Cup seven days ago; returns to 1m for first time since 2023.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: English Oak is clearly a classy sort, he travelled superbly through the race. We had a massive advantage on the stands' side, even after going a furlong or so we were a long way ahead of the others. He's very speedy. He's got a high cruising speed, he does feel pretty fast. When I let him go there he quickened up pretty smartly. It will be interesting to see what the guys want to do - James Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's a slow-maturing horse who was like a rabbit in the headlights first time. English Oak has seen the trip out really well and is definitely one to keep on the right side - P J McDonald, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Our confidence is a little knocked after two disappointing runs since Ascot but we still think there's more to come. We felt he had a legitimate excuse in the Lennox, when he lost a shoe, and I was very confident going into the Hungerford but left disappointed. I think tactically I made a hash of it as I was worried about the lack of pace. In hindsight making the running wasn't smart. He'll probably end up going for a Listed race over seven furlongs at Newbury on September 20 and he'll hopefully get a bit of cover this time. We'll also consider the Park Stakes. 11-09-24

He was a bit disappointing after putting up such a good performance when winning the Buckingham Palace at Royal Ascot, so we hope we can get him back on track this year. He's been gelded and I hope that will help him. He's a bit behind and is taking a long time to come in his coat, so we're not in a rush with him. He'll probably start back in a conditions or Listed race. I think he's best at that specialist trip of 7f but we'll see how we go. 16-04-25

runners.name: Kingdom Come

prev_owners.owner: China Horse Club Int Ltd & Gandharvi UK

runners.comment: Finished last in the Thirsk Hunt Cup, taking turf record to 0-8; opposed
runners.spotlight: Has shown best form on AW and ran respectably on Good Friday; finished last in the Thirsk Hunt Cup on return to turf, taking record in this sphere to 0-8; not the percentage call.

stable_tour.quote: We explored a mile at Newbury last time, but will come back to seven furlongs for the Buckingham Palace. I still think he's a very nice, progressive horse. 13-06-23

He had a productive start to the year completing a hat-trick in 7f contests, all at Kempton, the last two in handicaps. His only poor subsequent run was at Royal Ascot in the Buckingham Palace Stakes, but he ran a much more encouraging race when third at Haydock last time out. He looked as if a return to a mile would be helpful. I'm full of confidence that he will stay the trip with his pedigree. 02-08-23

runners.name: Ebts Guard
runners.comment: Reappearance form, namely Spring Cup success, puts him in the picture back at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Contrasting performances in major handicaps this season, winning the Spring Cup over C&D (good) then down the field in the Victoria Cup; reappearance form puts him in the picture back at Newbury.

quotes.race: OLBG Spring Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great to be back and it's our first runner on grass [this year]. I didn't know how fit they all were but Ebt's Guard has been working extremely well. - William Muir, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ebt's Guard has been slightly unlucky in his runs. First time out he got beat half a length and then last time we had to go the long way round - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.name: My Cloud
runners.comment: Well bred; proved well ahead of his opening mark at Ascot on reappearance; one to follow
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Palace Pier, whose Group 1 haul included the Lockinge on this card in 2021; proved well ahead of his opening mark at Ascot (1m, good to firm) on seasonal debut, scoring easily and taking form figures to 2211; one to follow and could well defy a 10lb rise with further improvement on the cards.

runners.name: Classic
runners.comment: Gelded prior to encouraging effort in the Spring Cup over C&D on reappearance; in the mix
runners.spotlight: No win since July 2023; however, gelded prior to an encouraging effort (keeping-on third) in the Spring Cup over C&D on reappearance; remains favourably treated on peak form and is one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Best Bet With Jenningsbet British EBF Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Classic has travelled well every day but we let him roll today. He still has signs of immaturity there but he is a very talented horse. We just didn't want to have any excuses today. It wouldn't surprise me if we see him turn up at the top level, especially on soft ground. I'd say there is a fair chance we go to the Champagne at Doncaster next - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's been a mental thing with him - if he wants to win, he will - but we've had him gelded and he seems to have come back in great form. I was very pleased with his run at Newbury this month and he could well be a force in good handicaps like the Hunt Cup. 22-04-25

runners.name: Boyfriend
runners.comment: Has form claims but returns from 12-month absence; market instructive
runners.spotlight: Has form claims as he beat Ebt's Guard at Newbury as a 2yo and ran well off this mark in last appearance; however, has been absent for 12 months, so the market may give the best guidance.

runners.name: Dutch Decoy
runners.comment: The oldest contender and hasn't returned in top form aged eight
runners.spotlight: The oldest contender in this field and hasn't returned in top form aged eight; useful on his day but needs to prove he still retains that level of ability and losing run is mounting up.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm a bit frustrated. I thought Dutch Decoy was the best chance we had in the race. Obviously the winner has come from stall 21, but you need the rub of the green from there and from two and a half to the furlong marker we were all dressed up with nowhere to go. I actually thought my two in front were setting it up perfectly for him because they went a strong gallop. We'll just have to make sure we're back here next year - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: Lettergold Handicap
quotes.quote: Dutch Decoy does prefer quicker ground and I thought when this rain came it might be too much for him, but we have probably got away with it. He ran at Goodwood last year [Golden Mile] and I think he will probably go back there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Handicap
quotes.quote: I feel a bit sorry for Dutch Decoy because he's been banging his head against a brick wall all spring. His time is coming - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap
quotes.quote: Joe Fanning rides Dutch Decoy normally and he just told me to let the old boy do his thing and it paid off - Ben Curtis, jockey.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell
runners.comment: Productive on AW this year; the unknown is whether he can transfer the form back to turf
runners.spotlight: Very productive on AW this year (maiden previously), producing form figures of 1311212; the unknown is whether he can transfer that improvement back to turf; record in this sphere is unconvincing.

runners.name: Cover Up
runners.comment: Useful sprint handicap form in 2024; ran flat in April but shortlisted back over 6f
runners.spotlight: Useful turf handicap form for the Gosdens, including when a never-nearer fifth of 19 to Elmonjed at York (6f, good to firm; later won on soft) in August; made a winning start for this yard in a Listed race at Meydan and although his Musselburgh defeat (5f) in April was disappointing he still makes the shortlist back over 6f.

quotes.race: Ertijaal Dubai Dash Sponsored By Emaar (Listed Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Cover Up likes a fast pace and he got that today; he picked up all the way. I thought it was a good race; Bilhayl and Ponntos set a high standard, so he had to improve, which he did - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Join Century Racing Club Today Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a grand performance. Cover Up is in the sales next week and it's going to be a lot of fun for someone to buy a horse like that. I think they went a bit quick in the ground, he enjoyed it and came to them - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Cover Up showed plenty of gate speed, that's not easy from stall ten from the six-furlong start, but he was plenty quick and that enabled us to be well positioned. We were in the firing lane from there and waiting to pounce. I didn't really have a plan to be honest, but his speed out the gate made up my mind for me. He was quickening all the way to the line, he's a progressive horse - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Orazio
runners.comment: Has been a tease over the years but he's very capable on his day and goes well fresh
runners.spotlight: Has proved a tease over the years but he goes well fresh and a close third in the Wokingham at Ascot (6f, good to firm) last June showed what can be done off this sort of mark on a good day; no surprise to see him return with a strong effort.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We were a little bit concerned about the ground coming into the race, and Orazio probably was just a little bit indecisive on the ground to start with. Then once he passed one horse, he flew home. He is a pretty decent horse and another few strides, he would have won. Delighted with him and there are a good few options now going forwards. He is in the Bunbury Cup at Newmarket, we will have a look at that. There are some nice handicaps going forwards and it would be nice to hopefully end up in Group company at some stage - Charlie Hills, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Handicap
quotes.quote: Orazio was a smart two-year-old until he met with a setback. The plan is to work back from the Wokingham Handicap at Royal Ascot and I think there is a race back here at the Guineas meeting for him - Charlie Hills, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was too firm for him last year when he finished sixth in the Wokingham and if he can get his toe in, it will be perfect. He stumbled coming out of the stalls at Newmarket last time and never got into it, but I always thought he'd be a Group horse and he should be competitive off his rating. 13-06-24

He's very lightly raced and still progressing. We earmarked the Wokingham for him a long way off and thankfully he's gone up enough in the handicap to get in. Thanks to impressive wins at Newmarket off 89 and Ascot off 93, he goes into this week chasing a hat-trick off a mark of 102. I'd be very disappointed if there wasn't more to come from him and if we were lucky enough to get a drop of rain it wouldn't count against him. I hope he'll progress into a Group horse and to win this race off such a rating he'll need to be in that league. This fellow ranks very highly in our team this week. 21-06-23

runners.name: Dream Composer
runners.comment: Suited by 5f; intermittent 6f runs in last 2 years suggest this task will be beyond him
runners.spotlight: Easily forgiven a Chester defeat last week and a comeback second of ten at Pontefract (5f, good) shows this mark is realistic but his intermittent 6f runs in the last two years suggest this task will be beyond him.

quotes.race: Aston Martin "Dash" Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We bought Dream Composer very inexpensively from France three years ago - he'd run as a 2yo there - and he's won for us every year. He keeps stepping up, and obviously this is the icing on the cake, winning one like this. He's won some good races at Grade One tracks; we just felt he was handicapped quite well today, and the cut in the ground helps him. He's pretty good at going up and down dale, because he's won at Goodwood and places like that. We were going along as we found it; he's got an entry in the Wokingham and if a penalty gets him into it and there's cut in the ground, he likes Ascot and has run well there, so that's a possible. But we'll enjoy today and see where it takes us - James Evans, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavani Menswear Sartorial Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the ground was a bit too lively at Royal Ascot. Dream Composer has been travelling much better in his races so the five seems to suit well now. There is the five-furlong handicap on the first day of Glorious Goodwood which is a 0-105 and that was a thought, and obviously the Stewards' Cup would come into consideration as well - James Evans, trainer.

quotes.race: Peroni Nastro Azzurro Handicap
quotes.quote: Dream Composer has great form here and likes this ground, so everything was in our favour. The race went to plan and he keeps galloping. He probably likes 6f more than five, but the ground helped him - you might as well use his stamina over five - Mollie Phillips, rider.

runners.name: Completely Random
runners.comment: Produced a strong finish to impress at Leicester (6f); up 6lb; destined for better
runners.spotlight: Can be slowly away and he nearly made a rod for his own back at Leicester (6f, good) recently when having to be steadied in a pocket 2f out before negotiating an awkward passage to win in good style; up 6lb but looks destined for better.

quotes.race: Carling King Richard III Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We're delighted with that. Completely Random is very progressive, straightforward and is effective over five or six furlongs. We had this race in mind for him after he won at Southwell and the plan is to prepare him for the Wokingham at Royal Ascot - Harry Charlton, trainer.

runners.name: Rosario
runners.comment: 5f looked to be his trip when winning at Goodwood recently; still well treated back up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Stays 6f on the AW but 5f looked to be his trip when he travelled strongly and found plenty to lead inside the final furlong at Goodwood (good; second-time cheekpieces); back up 2lb and should still be well treated but others still preferred over the extra furlong.

runners.name: Elmonjed
runners.comment: Progressive at 6f in blinkers last year; needed his comeback; has more to come this year
runners.spotlight: Progressive winner of two 6f handicaps (both good to firm) in August once blinkered, showing a good attitude to win a warm race at York on the second occasion; no headgear when a respectable fourth on his Newmarket return (good to soft) but he's a major contender with blinkers refitted; has more to come this year.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Constantine Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: The horse is tough since he's had the headgear put on him. Elmonjed was idling without it and needed it to make him concentrate. He hits flat spots in his races and it wouldn't amaze me if he got further one day. It's very much one step at a time with him, but he could be good enough for a bigger prize in time - Angus Gold, racing manager to Shadwell Estates.

quotes.race: AC Plastics Limited EBF Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: It looked like the runner-up had got away from him a bit so Elmonjed did well to win under a penalty and I really liked how he put his head down in the final furlong. He surprised us a little at Lingfield and has really improved from his debut. He was gelded in the summer because he was misbehaving but he's a good-looking horse and progressing with time. He's entered at Chantilly next Saturday and that's a pretty quick turnaround, but we'll talk with Sheikha Hissa and William [Haggas] and make a plan. He's going in the right direction and is a really nice horse - Richard Hills, assistant racing manager for owners Shadwell.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shadwell have another nice horse on their hands. Elmonjed has done well to overcome that greeness early on what is a sharp track - Tom Marquand, jockey speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Purest Time
runners.comment: 3-24 on the continent; off since November and plenty to prove off this mark for new yard
runners.spotlight: Three wins from 24 starts on the continent, most recently when beating a big field for a 6f Deauville handicap (good to soft) last July; sold for 65,000euros and gelded since last seen in November; has questions to answer off this mark for new yard after a break.

runners.name: Indian Run
runners.comment: Group 3 winner as a 2yo; never himself in 2024; promising over 6f for new yard
runners.spotlight: Won Group 3 over 7f (good to firm) as a 2yo but was never himself as a 3yo; has been getting his eye in back over 6f for new yard, coming on for a promising return when briefly dangerous inside the final furlong at Newmarket (6f, good) recently, only to find others coming home more strongly; he may well come on again for yard that's 2-7 here in the last five years.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Acomb Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It's very exciting, I was really happy with Indian Run. He got a bad trip all the way round on the outside and didn't get any cover but he found and found, which is great. He's in the Dewhurst so we'll probably look there. He's so unfurnished he needs time so we'll give him a nice break - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Greatwood Charity 25th Anniversary British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Indian Run is very unfurnished and was quite colty in the paddock, so did pretty much everything wrong before the race, but he did everything right in it. It looked a nice race and Danny said it rode like a nice race. We've thought quite a bit of him for a while and he's not entered in any posh races, but probably will be soon - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made a very promising debut at Newbury last week over 6f. I was very happy with that as he ran on for third place in what was probably a decent novice. I thought he would run well but he should come on nicely for that experience and looks up to winning a maiden sooner rather than later. 11-07-23

runners.name: Run Boy Run
runners.comment: Races prominently; three 7f wins in 2024 but very effective at 6f this year; good shot
runners.spotlight: Races prominently; last three wins over 7f but this trip has also suited this year, on the AW then back on turf at Newmarket (good; closely matched with the second Aramram) 14 days ago; up 2lb to career-high mark; should give it a good shot again.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Run Boy Run made very hard work of it. I wasn't overly keen on his attitude to be honest but I think some headgear will iron that out - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Aramram
runners.comment: Runner-up all 4 starts this year; strong form latest; up 3lb; R Moore up for first time
runners.spotlight: Limited joy from a win perspective this year but he's run some cracking races in defeat and was a shade unfortunate, having got to the front at Newmarket (6f, good) 14 days ago, to get touched off on the line by a smart prospect; raised 3lb but Ryan Moore rides for the first time; solid contender.

stable_tour.quote: I'm delighted with the way he's been running, and although he's due to go up another 3lb for finishing second again, which I think is slightly unfair. He's still a very nice horse for races like the Wokingham and the Stewards' Cup. 22-04-25

runners.name: Dorney Lake
runners.comment: Flourished this year but never looked like getting there at Ascot latest; this is harder
runners.spotlight: Has flourished for new yard, coming from off the pace to win at Yarmouth and Doncaster (both 6f; good and good to firm) but he never looked like getting there when fourth of ten at Ascot last week and these rivals will be harder to overhaul.

runners.name: Kings Lynn

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen
HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: Losing run goes back three years and he's likely to be up against it in this company
runners.spotlight: Had course form earlier in career and he's reunited with Oisin Murphy but his losing run goes back three years and recent efforts suggest this level will be hard work for him.

quotes.race: Cazoo Temple Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: It would be a dream come true if King's Lynn were able to win at Royal Ascot and he's a horse with plenty of ability. He's got a lot of speed and is able to pick up, so a stiff five furlongs at Royal Ascot would be ideal for him - David Probert, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Achilles Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: King's Lynn is just learning how to sprint now. The ground was a little tacky for him and I felt the best ground was over on the inside. It's fresh and hasn't had much racing on so I was keen to get over there. He stuck his head out and it was a good performance. He had a good run at Chester and got a little lost but today was a huge step up in form and I'm delighted with him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Racing Bank £300,000 2-Y-O Stakes
quotes.quote: King's Lynn has got a wonderful temperament. He was in the stalls first and he popped out and got plenty of cover. He travelled well and picked up. He's obviously going the right way, he's still quite raw and I think he'll make a lovely three-year-old. It's hard to judge what figure he's run to but he's run to a fair level. He obviously has a big heart - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: This is a high-class sprinter and we've taken the decision to try to make him into a 5f horse. I think sprinting takes practice and he should get better with experience over the minimum trip. The King's Stand Stakes is a possibility, but he will have to win his next start in order to go there. As a back up we will give him an entry in the Wokingham. 19-05-21

3:10.race_name: Childwickbury Stud Fillies' Trial Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Bintabuha
runners.comment: Opened her account in Class 5 handicap at Wetherby last time; this is harder
runners.spotlight: Opened her account in Class 5 handicap at Wetherby (1m2f) three weeks ago when looking well treated on the pick of her 2yo form; faces a stiffer task upped in class, as her rating reflects.

runners.name: Cecilia Star
runners.comment: The form of her AW success isn't compelling; however, looks open to progress
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in 1m2f AW maiden at Newcastle where she was the sole newcomer in a field of five; the form isn't compelling but she's a Sea The Stars filly who looks open to progress.

runners.name: Ecstatic
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Down the pecking order at Ballydoyle but is useful all the same; leading player on ratings
runners.spotlight: Seems some way down the pecking order at Ballydoyle but is a useful sort all the same, having performed well in Curragh Group 3 on reappearance; soft ground provides an excuse for lesser effort later in April; leading player on ratings.

runners.name: Likealot
runners.comment: Comfortably justified favouritism in winter Chelmsford contest; has potential
runners.spotlight: Carries famous silks that have been associated with some excellent fillies; comfortably justified favouritism in winter Chelmsford contest (1m2f, AW) and has potential; withdrawn from Newmarket Listed race this month due to good to firm ground.

stable_tour.quote: She was pretty impressive on her debut and she's training well. On pedigree, she'll stay well and we'll go for a trial. She's athletic and light on her feet, so we'll try to get her to Epsom on the first Friday in June. 28-04-25

runners.name: Protest
runners.comment: Bit to find on her 1m form but this new trip may enable her to rate higher
runners.spotlight: Ulysses filly who has a bit to find on her 1m form, which comprises a debut success and two Listed efforts; however, gives the impression this new trip may enable her to rate higher.

runners.name: Qilin Queen
runners.comment: Ran well in similar event at Newmarket on reappearance, taking record to 3123; solid
runners.spotlight: Ran well in similar event at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm) two weeks ago on seasonal debut, taking record to 3123; has progressive RPRs and could take another step forward in form terms; solid claims.

quotes.race: Tattersalls £40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Qilin Queen is a nice filly going forward. She made a pleasing debut at Newbury but was quite green that day. It was noticeable how professional she was today and she's a tall, leggy filly who'll strengthen and improve for the year. I've no doubt she'll  train on and make a nice 3yo too - Ross Coakley, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: I'm excited about her and I've entered her in the Oaks. I'll run her in a trial, probably the Pretty Polly - she needs fast ground and that race should suit her. She progressed with every run last year. 16-04-25

runners.name: Revoir
runners.comment: From a family that has served her connections well; duly won her sole 2yo start; promising
runners.spotlight: From a good family that has served her connections well; duly justified favouritism at Nottingham (1m, heavy) in sole 2yo start and looks the type to develop into a useful filly this season; interesting contender.

stable_tour.quote: We're not sure about whether she'll stay on her pedigree, but I'm keen to try her in a trial with the option of going to Epsom. 28-04-25

runners.name: Sand Gazelle
runners.comment: Ties in closely with Qilin Queen on Newmarket reappearance running; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly who belied market weakness at Kempton (7f, AW; won going away) in sole 2yo run; ties in closely with Qilin Queen on Newmarket reappearance form; possibilities with further improvement plausible.

runners.name: Winters Song
runners.comment: Won at Yarmouth then ran well at Sandown; bred to do better still; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Both starts over 1m2f on good ground, winning at Yarmouth then good second under a penalty at Sandown; bred to do better still, being related to two winners at the top level; remains of major interest.

runners.name: Wonder Star
runners.comment: Scored readily at Ascot last week; nicely bred and looks likely to progress further
runners.spotlight: Readily justified favouritism in Ascot maiden (1m2f, good to firm) last week, stepping up plenty on her 2yo effort; nicely bred, being by Sea The Stars out of a Listed scorer, and looks likely to progress further.

1:25.race_name: Highclere Castle Gin Carnarvon Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Andesite
runners.comment: No improvement since 2yo York success and big step forward required to win this
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a dual 5f Group 2 winner for these connections and he began his career with a 6f win at York's Dante meeting this time last year; however, he has not progressed in two runs since and will need a big step forward to emulate stablemate Elite Status who won this race 12 months ago.

stable_tour.quote: He's a high-class horse. He'll have an entry in the Norfolk Stakes as well ? Steve Parkin [owner whose horses run under the Clipper Logistics banner] was keen to put him in, in case it's a weak race ? but for me the Coventry should be the race. His half-sister Dramatised won the Queen Mary there and the track should hold no fears for him. He looks very exciting. 10-06-24

runners.name: Berkshire Whisper
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.comment: 3-4 on AW, latest a valuable Newcastle handicap; a danger to all if handling this surface
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten on the AW since his debut, winning a valuable 6f handicap at Newcastle on Good Friday in clearcut style; looks well worth his place in this higher grade, and with more improvement on the cards he'll be a danger to all if handling the surface on his first turf outing.

quotes.race: BetMGM All-Weather 3 Year Old Championships Handicap
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. Oisin gave Berkshire Whisper a peach of a ride and that was real class. I think he's got a lot to give. He could go for the Commonwealth Cup. He may have one more run just to be sure, we don't want to make ourselves look stupid, then I think we'll be there - Paul Spickett, owner.

runners.name: Caburn
runners.comment: Super Sprint scorer as 2yo; will need a personal best by some way to make winning return
runners.spotlight: Super Sprint winner over 5f here last July; ran well when fifth in the Gimcrack at York (6f) next time before disappointing in sales race at Doncaster on final 2yo start; still low-mileage but he'll need a personal best by some way to make successful reappearance after eight months off.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Super Sprint Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The question mark was dropping back to five furlongs after Caburn won over six on his debut. We were always coming here with the prize-money but, in the first two furlongs, I thought this ain't happening today. To do that on his second start is pretty unreal and the Gimcrack would be an obvious next step. This will be the last time he'll run over five furlongs; onwards and upwards - Jack Jones, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: At home Caburn was showing the right things to be a nice horse but, worryingly, most of the 2yos I've ran so far have ran averagely but I thought he was above them so it was nice to see him put it in on the track. This was a half bit of a stepping stone to the Super Sprint and so far the first leg has gone remarkably well - Jack Jones, trainer, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Defence Minister
runners.comment: Failed to get home in soft-ground Middle Park but 2-2 previously; remains unexposed
runners.spotlight: Took a good hold and failed to get home in soft-ground Middle Park on last 2yo outing, but he was 2-2 previously and probably still has more to offer; interesting back down in class and returned to faster conditions.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Britain's Biggest Independent Bookmaker EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Defence Minister is a nice horse who has shown some nice ability in the mornings. It was not easy to say he was going to win first time out as this was a nice education day for him, and hopefully his next race will show what he can really do. He was slowly away, but Saffie [Osborne] gave him all the time he needed to catch up and we've beaten the second favourite today which is good. It's not easy to put him in a novice race, but next but we'll give him plenty of time and it could be that we go seven furlongs with him next time - Hamad Al Jehani, trainer.

runners.name: Ides Of March
runners.comment: Form pick; second to stablemate at Navan on reappearance; should again play leading role
runners.spotlight: The pick of these on the form of his Curragh win last August and his good second to stablemate Whistlejacket in Listed race at Navan on reappearance; both those runs were over this trip, and with his stable going great guns he again seems likely to play a leading role.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Committed Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: You would have to be delighted with Ides Of March too. I thought the ground was way too soft for him, he's a very good mover and is way better on fast ground. He's a good traveller, a high cruiser and doesn't lie down easily - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Heider Family Stables Round Tower Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Ides Of March is powerful, fast horse. He finds it very easy to go quick. He travelled very easy through the race and he ran straight today. He looks like a Middle Park horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Revamp Conservation And Restoration Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Ides Of March could be a group sprinter. He's big, powerful and he's fast. He could go for the Middle Park and maybe have a run before that - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a Group 3 winner over six furlongs at the Curragh last season and he's on the Commonwealth Cup programme. He could have a run in one or two races beforehand and we'll take it from there. 07-04-25

runners.name: Noble Champion
runners.breeder: Thomas Foy & Lope De Vega Syndicate
runners.comment: Seemed not to stay 1m last time; improvement needed but this drop in trip may well suit
runners.spotlight: Won by clear daylight at Lingfield (7f, AW) last autumn and ran pretty well in the Group 3 Greenham here on reappearance; gave the impression he failed to stay 1m when third in conditions race at Goodwood since; improvement required but today's drop in trip could be a catalyst for just that.

stable_tour.quote: You can always forgive a horse a disappointing debut and he got it all right when an impressive winner at Lingfield next time. He probably needed the race in the Greenham and being on the far side disadvantaged him. He'll improve a lot for that and could go for the King Charles II Stakes. We're still very excited about him. He's fast and whether he'll truly stay 1m I'm not sure. 16-04-25

runners.name: Righthere Rightnow
runners.comment: Twice last since impressive debut win; still early days but he now has something to prove
runners.spotlight: Impressive in newcomers' race at Newmarket (7f, good) last summer but the wheels have come off since and he was last of six in a novice at the Craven meeting; still early days but he now has something to prove.

quotes.race: Maritime Cargo Services Road Haulage Hustle EBF Newcomers Maiden Stakes (Have Never Run) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Righthere Rightnow's homework has been good and we were wanting to get him out at a nice track. He's done it nicely and is going to be a lovely horse next year. He'll probably benefit from a little easier ground but his class has got him through today. He's in the Champagne [at Doncaster] and in a few sales races and we'll see how he comes out of it but he's a very nice horse to look forward to for next season - Richard Spencer, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Strong Warrior
runners.comment: Unbeaten after Ayr/Pontefract wins; plenty to find on bare form but he's clearly promising
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns at the breeze-ups last May and arrives here unbeaten after wins in maiden at Ayr (5f, good) last July and novice at Pontefract (6f, good; made all) in April; plenty to find on bare form but he's clearly promising.

quotes.race: Thank You Richard Hammill Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior probably would have needed that today. He's obviously going to come on from it and he wasn't doing an awful lost in the last furlong - he had his ears pricked - but we do think he's a nice horse - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior ran green in the first two furlongs, but once I asked him he's picked up really well and won like a nice horse in the making. He does know a bit but it was his first run, he'll come on for it too and there's plenty to look forward to. I've had a couple of bits of work with him and he's always shown plenty. He's fairly laid-back and won't have harm going over further, but he has the speed. He's definitely one of the nicer ones we have, for sure - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Symbol Of Honour
runners.comment: 7f against him last time and 6f record is 3-4; doesn't have much to find on the figures
runners.spotlight: Came up short in 7f Listed event at Newmarket two weeks ago but prior to that he'd justified favouritism in two contests at Meydan, taking his 6f record to 3-4; doesn't have much to find on the figures.

quotes.race: Al Wasl Stakes Sponsored By DP World (Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Symbol Of Honour had to dig really deep. I think he probably needed the race after a bit of a layoff but I really liked that when he got headed he battled back gamely. The five and six furlong races here, when they meet the intersection and the straight course, the race really starts and we just got caught a little flat-footed there. I think he's more a horse for six-seven furlongs, he's not a horse to drop down in distance - William Buick, jockey.

runners.name: Hold A Dream
runners.comment: Upwardly mobile type; beaten neck on return and unlikely to have reached ceiling just yet
runners.spotlight: Upwardly mobile type who won novice at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) last autumn and ran a cracker when beaten neck in Listed event at Chelmsford on reappearance; unlikely to have reached her ceiling just yet.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very nice filly who won at Yarmouth last September. She's done well over the winter and is working well, although, as I've mentioned, the fillies have taken a while to come to hand. I hope she can build on that win last autumn. 17-04-25

runners.name: Sayidah Dariyan
runners.comment: Ready winner of valuable conditions event at Chelmsford; commands major respect
runners.spotlight: Had Andesite well held in fourth when readily winning valuable conditions event at Chelmsford (6f, AW) four weeks ago; shaped well on only turf outing on debut; still unexposed and commands major respect.

quotes.race: bet365 Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wouldn't normally take on horses rated 110 when you're 92 but Sayidah Dariyan was working really well at home. She could come back here in two weeks [Chelmer Fillies' Stakes], but I wouldn't be mad about that, or go for the Carnarvon which would be spot on - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We really fancied her at Windsor at the start of the month, but she stumbled over every one of those ridges and it was hard to get her on an even keel. I backed her up just over a week later because it was the ideal race over 6f at Lingfield on the all-weather. I didn't think she'd win like she did and she's gone up in her estimation at home. We might go to Dundalk on October 4 for a Listed race over 5f. 18-09-24

runners.name: Dantes Lad
runners.comment: Fifth of eight at Newmarket after a break; that was competitive but so is this
runners.spotlight: Gelded after his successful stable debut at Kempton during the winter (1m handicap; 5lb lower) and was returning from a break when fifth of the eight runners at Newmarket (1m, good); that was a competitive race but so is this.

stable_tour.quote: He made a good start for us by winning in November and stayed the mile well. I think he'll want fast ground and a strong pace to run at, and we'll work back from a race like the Britannia possibly. 07-04-25

runners.name: Roman Centurion
runners.comment: Justified some market confidence when flooring the Wood Ditton runner-up at Yarmouth
runners.spotlight: Appeared to justify some market confidence when flooring the Wood Ditton runner-up at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) and this mark might be workable on handicap debut; Silvestre De Sousa is a positive booking.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Yarmouth is always a tough place to come because the big boys bring their best horses here. We backed Roman Centurion from 20s down to 8s at one point so we fancied him - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Nakeeb
runners.comment: Doncaster winner; going the right way and has plenty of potential to raise current mark
runners.spotlight: 230,000gns yearling; made his debut at 1m and last two runs over 7f, last time at Doncaster (good to firm) sent off long odds-on and beating an improver with the pair well clear; going the right way and has plenty of potential to raise current mark.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a super race when second at Newmarket last week against a winner who looked out of the ordinary. Jim Crowley was very pleased with him. That was only his second run, so he'll improve for that. We'll choose a novice for him and I'd be disappointed if he didn't win. He's got a lot of ability and he might be a Britannia type or one for the bigger handicaps later in the season. 22-04-25

runners.name: Regalian
runners.comment: First and third in novices; now gelded and open to considerable improvement
runners.spotlight: Has looked green in both his AW races, winning at Newcastle (7f) and then close up under his penalty at Southwell (1m); the winner of the latter race was disappointing behind Rogue Diplomat next time, but this Kingman colt is open to considerable improvement and has been gelded.

runners.name: Rogue Diplomat
runners.comment: Looked nice at Leicester and didn't appear overly at home on Newmarket undulations
runners.spotlight: Did it well in a Leicester novice (7f, good to firm) but was never that threatening when sent off favourite for handicap debut at Newmarket (good); might not have handled the track that day and there's probably more to come.

quotes.race: Best Ticket Deals Online At leicester-racecourse.co.uk Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Rogue Diplomat and he's shown so much at home. We tried him over too far at Chelmsford last year and we're delighted to see him win. He's a different horse this year. James is such a good trainer and has done a great job with him - Tony Elliott, founder of the Rogues Gallery, owners.

runners.name: Shameful
runners.comment: Pleasing start to his career; gelded since last run; unexposed now entering handicaps
runners.spotlight: Similar profile to Regalian in that he's well bred and now gelded, having won on debut (here over 6f) and then placed under a penalty (7f, AW); dangerously unexposed now entering handicaps.

stable_tour.quote: He won his only start at Newbury last year and we thought enough of him to give him a 2,000 Guineas entry. That was always a bit of a pipe-dream and, after he was beaten at Kempton on his return this year, we had him gelded as he was getting heavy. However, he still excites me with his whole physical build and we'll be talking about plenty more nice races for him in the future. I'm looking forward to some rain for him. 17-04-25

runners.name: Gilet
runners.comment: Consistent at two; left the impression that his Newmarket return was needed
runners.spotlight: Consistent last season when a 6f maiden winner and a four-time runner-up (6f/7f); left the impression that his Newmarket return was needed (7f handicap, good) and he should stay this far.

runners.name: Hyperchromatic
runners.comment: Won twice at two; latest effort was encouraging and he looks ready for this return to 1m
runners.spotlight: Novice/nursery winner at two; seemed to need his comeback race and then stuck on nicely for second over Beverley's extended 7f (good); looks ready for this return to 1m (second attempt).

runners.name: Hot Cash
runners.comment: Held a Derby entry when a weakening seventh on handicap debut at Sandown
runners.spotlight: 7f maiden winner last year and then highly tried; held a Derby entry when a weakening seventh on handicap debut at Sandown (1m2f, good) and this trip might be a better fit right now; not entirely dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: I'm delighted with him and we've taken a very speculative punt and stuck him in the Derby. He had only two runs last year, ­winning his maiden at Epsom and then finishing fourth in a Group 3 at Deauville in August. He went for another novice at ­Wolverhampton last week because he wasn't qualified for a handicap mark and was third. We might look at a Derby trial for him. If he cuts it at that level then brilliant, but if not we'll take stock and ­rebuild him, but we're very ­excited about him and he's been training really well. 02-04-25

runners.name: Solar Army
runners.comment: Best form yet when second at Newmarket; should stay 1m and Ryan Moore rides
runners.spotlight: Gelded ahead of getting off the mark at the seventh attempt in a 7f handicap at Kempton and probably better again when second at Newmarket (7f, good), where Gilet and Rogue Diplomat were further back; 1m won't be an issue on pedigree and Ryan Moore takes over.

runners.name: Well Enough
runners.comment: March AW win looks dodgy form; offered little on stable debut when upped to 1m at Haydock
runners.spotlight: Winner of a Southwell 7f handicap but that was a messy race and looks dodgy form; offered little on stable debut when upped to 1m at Haydock.

runners.name: Happy Banner
runners.comment: 2yo winner; weak in the betting when beaten about 6l in a Newmarket handicap
runners.spotlight: Progressed to win his final start as a 2yo (7f AW) and then gelded; couldn't land a blow upped to 1m for his handicap debut at Newmarket (good) but he was weak in the market and didn't run badly; remains of interest.

runners.name: General Admission
runners.comment: Has races in him off this mark and 1m2f appeared a stretch on handicap debut at Newmarket
runners.spotlight: No wins in five but he was close up behind Regalian at Southwell in March and looked threatening to a point when 7-1 for his handicap debut over 1m2f at Newmarket; didn't appear to get home and he's now back in trip with a visor added; each-way claims.

runners.name: Gold Cup Day
runners.comment: Impressive at Salisbury on second start and should continue to progress; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Hinted at promise on last month's debut at Newbury (1m3f, good) and won easily at Salisbury (1m4f, good to firm) a fortnight ago; from a classy family and should continue to progress; leading claims under 6lb penalty.

runners.name: Middle Ages
runners.comment: Won at 1-4 on reappearance; this 250,000gns yearling could have lots more left in the tank
runners.spotlight: One run last year and showed improved form to win at 1-4 on last month's return at Ripon (1m4f, good); needs another step forward to defy a penalty today but this 250,000gns yearling could have lots more left in the tank.

runners.name: Bahadur
runners.owner: J William Rowley & S P C Woods
runners.comment: Half-brother to 6 winners but well beaten at 66-1 on last month's debut here (1m2f, good)
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to six winners but well beaten at 66-1 on last month's debut here (1m2f, good) and is probably best watched for now.

runners.name: Dangerman
runners.comment: 210,000gns yearling; promise on second run; in excellent hands to continue to improve
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at 16-1 on debut at Newbury (1m2f, good) last month but showed promise when second of three at Doncaster (1m2f, good) a fortnight ago; this 210,000gns yearling is in excellent hands to continue to improve and could have a part to play.

runners.name: Minhad
runners.comment: Has shown a good level of ability on both starts but needs something extra today
runners.spotlight: Promising third on debut at Yarmouth (1m2f, good) last month and another good run when fifth of seven at Haydock (11.6f, good); however, he needs something extra if he's to get off the mark today.

runners.name: Pole Star
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Did very well to finish fourth on recent debut at Chester; big player if building on that
runners.spotlight: Inexperience evident when 20-1 on last Friday's debut at Chester (1m4f, good) and he did very well to finish a 2l fourth of six against rivals who had already shown considerable ability; big player if building on that.

2:50.race_name: Tattersalls £40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Dance To The Music
runners.comment: Sister to Space Blues who was top-class for these connections; major player on debut
runners.spotlight: Newcomer by Dubawi; 11th foal; sister to top connections' 6.5f-1m winner Space Blues (including 2yo and Group 1/Grade 1), half-sister to four winners notably Shuruq (7f-9.5f including 2yo and UAE AW Group 2); dam 6f/7f winner (including 2yo/Group 2); stable won this last year; major player.

quotes.race: Tattersalls £40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dance To The Music was still a little green but did it well in the end. I haven't spoken to Charlie [Appleby, trainer] but I'd imagine she would go for another novice after that - Alex Merriam, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Daretobedifferent
runners.comment: 22,000gns yearling; half-sister to five winners but others may have greater potential
runners.spotlight: 22,000gns yearling; tenth foal; Starman half-sister to five winners including Galinea (French 6.5f-1m 2yo; RPR 92), Tea Dance (French Listed-placed 6f 2yo; 84) and St Ives (6f 2yo; 79); dam French Group-placed 5f 2yo winner (93); could have a future but others may have greater potential.

runners.name: Eskimo Pie
runners.comment: Has a precocious pedigree and this Kodi Bear newcomer could give a good account
runners.spotlight: 75,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 87), half-sister to two winners out of 6f 2yo winner; has a precocious pedigree and this Kodi Bear newcomer could give a good account.

runners.name: Lyrics Of Life
runners.comment: Attractive pedigree; likely to improve for this debut but no surprise to see a good run
runners.spotlight: 65,000gns yearling; 12th foal; Pinatubo close-relation to 1m AW winner Lovely Memory (RPR 95), half-sister to four winners including Folk Melody (7f 2yo; 93); dam 1m2f-1m4f winner (including Canadian Grade 1); likely to improve for this debut outing but no surprise to see a good run.

runners.name: Midnight Tango
runners.comment: Connections have done very well with her family; likely to improve for this first run
runners.spotlight: Second foal; Night Of Thunder half-sister to 1m 2yo winner Fernando (RPR 73); dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (103), half-sister to 5f Group 1 winner Makarova; connections have done very well with her family and her trainer is in good form, but his 2yos frequently need their first runs.

runners.name: Moo Deng
runners.comment: £68,000 yearling; potential in her pedigree and good trainer can ready one first time
runners.spotlight: £68,000 yearling; sixth foal; Ardad close-relation to 1m winner Playupskyblues (including 2yo; RPR 78), half-sister to three winners including Notre Belle Bete (1m-1m2f AW; 111) and Angiolleta (US stakes-placed 1m turf 2yo; 98); good trainer can ready one first time up; could go well.

1:05.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.name: Persuasion
runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh last month; couldn't get into it at Chester last week but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won at Musselburgh (7f, good to soft) last month; this 8yo couldn't get into it off this revised mark at Chester last week, but he's effective here (third in this in 2023 on good) and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Silver Arrow Handicap
quotes.quote: We had the perfect trip, a good draw and a nice position. Persuasion went well throughout the race and toughed it out all the way to the line. He's been a consistent horse in defeat and he'd won off this mark at Haydock last year and we were fairly hopeful -  Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He really pleased me on his only start this season when beating stablemate Dulas at Haydock over seven furlongs. The form of that race is working out well and on a new mark of 96 he should have a nice weight in the Buckingham Palace. I'd like to think he has a very good chance. - 10-06-21

runners.name: Dark Tornado
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who won recent Leicester maiden; needs bigger performance off lofty mark
runners.spotlight: Glimpses of considerable promise during light campaigns in 2023 and 2024, and this lightly raced 4yo won a maiden at Leicester (7f, good to firm) last Saturday on his second stable start; however, he now goes handicapping off a lofty mark and will need a bigger performance today.

runners.name: Sterling Knight
runners.comment: Looked a big threat 1f out over 1m here a fortnight ago; respected back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Faded into 3l fourth over 1m here (good) a fortnight ago, having looked a major threat 1f out; the drop back in trip could be ideal and he's respected off the same mark.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We played the same cards as last time here and although the ground is a bit softer today, Sterling Knight has absolutely thrived on it. I started to make a move at the three pole and the only place to go was the inside. Luckily, he had plenty in the tank to get through the gaps. When he hit the front he idled and waited for something to come upsides him again. He's done it well -- Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey.

quotes.race: Hascombe & Valiant Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Sterling Knight is tough and durable and was entitled to run his race. It was a good performance at Windsor and he was going up 7lb, so we ran him with the penalty and 3lb off with Rhys, but he's definitely improving. He's strengthening and the handicapper can stop anything, but we hope this isn't the end of him. He's won over seven on the all-weather, but we just felt he wasn't seeing it out and he has a load of toe, so a stiff six here has really suited him. There's a good programme for three-year-old sprint handicappers and he'll have to follow it - Robin Trevor-Jones, travelling head lad.

stable_tour.quote: He's won ten times for us. We gave him a bit of a winter campaign and he ran very well twice and then we ran him in a decent race at Lingfield on Good Friday - he got a terrible draw, got stuck out the back and didn't like that. We'll now go back to turf racing more than likely. He likes some cut in the ground and is the type to pop up and win a decent handicap somewhere. 30-04-25

runners.name: Waleefy
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite at Goodwood on reappearance but retains potential for top yard
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite at Goodwood on reappearance but perhaps the track and the drop back to 6f were against him; progressive in handicaps last season and this lightly raced 4yo could still have more to offer for a top trainer who has won two of the last four runnings of this race.

quotes.race: Unison Campaigning For Public Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Waleefy is maturing throughout the campaign. He seems to be improving all the time and things went right for him, even if the ground was a little quick. Going up to a mile should suit and he's exciting - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Aston Martin Handicap
quotes.quote: Waleefy is not as talented as his relatives but he was a late foal and is only just beginning to fill his frame. Coming back to six furlongs was a gamble and they went no pace, which didn't help, but he got there in the end. Jim Crowley said the ground was quick enough for him but to stick to this trip for now -Angus Gold, Shadwell racing manager.

runners.name: Vicario
runners.comment: Reappears with her yard going well and could get back on track with a good performance
runners.spotlight: Down the field in Listed races on final two outings last season but progressive in handicaps previously and she reappears with her yard going well; could get back on track with a good performance.

stable_tour.quote: She was an underachiever last year but is in great nick and I have big hopes for her this season. She ran in a Listed race on her final start of 2024 and she'll probably start back in that company. She's run well at 6f but I think 7f will be her bag. 16-04-25

runners.name: Physique
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D a fortnight ago and could be bang there once more
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth of 19 on stable/seasonal debut at Doncaster (6f, good) in March and bounced back from lesser run here to finish second over this C&D (good) a fortnight ago; could be bang there once more.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Ahonoora Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Physique is a horse who likes to get on with things and there is only one way to ride him. He can get quite wound up if you try to hold him back. Seamie knows him and knew what to do after riding him the last couple of times - Micky Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Harvard Sound
runners.comment: No impact in AW handicaps the last twice but 2-2 on turf and has first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: 2-2 on turf having won maiden/novice races at Lingfield (7f, good to firm) last summer; good third on handicap debut at Southwell (7f, AW) in October; two lesser runs have followed and he needs to raise his game, but perhaps the return to turf and first-time cheekpieces will help

stable_tour.quote: He's by Ten Sovereigns and I feel they're at their best on top of the ground. He didn't hold his form in a few runs during the winter, having won a novice under a penalty last year. He's done well through the winter and done some good work. I still believe he could be a nice horse and I just think he wants top of the ground. He's entered at York on Friday. 14-05-25

runners.name: Madame De Sevigne
runners.comment: Well beaten on reappearance but may have needed it; this C&D winner is not written off
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on reappearance at Doncaster in May but may have needed the run; won twice during a progressive campaign last season (good to firm/good to soft; including C&D) and she's not written off.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a nice race to win and Oisin said this would be Madame Sevigne's best trip when he rode her first time this year. I think we'll put her away for the year - Robert Eddery, trainer.

runners.name: Leadman
runners.comment: Second on recent stable/seasonal debut and every chance he'll again be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Yet to cross the line in front (last August's win came when promoted due to a technicality) but this lightly raced 5yo is very consistent and finished second on his recent stable and seasonal debut at Newcastle (7f, AW); there's every chance he'll again be thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: New to us from Andrew Balding's, we bought him as a maiden and haven't run him, but he's still won a race since. It was a disqualification, so he's no longer a maiden. He's got ability but might have a soft temperament. 14-04-25

runners.name: Mythical Guest
runners.comment: Both wins over 1m2f (one here) but in good form at 1m this spring and could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 1m2f, the latest here last May, but he's been placed over 1m on his two outings this season and could be in the mix.

runners.name: Helm Rock
runners.comment: Without a win on grass since 2022 but ran well in the Spring Mile and not ruled out e-w
runners.spotlight: More reliable on AW than turf and without a win on grass since September 2022; however, he ran well when sixth of 21 in the Spring Mile at Doncaster in March and he's not ruled out each-way.

quotes.race: Unibet London Mile Series Final Handicap (Series Final - Qualified horses Only)
quotes.quote: It's a great result. We only ran in the Racing League because the race looked winnable. The plan had been to come here and we did think the races were a bit close together, but Helm Rock has won 70,000GBP in ten days. He's won seven now and was the most expensive yearling we've ever bought, but he's paid it back. It's taken time but he's matured mentally and every year he's come back a bit better - Daniel Kubler - co-trainer.

quotes.race: J W Lees MPA Handicap
quotes.quote: Helm Rock just loves the soft ground and it's been tricky to find it this year. He handles the all-weather but you see the best of him in the mud; he's a true Pivotal - Claire Kubler, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Wreay Handicap
quotes.quote: We debated the trip a bit for Helm Rock but he ran over a mile three times and didn't quite get it. He loved the ground and we'll see what options there are for him-Claire Kubler, joint trainer

stable_tour.quote: It looks like he's better on the all-weather all of a sudden. He's good on turf, but took off on the all-weather and ideally we'd like to get him back to Kempton for the series final he won last year. He's on a break and is one for the second half of the campaign. 02-05-24

runners.name: Classic Encounter
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo for whom things have clicked again this season; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo for whom things clicked again with a reappearance win at Redcar (1m, good) last month; backed that up with a good second of 14 over this C&D (good) and he's a strong contender.

runners.name: Good Morning Alex
runners.comment: Dead-heated for first at Ripon last time; this prominent-racer can make another bold bid
