runners.spotlight: Six wins between December 2023 and last June, and he was back on song when dead-heating for first at Ripon (1m, good) three weeks ago; just 2lb higher today and this prominent-racer can make another bold bid.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Global Stallions Handicap
quotes.quote: We were up 11lb in a better grade on totally different ground so we went with an open mind again and Good Morning Alex has done it well. He's been a real surprise package from going to the all-weather in December thinking it was a last-chance saloon. He's just grown up and matured. In fairness, he was a late foal but he's improved out of all recognition. Connor [Beasley, jockey] said he wouldn't want the ground any faster than it was today so I think a lot will depend on the weather as to where we go. This was very much the target - Nicola Barron, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Wheres Freddy
runners.comment: Effective here and good second on AW in March last time; he's one to consider
runners.spotlight: Two 7f wins on the other Newmarket course and close second here (7f, good to firm) last September; in good form on AW earlier this year, finishing second at Chelmsford (1m, AW) in March last time; he's one to consider.

runners.name: Redhot Whisper
runners.comment: Well handicapped on peak form but below par this year and now 0-11; others more compelling
runners.spotlight: Creditable third at Epsom last June on sole handicap start and now 10lb lower; often placed but wasn't at his best in two AW maidens this February and is now 0-11; his claims aren't overly compelling.

runners.name: Royal Velvet
runners.comment: Reappeared with creditable fourth at Yarmouth; likes it there but she's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Three handicap wins last April-July; her progress stalled subsequently and her best turf form has come at Yarmouth, where she reappeared with a creditable fourth (1m, good to firm) 16 days ago; however, she ran okay on her sole previous visit here and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Bet £5 Get £20 At tote.co.uk Racing League Race 3 Handicap (Trainers Registered To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Royal Velvet has won really well there today. I did think the flat track and the easy mile really suits her and she likes that ground. She was quite backward last year and she's just really coming to herself. I think she could be quite useful - William Knight, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: City Of York
runners.comment: 0-10 last year and well beaten on reappearance, but not discounted off a handy mark
runners.spotlight: 0-10 last year and well beaten on last month's reappearance at Chelmsford; however, he may have needed that run and is well handicapped on form as recent as last September; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run. He enjoys a bit of juice in the ground and we've kept him on the all-weather. He's a really hard ride but he's more than capable. He should have a good autumn now. 04-09-24

4:35.race_name: Suffolk Chamber Of Commerce And USVF Handicap

runners.name: Northcliff

prev_owners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor

runners.comment: Completed hat-trick at Ascot last week (stable debut); contender despite a 4lb rise
runners.spotlight: In good form last May and he's back in top form now, winning at Wetherby and Brighton last month and completing his hat-trick at Ascot last week on his first run for a new yard (now 3-3 in a visor); 4lb rise to defy but hard to discount in current form.

runners.name: Aberama Gold
runners.comment: Losing run stands at 22 but effective over C&D and on a competitive mark; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Losing run stands at 22 but he retains ability and this is much less demanding than the C&D handicap he contested at the Guineas meeting; slower ground preferable but still holds each-way claims off this mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Farewell Flat Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold seems to enjoy those conditions and we're lucky to have got him really. He ended up in Goodwood on this sort of ground, he won at York before that on better ground, but these are his sort of conditions by the looks of it. I don't know if we'll run him again this year. I'm not sure he's up to Listed class. He's a very good sprint handicapper and he's had a great year. I can't imagine he's going into next year well handicapped, but on these conditions, if you handle them it's probably worth a stone. We'll probably look for valuable sprint handicaps on bottomless ground - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Owner Evan Sutherland said Aberama Gold would handle the ground better than most and he was right. It was very straightforward, he travelled well, the last half a furlong felt like a long way but the loose horse might have been a help. I have inherited a very good horse off Keith Dalgleish. It is his third start for me now, I can't take a great deal of credit for him. The Ayr Gold Cup will be a good target and between now and then I am not certain as there is a bit of time. He is not just a mudlark but he probably wouldn't want it rattling fast - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: That was very nice. We've not really done anything with Aberama Gold since he arrived. He ran at Ayr very quickly after coming from Keith's and even now I hardly know the horse yet. He's in the Stewards' Cup next Saturday and if he gets in, why not run? - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold keeps improving and who knows when we will get to the bottom of him. He doesn't do a whole lot when he gets there but he's a nice horse. I always thought a bit of him and he probably just went a bit weak between two and three. He's versatile with ground and track - Shane Gray, jockey.

quotes.race: Shadwell Stallions Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We had been disappointed with Aberama Gold but giving him time and a strong pace at six furlongs has paid off - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great year in 2023, but not so much last year. He runs himself in and out of form and hopefully this is an 'in' year. If it is, he's well handicapped. He likes dig in the ground and won the Stewards' Cup two years ago on almost unraceable ground. 14-04-25

runners.name: Batal Dubai
runners.comment: Chance on this winter's AW best but quiet the last twice and needs new visor to revive him
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f AW handicap at Lingfield on New Year's Eve; also ran well at Southwell in February but his last two efforts have been disappointing; lightly raced on turf but fully effective on fast ground; new visor needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I needed some luck, but I was on a really capable animal. It was a good bit of placing by Harry and Roger because Batal Dubai was in great form and improved from Windsor. I thought with a bit of luck we'd win the whole way. He went to the start sweetly and I didn't have to fight him at any stage. He's a horse with a future and the weight-for-age isn't massive, but it has helped him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Kiwano
runners.comment: Talented but a major query over his current form; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Quiet in Bahrain over the winter and fared no better back in Britain when a remote last of seven at Goodwood two weeks ago; has lots of ability, on a lowly mark, tongue-tie returns and stable amongst the winners but, even so, he's not a solid option.

runners.name: Imperial Guard
runners.comment: Best RPR came over C&D; promising third latest on second run for M Dods; one to consider
runners.spotlight: His best effort for Andrew Balding came when second over C&D last September; two runs for new stable, building on his reappearance effort when third at Thirsk two weeks ago (6f, good); one to consider off same mark.

runners.name: Fiscal Policy
runners.owner: S Thompson, Mrs R Carr & G Shields

prev_owners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr

runners.comment: 5-11 since joining Ruth Carr; should continue to give a good account
runners.spotlight: Four 6f wins last year and made winning return to action when seeing off five rivals at Chelmsford 16 days ago (6f); this looks a deeper race but he's only 1lb higher and Kaiya Fraser takes off a useful 3lb; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He's another to have had a winter's break and he's not quite ready to come back yet - he's about a month away. He won't find things so easy when he returns because he's only 1lb below his highest ever mark, but that's the price of success because he won two races in the autumn. He's a straightforward sprinter, though, and always gives his best. 09-04-25

runners.name: Eminency
runners.comment: Yet to shine in two runs after a wind op; new headgear today; should be well treated
runners.spotlight: 8lb lower than when just missing out at Goodwood last June (6f, good); had wind surgery prior to his reappearance but he hasn't sparkled in either start this spring; blinkers replace visor; should be well treated but a strike-rate of 1-20 tempers enthusiasm.

stable_tour.quote: He's always been a laid-back character and I'm really pleased with how he's done over the winter. He had nowhere to go on his comeback at Kempton and hopefully he can move forward from that run and have better luck next time. He wouldn't want it too soft, is versatile at six or seven furlongs and I hope he can keep progressing. 02-05-23

He has only won the once but he has run consistently well in defeat apart from last time at Newmarket where he got a bit behind the pace and that cost him any chance. His penultimate run behind Quinault at York reads well and I'm looking at going back to the July course if conditions are in his favour and it dries out as he is not far off winning again. He may even run in the Stewards' Cup on Saturday. 02-08-23

runners.name: Rebel Path
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Two 6f wins at Chelmsford this winter; finished behind reopposing rivals on last two runs
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins at Chelmsford this winter and not far behind Fiscal Policy at that track 16 days ago; finished further behind Northcliff at Ascot last week though and others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.name: Royal Musketeer
runners.comment: An 11-week break looks a positive and his Newmarket record dictates he needs a close look
runners.spotlight: Goes well fresh so an 11-week absence since a quiet run at Southwell no bad thing; only 2lb higher than for a ready 6f AW win in January and ran well on the July course on the only other occasion Ray Dawson has ridden him; record on both Newmarket tracks reads 532123; one to take seriously.

4:00.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM Golden Goals Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Qual') (GBBPlus)

runners.name: White Chapel Road
runners.comment: Could improve for last month's reappearance run here and he's not ruled out now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Fast-ground 7f maiden winner who was soundly beaten on last month's reappearance here (7f, good), but may have needed the run; kept on well when third of five in Epsom nursery (7f, heavy) last September, which provides a bit of hope this trip might be within range; not ruled out.

runners.name: Venezuelan
runners.comment: Has shown promise over 1m on AW; this handicap newcomer is in good hands to progress
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Lingfield (1m, AW) last November on second start and another good run when fourth at Southwell (1m, AW) on reappearance; in good hands to progress and he's one to consider now up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Bryant
runners.breeder: Etreham Riviera Eq Girod De L'Ain Grivel
runners.comment: Could do with settling better but he has a fair opening mark and is not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Head runner-up when odds-on at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) in February on second start and fair third at Newbury (1m3f, good) last month in first-time blinkers (retained); he could do with settling better but has a fair opening mark and is not ruled out.

runners.name: Mighty Boy
runners.comment: Creditable fourth on handicap debut at Sandown and the third has won since; chance
runners.spotlight: Improved form when upped in trip and fourth on handicap debut at Sandown (1m2f, good) three weeks ago, and the third has won since; chance.

runners.name: Chesneys Charm
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.comment: Runner-up over 1m1f at Musselburgh then faded over 1m4f at Chester; not discounted at 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Three 7f AW wins last year and good second when upped to 1m1f at Musselburgh (good) last month; faded when tackling 1m4f at Chester last week and he's not discounted now back down in distance.

runners.name: Kentucky River
runners.comment: Camelot half-brother to Melbourne Cup winner who could relish this handicap debut trip
runners.spotlight: Encouraging fourth at Kempton (1m3f, AW) in December on second start; well beaten at 33-1 on last month's reappearance at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) but this Camelot half-brother to Melbourne Cup winner Protectionist could be an entirely different proposition now back up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Best Adventure
runners.comment: Stayed on well for 4th over 8.5f at Epsom; the step up in trip could be just what he needs
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but consistent and stayed on well when fourth of 13 at Epsom (8.5f, good) last month; this step up in trip could be just what he needs.

runners.name: String Of Pearls
runners.comment: The type Sir Mark Prescott excels with; could be a big improver up in trip on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability last autumn among her first three starts (7f-8.6f, AW) and, while she's not obviously well treated for this handicap debut, her pedigree firmly indicates she'll be suited by the step up in trip; the type Sir Mark Prescott excels with and she could be a big improver.

runners.name: Squires Treaty
runners.comment: 0-10 but third over 1m2f at Yarmouth last month and he's an each-way possible
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but runner-up in two 1m AW handicaps in January and returned to form when upped in trip and third at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm) last month; each-way possible.

runners.name: We Dare To Dream
runners.comment: Pulled clear with runner-up when scoring at Beverley 12 days ago; respected up 6lb
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 221221 and he pulled 5l clear with the runner-up when landing a Beverley handicap (7.4f, good to firm) 12 days ago; up 6lb but he still looks feasibly treated and is open to more progress back in trip; respected.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who got off the mark at the third time of asking at Haydock over seven and then ran really well at Doncaster. He looks like he's taken a step forward and there's absolutely no reason why he can't progress. He's very straightforward and likeable. 14-04-25

runners.name: Fondo Blanco
runners.comment: Progressive form in his three runs and he looks interesting upped to 7f on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Cost 260,000gns as a yearling and is out of a Group placed 7f winner; landed the odds at York (6f, soft) in the second of his two 2yo runs and he went close in a Doncaster novice (6f, good to firm) on his return last month; this step up in trip should suit on handicap debut and he's an interesting contender off what looks a fair opening mark.

stable_tour.quote: He's done nothing wrong in his two starts. I think he's a nice horse and he could run in the seven-furlong conditions race at the Craven meeting or a novice soon after. How he runs on his first start will tell us where we should be shooting. His win at York was on soft ground but I think he'll be better on better ground. 11-04-25

runners.name: Original Outlaw
runners.comment: Flopped in final 2yo run but he still has potential and needs checking in market on return
runners.spotlight: Showed plenty of promise last summer including a near-miss in a nursery at Glorious Goodwood (7f, good to firm); flopped in his final run last season and has been gelded since but he still has potential after only five runs and needs checking in market on return; blinkers worn for last two starts are removed.

runners.name: Art Market
runners.comment: Made it 3-9 on turf when scoring over C&D last month; up 5lb but he's in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Has seen plenty of action since his debut last June but he resumed his progress back on turf after a gelding operation when scoring over C&D (good; cheekpieces removed) last month; up 5lb but that was a comfortable success and this return to quicker ground is no problem; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I did think the stiffer six furlongs today would suit Art Market but I was a little bit unsure how the ground would have dried out if it became holding ground. He actually handled it fine, it's pretty nice ground out there, but I needed every yard of the six furlongs to get him going. He's the type that the more you ask, the more he finds. He still is learning about the game and he's going the right way - Adam Farragher, jockey.

runners.name: Spirit Of Leros
runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for last success but he has a mixed record and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Two 2yo wins (6f, good) last summer but he struggled in two runs in Dubai during the winter and was well held behind We Dare To Dream on his recent Beverley reappearance; had some traffic issues in that race and is now only 1lb higher than for last success but others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Griselda
runners.comment: Well below form in last two runs and still has stamina to prove at this trip; headgear on
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-10 on turf but she's been more miss than hit since her win at Thirsk (6f, good to firm) last July and was last of eight on her reappearance at Wolverhampton last month; needs to turn things around and she still has stamina to prove at this trip; cheekpieces added.

stable_tour.quote: She's tall, imposing and covers a lot of ground, she looks a really smart prospect for the yard. It's hard to know quite when she'll get started but she's showing us enough at home to suggest she'll be able to run over six furlongs. 29-03-24

runners.name: Miss Collada
runners.comment: Defied this mark at Kempton in November but she's not come close to that form since
runners.spotlight: Recorded her third win when defying this mark at Kempton (7f, AW) in November but she's not come close to that form in three runs since; now goes back up in trip but she needs a major revival with blinkers added.

runners.name: Arabian Leopard
runners.comment: Promising fourth on handicap debut at Yarmouth and has claims if she can build on that
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in her three qualifying runs and she returned from a break with promising fourth on handicap debut Yarmouth (7f, good to firm) two weeks ago; was beaten less than 2l behind a useful prospect in that race and has possibilities if she can build on that.

stable_tour.quote: She was fourth in that good fillies' maiden at Glorious Goodwood and the winner, Dreamy, has won a Group 3 since. That was a really nice start and she's a filly with plenty of talent. 04-09-24

runners.name: Saxonia
runners.comment: In good form since a gelding operation but he needs to find more back on turf
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough when landing the odds in a Newcastle maiden (1m, AW) in February; three respectable efforts back in handicaps since but he's now 1-9 and needs to find more on this return to turf.

2:55.race_name: Shropshire County Show Grand Wynnstay Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Etalon
runners.comment: Ended last season with an easy win but has become unreliable
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form at end of last season, winning easily by 19l at Perth (2m, good to soft), and can probably cope with today's 7lb higher mark but has become unreliable and is not sure to be suited by the faster ground here.

quotes.race: Phil Nelson Capercaillie Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Etalon has not had the greatest winter but he's brought it all together when needed - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Team Forces "Ubique" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Etalon pulled a muscle right at the start of the season, so we just gave him a bit of time and he's come good. He was always going to improve for a fence and you can ride him any way and on most ground. Now we've given him that time he's very straightforward. We ran him in the EBF Final last season and while he did stay two and a half miles he's more of a two miler and will stay at that for now. I should think we'll go to Aintree for the Grade 1 race [Maghull Novices' Chase] -

quotes.race: Unibet Edward Courage Cup Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Etalon is a good horse, chasing was always going to be his game and he's now beginning to repay Ian's (Lawrence, owner) patience. It was good to get him some more experience and we'll likely keep him to handicaps and maybe look for something a bit bigger in the spring. He jumps well and is an exciting horse for the future - Tom Messenger, assistant to trainer Dan Skelton.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good last season in the build-up to Aintree, winning three novice chases, but we stepped him up to Grade 1 level and he completely underperformed - he was beaten after two fences and I've still got no idea why. I've always thought he'd reach higher and I hope he'll be progressive again this season, but his reappearance in the Haldon Gold Cup didn't go according to plan at all. We'll put it behind us, take the view that he's got a run under his belt and aim him at some of the more competitive two-mile handicaps. 12-11-24

runners.name: Fringill Dike
runners.comment: Well beaten last month but still has good chase strike-rate; won this comfortably in 2024
runners.spotlight: Behind Coastguard Station when well beaten in last month's Sussex Champion Chase at Plumpton but his 5-11 strike-rate over fences includes a comfortable success in this race a year ago (good to soft); will be dangerous if back on song.

quotes.race: Make Your Home A Happy Haus Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blinkers have been the making of Fringill Dike. For some reason over hurdles he just lost his confidence a little bit, he didn't like being crowded. The instant we put blinkers on, he was just a different horse. Life is going to get tougher now as his mark is getting towards 130 and the better jumpers will be coming out before too long. There's a race at the first meeting at Wetherby that may suit as long as the ground hasn't gone too slow by then - Jedd O'Keefe, trainer.

runners.name: Parisencore
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Peyre
runners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars And Miss D C Sellars

prev_owners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars & Major Philip Arkwright

runners.comment: In good form last year and might have needed his recent reappeance run; a possible
runners.spotlight: In good form last year, most notably when winning at Perth (2m4f, good to firm; 2m1f also suits) in June; made nothing better than a satisfactory reappearance behind Etalon at Perth last month but his current mark is workable and he ran well on both previous visits to Bangor (bumper/hurdle).

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Parisencore was consistent last season and deserved to win his two races. He relaxes well in front and pops away well. I don't think he can go up too much for that so hopefully there's a bit more to come - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A good, consistent handicap hurdler who's nearly top class. He ran a cracker when fourth in the Scottish Champion Hurdle at Ayr, having run well through the season. We've started schooling him over fences and we're looking towards 2m chases with him. He's a strong-running galloper and he'll be pretty exciting if he takes to fences. 25-10-23

runners.name: Coastguard Station
runners.comment: Career-best form when winning at Ascot in March and has run well again since; respected
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with career-best performance at Ascot (2m1f, good) in March and was not beaten far when sixth in valuable Sussex Champion Chase at Plumpton (2m1f, good) last month, despite a less-than-fluent round of jumping; commands respect in current form.

quotes.race: LK Bennett Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Coastguard Station is quite a quirky individual, hence why he has the headgear on. Even though he's keen, he can often get there and think he's done enough - Henry Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'd given Coastguard Station a little break as he's quite a free individual and can flatten himself out. He's come back fresh and well and that was ideal. We'll see what's about and see how he is. He likes a fast run race and could go up in trip with a run behind him - Henry Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: More Than A Flake Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Henry (Brooke) gave Coastguard Station a proper educational ride. He has loads of experience and he's very underrated as he was more than capable of getting the job done and we were pleased to have him on board. I don't think he wants the ground too extreme, so we might look for something this side of Christmas before then looking at nicer racing in the spring - Henry Oliver, trainer.

runners.name: Third Time Lucki
runners.comment: Smart in his prime but was well below his best last season; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old form but, following a long absence, did not really fire on any of five starts for new stable last season; not beaten far when last of five in Ascot race won by Coastguard Station in March and another 5lb lower here but still needs to up his game.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Dolos Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki hasn't been right this season but hopefully we have turned a corner. I like the look of the Grand Annual but it depends what the handicapper  does to him. I think Dan would be keener to go to Aintree for the Red Rum on a flat track. One thing the horse has got is speed, he has always been quick and on better ground he would be a better horse - Mike Newbould, owner.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We don't know yet where Third Time Lucki will go next season but he won't be going over two and a half miles. I wish we hadn't bumped the cross fence but he came back on the bridle afterwards and has run well. We've seen the back of Edwardstone in the three times we've been beaten this year - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very happy with Third Time Lucki, he travelled and jumped really well and did nothing wrong. There was a small chance his run two weeks ago would have taken a little bit out of him, but only a little bit, and there's no excuses. Edwardstone won well and he's a very strong Arkle contender. Third Time Lucki didn't underperform and if he did it was by pennies not pounds. We'll keep him in the Arkle but I expect the rain will come sooner rather than later, so the reality is he'll probably go for Aintree - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Off The Fence On attheraces.com Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki had a little bit of an overreach so I'm just going to keep an eye on that. It's nothing bad but we'll see how it is. If he goes to Cheltenham, great. If he has to miss Cheltenham because of the overreach and goes to Aintree then that's fine as well. We're delighted to have him, he's just magic.  He's very, very talented. We slipped into a few mistakes at Sandown but I always said that with that third run in quick succession there was always going to be some apprehension going there. And for a horse like him that wants decent ground you're only 50-50 to get it. We knew when we went there we were stretching the band a bit. He's had a good break and been freshened up. This is the perfect track and perfect trip with a fast-run race, it's all the things we've been craving for him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The November) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry said Third Time Lucki felt fantastic and he feels like a horse with a lot of natural pace. During my apprenticeship with Paul (Nicholls), Ruby Walsh used to talk about the difference between speed and pace and why the latter in a race is so important. It means you can go at your speed very comfortably. He can go through it in second gear, and that's great. He made it a bit harder work, visually, than he did the last day. He was fitter the last day, I just did a lot with him for the first day, he's a very exuberant horse so I pressed him a bit. I didn't want him too fresh and I've done less with him. He's jumped the last and had a bit of a blow. Originally the plan was to come here then the Henry VIII, but whether that'll definitely happen I'll need to talk to Mike (Newbould, owner). I could leave him until Kempton (Wayward Lad) but the ground would have a big bearing - there's no way I'd run him on soft or heavy. He might go there or wait and go to Doncaster (Lightning Novice), then come here. Appreciate It is top of the Arkle market and we've got to see what he does but I want to bring him back for the Arkle. We're going to go down that route and hopefully it'll work out - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: squareintheair.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always considered Third Time Lucki one of our best horses. I wanted to get some experience into him early, we went to Uttoxeter early then here on bad ground and that unravelled our season. If I had last year back I could've won a big race but the one thing it did do is give him a lot of experience - he's done it all. He's now mature, I've tinkered with his wind and Harry can really ride him. We've been chuffed to bits with his jumping at home and everything has come together.  We might come back here on the Sunday of the Paddy Power meeting, but if the ground was bad he wouldn't run, then he'd go to the Henry VIII. Ultimately he's coming back here in March.  We've got every right to believe in him now and plan for March.  He's a pure two-miler and the faster they go the better - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes £1 Free Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Third Time Lucki's last race was a bit of a disaster but today's test suited him a lot better. You can now ride him so much closer to the pace, whereas before we knew he would do too much. He has been relatively busy with four runs already this season, but whilst he is next season's chaser, we still want to compete in top races over hurdles. Everything is under consideration - and I would love to try him in a fast-run handicap - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's always a bit nerve-wracking, especially when you're coming out of bumpers, but luckily with Third Time Lucki it looks like he's got the aptitude for hurdling.  He was a bit keen the whole way round, but they're always going to be keen first time these talented horses because they've not got the fizz out of them. The benefit of having a run will be massively important. I should have thought we'll probably look at the November meeting at Cheltenham - Dan Skelton, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a graduate of Fran and Charlie Poste's and the British point-to-point scene is really on the up. We've always liked him at home and he finds life easy in general. Where we go next I don't know, although Cheltenham is tempting. Whether Third Time Lucki is mentally ready I'm not sure and he'll be a nice horse for the future. We'll weigh up our options - Tom Messenger, assistant to trainer Dan Skelton.

stable_tour.quote: It was an underwhelming comeback in the Haldon Gold Cup but as a second-season chaser you're forced into these races as options are limited. I thought I'd done loads of work with him but in hindsight he probably needed the run a fraction. There's no need to over analyse and we'll go for the Hurst Park at Ascot on Saturday now. His ideal would be two miles on good ground and a flat track, and the obvious race which springs to mind is the Red Rum at Aintree in the spring. 15-11-22

1:45.race_name: Bangor-On-Dee Family Fun Day Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Stream Of Stars
runners.comment: Ended last season with very respectable second at Ffos Las and remains on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two Fontwell wins (2m3f/2m1f) last autumn and ended last season with very respectable second at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) last month; still on a good mark and will be suited by the quicker ground here; likely contender.

quotes.race: Kilburn Gaels Hurling Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stream Of Stars had a long time off and the owners have been very patient, because I promise you we've probably given him eight entries and he's never once been declared. There's been a lot of patience shown all round and it's paid off. He had a leg, and then recovered from that and was just coming back into training at possibly the wrong time. I thought stepping up to two miles and three on his first run back possibly wasn't ideal but luckily he got a nice slot in behind the leader and it was a nice even pace. He relaxed and jumped - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Castel Gandolfo

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Has modest strike-rate in recent years but landed a good prize last summer
runners.spotlight: Has modest strike-rate in recent years but returned from break with satisfactory run at Cheltenham last month and is now only 1lb higher than when winning valuable Summer Hurdle at Market Rasen (2m, good) last July.

quotes.race: Unibet Daily Industry Best Prices Summer Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Castel Gandolfo has been around a while and placed here a lot. He was always finding one too good, but he felt great today and was working well. I got a grand run round and every split that I needed came. He toughed it out as I was there too soon, but I had to take the split on the rail as soon as I got it. When he landed at the last he rallied at the line. He loves it here so he's going to be coming back here soon I'd think. He could come back here for the Prelude meeting - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

quotes.race: Fakenham Racecourse Caravan & Camping Site Is Open Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Castel Gandolfo is a mile/mile and a quarter horse on the Flat, there's some difference around here when you have a bit of speed because it's really tight, it worked out well today. It's lovely ground here and he loved it - Paddy Brennan, jockey

runners.name: Fromheretoeternity
runners.breeder: Mrs A L Merry & Mr Brett Merry
runners.comment: Made excellent progress towards end of 2024; needs to kick on again after his break
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who made excellent progress for Jennie Candlish in the autumn, winning three times over 2m (good/soft); managed only fourth of five on latest outing at Newcastle (2m1f, soft) in January, though, and needs to kick on again after 109-day break.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fromheretoeternity felt a lot better on that ground compared to Worcester. When she hit the front she was lugging a bit left but it was very impressive from the last. When I gave her a squeeze she just took off. Fair play to Jennie [Candlish, trainer] and Alan [O'Keeffe, assistant], the horses are flying - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports

stable_tour.quote: She won two hurdle races over 2m in October and early November but then didn't stay at Newcastle when stepped up to 2m4½f. She was one of the few who had been purchased or moved across from the Declan Queally yard. We dropped her back to 2m at Plumpton on ­Monday and she was a close second, ­beaten three-quarters of a length. She did it really well at Hexham for her latest win and the handicapper took a proper swipe at her, but hopefully she can justify her mark. While we can run her in novices, she'll run in handicap company as her jumping is so effective. 05-12-24

runners.name: Hidalgo De Lisle
runners.comment: Out of form at end of last season and needs a significant boost from the new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field chase last summer but ended last season with two disappointing efforts, more recently when back over hurdles at Kempton (2m, good) last month; on a good mark now and is a dual C&D winner but needs a significant boost from the first-time cheekpieces today.

runners.name: Got Grey
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Treli
runners.comment: Ran well in two competitive handicaps last month (2m/2m4f) and has a good chance here
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to take second in valuable series final at Haydock (1m7f, good) last month and travelled strongly for a long way before fading into sixth at Sandown (2m4f, good) a week later; today's race is less competitive and the drop back in trip looks the right move; good chance.

runners.name: Lipa K

prev_owners.owner: P L Conway & T B P Cottrell Racing

runners.comment: Dual course winner over fences; ran okay in competitive hurdle last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner over fences; reverted to hurdling with respectable sixth in competitive Ayr handicap (2m, good to soft) at last month's Scottish National meeting and is sure to be suited by the return to this track; could have a say.

quotes.race: Dragonbet Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lipa K always ran well for his previous yard and we were lucky to get him pretty much ready to go. He jumped really well at home and while he was a little ponderous over his fences today I don't think he enjoyed the soft patches of ground. He actually did it a shade cosily at the end - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Killarney Oils (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Lipa K is a good horse and I think he will be sold now, but hopefully to stay in the yard. I'd love to keep a horse like him in my yard - Eoin McCarthy, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been a tricky horse to get right. He ran well when third at Stratford on his reappearance but it didn't help him when they took the hurdles out on the straight due to the low sun. I think there's plenty of room off his mark and he can win a decent race off a low weight. He wants a quickly run two miles with some cut in the ground, although he might stay a bit further. 02-11-23

runners.name: Carrigmoorna Rowan
runners.comment: Safely held in first two chases; eased in grade with cheekpieces tried here
runners.spotlight: Yet to build upon last spring's maiden hurdle win and was safely held in two handicap chases (3m/2m4f) towards end of last season; will appreciate this slight ease in grade, though, and might be perked up by first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Walking The Walk
runners.comment: Third on first two stable starts but pulled up the next twice; returns from 200-day break
runners.spotlight: Started off for Kerry Lee with two pretty good thirds in early part of last season, the latter over C&D on good ground, but was pulled up in refitted cheekpieces (retained) on next two outings and it's hard to know what to expect from him after a 200-day absence.

quotes.race: Lady's Cove Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Walking The Walk is consistent. It was good for him to finally get over the line - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

runners.name: The Dark Edge
runners.comment: Ended last season in very good form over hurdles; contender on this chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in very good form over hurdles, winning at Warwick (3m2f, good) before clear second at Huntingdon (3m1f, good); contender if he jumps soundly on this chasing debut.

runners.name: Another Lord
runners.comment: Hiked up 9lb for last month's soft-ground win but still lightly raced over fences
runners.spotlight: Has taken pretty well to fences this year and drew nicely clear to score at Ffos Las (3m, soft) last month; went up 9lb for that and may not be ideally suited by the quicker ground here but still respected.

quotes.race: Landofsmiles Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Another Lord wasn't great to start with but he's getting the hang of it. He lands steep and hasn't much scope but he does make the effort. James Bowen - jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was running over hurdles but has now had a couple of chase starts, finishing second at Uttoxeter behind Lucky Lugger and fourth at Exeter last time out. He's taken a while to get his jumping together but I'm sure that once we get that sorted he'll win one or two. He's still a bit novicey over a fence and we could even go back over hurdles for a bit to give him confidence. He's another one who can get his head in front. 26-03-25

runners.name: Mrs Tabitha
runners.comment: Ran big race when second over C&D on chasing debut but this quirky mare comes with risk
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles last year and ran big race when second over C&D (good; first-time blinkers) on last month's chasing debut; however, this quirky mare didn't appear to be helping her jockey much in the closing stages and always comes with risk attached.

stable_tour.quote: She was only just ready to run before her debut, so it was a big surprise when she won really nicely. She's a half-sister to Presenting Percy, so she's bred to do the job and she jumps really well. We'll go novice hurdling and she might be one for those mares' finals in the spring. 01-11-23

runners.name: Yes And Yes
runners.owner: David W Jagger & Mrs Belinda Clarke
runners.comment: Both runs since 2m3f Chepstow win in March were very respectable; back up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at third attempt, at Chepstow (2m3f, good) in March, and both subsequent runs (2m4f/2m5f) were perfectly respectable; well worth another crack at 3m and probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Bumpy Evans
runners.comment: Ended last season with two wins (2m4f/2m3f); up in trip today; still unexposed under rules
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner towards end of last season; had to dig pretty deep to reel in lowly rated 12yo at Ffos Las (2m3f, good to soft) on latter occasion but remains lightly raced under rules and ought to be suited by today's step up in trip.

quotes.race: DragonBet Sponsors Alan Johns Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bumpy Evans wasn't too bad on the way to the start but he wasn't very nice during the race. I didn't think I was going to win the whole way around and then to his credit he's very game at the business end - Alan Johns, jockey.

runners.name: Famoso

prev_owners.owner: P K Barber And P J Vogt

runners.comment: Six-time chase winner who is suited by good ground and largely consistent; respected
runners.spotlight: Six-time chase winner who is suited by good ground and largely consistent; no match for revitalised rival when second of three at Newton Abbot (2m, good) last month and may have a preference for right-handed tracks but still enters calculations.

quotes.race: Matt Sheppard Slow Two Miler Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a career-best performance from Famoso and Stan [Sheppard] gave him a blinding ride. He's very well bred and probably has far more ability than he lets on, but he put it all together on the right day - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

quotes.race: NFU Mutual Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Famoso is a joy to train and he's very straightforward. He travelled into the race very strongly and I couldn't be happier with what he did. He'll be going to Ludlow as much as possible as he needs a sharp track. He disappointed at Exeter last time and Warwick too this season, which are galloping tracks, whereas his best runs have come here and at Stratford - Matt Shepherd, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He started 8-11 favourite for a Chepstow bumper but disappointed us. I think he'll leave that form well behind and I'm now going to get him going over hurdles because I think he wants a trip. 16-11-20

He's been in great form. He did us proud when winning the Matt Sheppard Slow Two-Miler Handicap Chase at Hereford on the day of my book launch. He won at Ludlow off 81 last November and his win at Hereford this November was off 97, so he's done really well. He then ran at Wincanton last Thursday, running and winning off a career-high mark of 102 under Richard Patrick. I was a bit worried that the ground might have been a bit soft for him but he's never failed to surprise me. Wincanton proved to me that the better the class of race, the better he might run, and he did it quite cosily in the end. He'll go to either Ludlow or Hereford on December 18 or 21, whichever one looks best at the time. He's a half-brother to the King George winner Tornado Flyer. 28-11-24

runners.name: Intrepide Sud
runners.comment: Didn't jump well enough in first two chases but may yet get his act together over fences
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner on good ground; didn't jump well enough when safely held in two Stratford chases (2m1f/2m3f) in March but has been given some help by the handicapper and may yet get his act together over fences.

runners.name: Nevendon
runners.comment: Made low-key return on Flat last month but was in good form over fences last autumn
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with low-key Flat run last month but was in good form over fences in the autumn, most notably when narrow winner at Southwell (2m, good); not out of this if that recent outing did him good.

runners.name: Flash In The Park
runners.owner: Mt Hughes, John Lawson, Stephanie Kaye
runners.comment: Back in form when third in first-time blinkers last month, under very positive ride
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m4f on soft ground for Dan Skelton in the autumn; initially disappointing for new stable this year but ran well from the front when dropped back to 2m and fitted with blinkers at Warwick (2m) last month, finishing third; could make another bold bid if the headgear continues to aid.

stable_tour.quote: He's another cracking individual who's come here after winning a point-to-point. He carries his head a little high, like his sire's progeny can, but he has an engine and jumps well. He could be anything because he does things easily. He'll be hurdling soon. 10-11-23

runners.name: Neigh Botha
runners.comment: Below form over hurdles last month but ran well when second in C&D chase two runs ago
runners.spotlight: Below form when back over hurdles last month but gave very good account when clear second to all-the-way winner in C&D chase (good) two starts ago; leading contender if judged on that performance.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Musselburgh for Donald Whillans before joining us. He ran well enough in a maiden hurdle at Listowel last month but will come on a ton for that and leave that form well behind. 18-10-22

runners.name: Jaitroplaclasse
runners.breeder: David Lumet & Dr V Catherine Lumet
runners.comment: Placed over C&D on heavy ground in February; not as good on good ground since, though
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who left disappointing stable debut a long way behind when placed over C&D (heavy) in February; 2lb lower today and may improve again for Robbie Llewellyn but was slightly disappointing on good ground in March, and the lively conditions are a nagging concern again today.

stable_tour.quote: Michael Blencowe hasn't had much luck for us and I was hoping this fella, who is beautiful, would change that, but he disappointed at Kempton in March. He looks the part and we just need to unlock his talent. 30-10-23

runners.name: Lahire
runners.comment: Quite well handicapped on hurdling form but was held before last-fence all on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Quite well handicapped on some of his winter hurdle form but had faded out of contention (albeit after running well for a long way) before last-fence fall on last month's chasing debut at Sedgefield (2m, good) and may be better suited by ground slower than good.

runners.name: Greenrock Abbey
runners.comment: Regressive 9yo who became very disappointing last season; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Regressive 9yo who became very disappointing last season; continues to slide down the weights and may benefit from today's drop back in trip but others have much more appealing profiles.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, scopey horse who won an Irish point-to-point before we bought him at the Cheltenham sale in March. I've been very happy with him and he'll go straight over hurdles, probably at two and a half miles with a view to stepping up in trip. 09-11-20

runners.name: Barranco
runners.comment: Pulled up on last four outings but still worth close look in market before stable debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on final four outings for Henry Hogarth, most recently after two early jumping errors on chasing debut in January; makes stable debut from 5lb out of the weights and with all sorts to prove but, nevertheless, warrants close attention in the betting; hood removed; tongue-tie added.

2:20.race_name: Fyrnwy Equine Clinic Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Independent Jimmy
runners.comment: Placed on soft ground during winter and might do even better on the quicker ground here
runners.spotlight: Absent since 37l defeat at Doncaster in January but ran well when placed at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) two starts ago and might be seen to better effect on the quicker ground here; player if fully tuned up after break.

runners.name: Eagles Gold
runners.comment: Seemed to be moving into contention before mishap in home straight here last month
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 25l in first two handicaps but seemed to be moving into contention before stumbling and falling just after penultimate flight over C&D (good) last month; must be considered after that improvement.

runners.name: Soldier In Mayo
runners.comment: Placed in 2m4f maiden last month and should have further improvement to come in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who made steady progress in his qualifying races over hurdles last season; placed in Sedgefield maiden (2m4f, good) last month and should have further improvement to come in handicaps.

runners.name: Make Sunshine
runners.comment: Well held when last of three nine days ago but earlier Hereford run gives her a shout
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; well held when last of three finishers at Stratford (2m6f, good) nine days ago but ran game race from the front when third at Hereford (2m3f, good) in March and has possibilities here if judged on that performance; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Gone In Sixty
runners.comment: Placed four times last spring/summer but absent since two below-par autumn runs
runners.spotlight: 0-15 over hurdles; placed four consecutive times on good ground last spring/summer (2m4f-2m6f) but absent since two below-par autumn runs.

runners.name: Kenmya
runners.comment: Has not yet shown much over hurdles but was a five-time Flat winner in France
runners.spotlight: Five Flat wins in France; showed very little over hurdles in Britain last season, including when dropped back to 2m for last month's handicap debut, but Dan Skelton is persisting with her and she can't be written off just yet.

runners.name: Blended Stealth
runners.breeder: R D And Mrs J S Chugg
runners.owner: D Mullen, G Barker And Partners
runners.comment: Out of form when last seen in winter and career strike-rate stands at 0-34
runners.spotlight: Went close off his lowly mark at Hexham (2m, good; refitted cheekpieces) in November but suffered three heavy defeats afterwards (one over fences; visored last time) and returns from 131-day break with career strike-rate standing at 0-34; no headgear today.

runners.name: After Midnight
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Donald Smith
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise when a big-priced outsider in maiden/novice hurdles
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise when a big-priced outsider in four maiden/novice hurdles (2m3f-2m5f); makes handicap debut from a lowly mark but still needs significant improvement.

runners.name: Jailbird
runners.comment: Kept on for third on handicap hurdle debut but well beaten twice since (Flat/hurdle)
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable third at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft) on handicap hurdle debut in February but well beaten twice since (Flat/hurdles) and not the most obvious answer here.

runners.name: Hope Hill
runners.comment: Shaped well in two handicaps last summer; had possible ground excuse last time
runners.spotlight: Shaped well before fading into fifth in two Market Rasen handicaps (both 2m4f, good) last summer and may not have been suited by the soft ground when a disappointing favourite at Sedgefield in January; returns from another break today but still considered.

3:30.race_name: Horse PWR 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: City Of Diamonds
runners.comment: Shaped with some promise in a bumper on rules debut but needs significant improvement here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on Irish point debut in March 2024; shaped with more promise than finishing position suggests when seventh of eight in good-ground Newcastle bumper in October but still needs significant improvement on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: Garswood Gold
runners.comment: Struggled in slow-ground Irish bumper on debut in December 2023; not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 6yo; struggled when a big-priced outsider for slow-ground Leopardstown bumper in December 2023 and not seen again since; had wind op in January; can only be watched on stable/hurdle debut.

runners.name: Ilostasock
runners.comment: Did not show enough in bumpers last season to warrant consideration here
runners.spotlight: Did not show enough in his three bumpers last season to warrant serious consideration on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: Old Bridge
runners.breeder: Mrs P Lafitte & Mr A Edwards
runners.comment: Placed twice in Ireland in April and may not need to improve to make winning stable debut
runners.spotlight: Made quite promising start to hurdling career for Gordon Elliott last month, placed in maidens at Bellewstown (2m1f, good) and Kilbeggan (2m, yielding); recently changed hands for £20,000 and may not need any improvement to make a winning stable debut.

runners.name: Blackwater Lilly
runners.comment: Placed all three hurdling starts and likely to be right in the thick of things again here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two good-ground bumpers last year and placed on all three hurdling starts, most recently when third of 12 at Hexham (2m, good) last month; likely to be right in the thick of things again here; sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Just Tell Robyn
runners.comment: Pulled up when 200-1 for for last month's hurdling debut here (2m3f)
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when 200-1 for for last month's hurdling debut here (2m3f, good to soft); can't be recommended.

runners.name: Mouthshuteyesopen
runners.comment: Irish point winner; well beaten after racing too freely in bumper; hooded for hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Joined Donald McCain after winning Irish point debut in January (yielding ground); well beaten after racing too freely in Uttoxeter bumper on rules debut in March; hooded for today's hurdling debut.

runners.name: Aazza
runners.comment: Revitalised 9yo who ended last season with two wins; can't be ignored in current mood
runners.spotlight: Revitalised 9yo who ended last season with wins at Wetherby and Southwell (both 3m, good); up another 5lb since last time but can't be ignored in current mood.

runners.name: Fine By Her
runners.owner: Mrs J A Benson & Miss S N Benson
runners.comment: Surprise winner at Fakenham last spring but out of form when last seen in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Caused 22-1 surprise off 3lb lower at Fakenham (2m4f, good; stays further) last June but this mercurial mare performed poorly on latest outing in November and it's hard to predict whether she'll be in the right mood here.

runners.name: Izzys Grey
runners.comment: Placed twice over C&D at end of last season but returns here after a lacklustre effort
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles; placed twice over C&D on good ground towards end of last season and won't be far away if in similar form again but needs to bounce back quickly from lacklustre run a fortnight ago; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Strolling Along
runners.comment: Close third of 14 on last month's handicap debut; up from 2m4f today; still has potential
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who encountered traffic in the straight when close third of 14 on last month's handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, good; first-time tongue-tie); moves up in trip here and probably still has potential.

runners.name: Heather Honey
runners.comment: Low-mileage mare who won pretty comfortably when upped to 2m7f last time out
runners.spotlight: Evidently well suited by step up to 2m7f when winning pretty comfortably by 6l at Newcastle (good) six weeks ago, her second handicap; could still have a lot more to offer and commands respect.

runners.name: After Many Days
runners.comment: Pulled up on chase debut and now back over hurdles; others have much less to prove
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who was pulled up on chasing debut in February and now reverts to hurdling in refitted cheekpieces; seems versatile regarding ground but has a lot more to prove than some of these.

3:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
3:55.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Mirsky
runners.comment: Four wins in France but he's 0-10 in Britain and others are more convincing
runners.spotlight: Four turf wins (1m-1m3f) on good to soft in France but he's 0-10 in Britain and was well held on recent reappearance at Newmarket (1m, good); mark continues to fall but he needs a major upturn in form.

stable_tour.quote: He ran some good races last year without winning and will do all the same races again. On his work at home, he looks like he'll take a step forward. 14-04-25

runners.name: Rhythm Master
runners.comment: Quiet over C&D latest but he was in good form before that; not ruled out back in grade
runners.spotlight: Just two wins from 30 starts and was quiet over C&D (Hunt Cup) two weeks ago but he was running well before that including an eyecatching second at Redcar (1m, good to firm); looks interesting on that form and he's not ruled out on this drop back in grade.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhythm Master has been a bit of a rogue. We had to relieve him of his manhood, we tried the visor today and it made the world of difference - John Dance, owner.

runners.name: Star Studied
runners.comment: Back from lengthy absence but he's 2-2 and looks a useful prospect for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Evens favourite when making a successful debut at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in February 2024 and he followed up with a comfortable win under a penalty at Kempton the following month; been absent since but he looks a useful prospect for handicaps and is an interesting contender on his comeback.

quotes.race: Bet £10 Get £40 At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands B-D) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was a lovely performance from Star Studded. He was a bit sleepy in the gates, but picked up nicely in the straight when I asked when the gaps appeared. He won going away at the finish - Clifford Lee, jockey.

runners.name: Obelix
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he's not easy to predict and comes with risks attached
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of reduced mark when landing a competitive handicap at Haydock (1m, good) in September; creditable fourth over 7f here on reappearance last month but he's not easy to predict and was out the back in the Hunt Cup over C&D last time; remains feasibly treated and now drops back in grade but he comes with risks attached.

runners.name: On The River
runners.comment: Ideally suited by slow ground and was beaten 14l at Pontefract last time; down the list
runners.spotlight: Four wins on good to soft or slower last year; reappeared with a close second at Ripon (1m, good) last month but he falied to back that up at Pontefract 13 days later; has something to prove after that heavy defeat and this return to fast ground is a negative.

quotes.race: Yorkshire Wonder Horse Race Is On Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: On The River won on this day last year. He's consistent. I was a bit worried about the ground over this trip but he toughed it out. He's got a good attitude - Ben Haslam, trainer.

runners.name: Redarna

prev_owners.owner: Dianne Sayer Anna Noble Arnie Flower

runners.comment: 16-time winner and is only 1lb lower than for last success; dangerous back in a Class 3
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has won 16 times including over C&D; reappeared with ninth of 13 in Hunt Cup here two weeks ago but he may have needed that run and is only 1lb higher than for his win at Ayr in the autumn; could be dangerous on this drop back in grade and he's not ruled out.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Handicap
quotes.quote: Redarna is a wonderful little horse who tries his heart out, which he certainly did there. He's just fabulous. It's quite strange that he's now winning over seven [furlongs] when it always used to be eight ? he's gone the opposite way to most horses.  There's no race for him at the final meeting at Ayr, so he'll probably go to the grass now and we'll be back to give it another go next year - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Blackwell Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Redarna has run some good races here. I thought he needed soft ground so he's proved me wrong. The cheekpieces have helped him come out of the stalls as that was the best he has broke - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Wemyss Bay Holiday Park Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Redarna has run some good races at five and six furlongs so I wouldn't say he was necessarily any better at this trip. The ground was probably too quick for him last time and he was just that bit sharper today - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Wemyss Bay Holiday Park Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Redarna stayed on well over a stiff five furlongs at Carlisle last time and we thought bringing him here and trying him over seven furlongs we could learn a bit more about him. This is probably the right trip for him but the cut in the ground was also a help. It would be nice if we could find a suitable amateurs' race for him now, so that I can ride him! - Emma Sayer, trainer's daughter.

runners.name: Barley
runners.comment: Fair efforts in two runs at Redcar this season but he's only won once since April 2022
runners.spotlight: Respectable fifth in two runs at Redcar (1m, good/good to firm) this season but he's only won once since April 2022 and that was in a Class 4 event 11 months ago; others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: Jeffrey King Memorial Race Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Barley probably needed the run at Doncaster, not from a fitness point of view but to wake him up as he's very laid-back. We got a really soft lead today and were able to dictate. He's a lovely-looking horse and has a good attitude. He'll stay further and be better in a better race, where I think he'd be able to show his full potential - Rob Hornby, jockey.

runners.name: Quiet Resolve
runners.comment: Went close at Hamilton 13 days ago and he's still lightly raced on turf; respected
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who is 0-6 on turf but he ran near his best when a close third at Hamilton (8.3f, good to firm) 13 days ago; this is a big step back up in grade but he's on the same mark as last time and could make another bold bid.

4:30.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
4:30.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Probe
runners.comment: Back to form with last-gasp win at Chester ten days ago; respected up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Returned to form on the step back up to 7f when finishing well for a last-gasp win at Chester (good; 12-1) ten days ago; up 3lb but he remains well handicapped on best form and should get a decent tow into this race; respected.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Probe is a straightforward horse and Jennie's done a great job getting his head right. We learnt the last time here that we probably got there a bit soon. We waited a bit longer today and the rain has helped. I'm really pleased as he's a proper horse - Alan O'Keeffe, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Remembering John Kierans Rated Race
quotes.quote: Probe is progressing. The step up to a mile suited him last day and he has sharpened up since. He handles the ease well and I think he's versatile as to trip, I think he could get as far as 1m2f - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Probe on debut when he was plenty green and raw and I loved him. Oisin (Orr) said he was plenty green again the second day and said he'd appreciate going that little bit further and the step up to a mile with juice in the ground suited. It probably wasn't the strongest race but you'd like the way he did it and hopefully he can keep improving. I wouldn't think he's too far off Stakes level - Colin Keane, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper good sprinter on his day. He was a great servant for us in 2023 when he won the big sprint handicap on Guineas day at Newmarket. He's had a few setbacks but is on the way back and we'll be looking to start off again in January for the big all-weather handicaps. 05-12-24

runners.name: Documenting

prev_owners.owner: Kf Racing, Humphreys, Orr, Glover Priest
Kf Racing Club, Humphreys, Jones And Orr
Kevin Frost Racing Club & M A Humphreys

runners.comment: 12yo who recorded his 12th win when scoring on AW in December; in the mix on return
runners.spotlight: 12yo who recorded his 12th win when scoring off a reduced mark at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in December; 3lb higher on his return but he remains well treated on old form and conditions are no problem on this switch back to turf; dangerous.

quotes.race: Play Pick 6 At BetVictor Handicap
quotes.quote: The faster the ground, the better Documenting is. The one worry was no pace and it'd be tactical, but Jack knows him well and Able Kane gave us something to aim at. He's a tough dude and we put him in the Ayr Gold Cup because I'd love to see him in an eyeballs-out six-furlong race. I've never seen him off the bridle early in the race and it's an option if the ground's quick - Kevin Frost, trainer.

quotes.race: sunracing.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: I had a lovely run round the inside - it was very straightforward. Kevin [Frost] was very pleased with how Documenting was before the race - Jack Mitchell, jockey

quotes.race: Visit mymedsuk.com Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Documenting has got a fantastic pedigree and we bought him for just 1,000 guineas out of Juddmonte as he has obviously had problems. He can only come on for the win - Kevin Frost, trainer.

runners.name: Darkness
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he's lost his way and needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Effective on fast and soft ground and four of his wins have come at this trip; last success at Sandown in the autumn but he's been disappointing since including in two runs at Newmarket this season; now 2lb lower than for his last win but he needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Handicap
quotes.quote: Darkness enjoyed the change of tactics and he's got plenty of ability, it's just getting it out of him. It was a decent enough run today, he just got tired close home - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a law unto himself. Last year he won at Newmarket and then ran well in the Golden Mile at Goodwood, but he can throw a bad run and doesn't win as often as he should. He likes to be ridden forward, but when he gets behind he has his own ideas. 19-04-24

runners.name: It Just Takes Time
runners.comment: Three wins in the autumn and creditable fourth at Doncaster three weeks ago; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Revitalised when returned to 7f+ last autumn, winning three times on turf; reappeared with a tenth of 13 over C&D last month but his fourth at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) two weeks later was more like it and has possibilities if he can build on that.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Training Series Final Apprentice Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Series) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It Just Takes Time made it look easy and relished the ground. It slowed the others down but he's a very simple ride. I popped him out and drop the hands and that's his style. He hits a flat spot but never gives up. He's very game - Olivia Tubb, jockey.

quotes.race: Joe Rowntree Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: It Just Takes Time is still progressing now we have found out how we can keep him settled down. He did that well enough. That was the perfect distance and a sharp 7f suits him well - Jack Garritty, jockey.

runners.name: Desert Falcon
runners.comment: Ended last season with two wins including over C&D; needs a close look on his return
runners.spotlight: Gradually worked his way back to form for new yard last season and he ended that campaign with wins over C&D (good) and at Ayr (7f, good to firm); returns after 238 days off but he still looks feasibly treated and has won when fresh in the past; interesting contender.

runners.name: Liamarty Dreams
runners.comment: Signs of a revival when fourth behind Probe at Chester and he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: His last win was 13 months ago but that was off 5lb higher and he returned to form with a creditable fourth behind Probe at Chester (cheekpieces) ten days ago; has a swing in the weights with his old rival and could be dangerous if he can take another step back in the right direction.

runners.name: Valentine Catcher
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut last August but he's been disappointing in three runs since
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Nottingham (6f, good to firm) last August but he's had only three runs since and has been well held in all of them; still lightly raced and now returns to turf but he has plenty to prove back up in trip.

quotes.race: Happy 40th Birthday Gary Sivills EBF Novice Stakes (Horses With No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Valentine Catcher showed enough at home but first-time-out in those conditions, you'd think it wouldn't be ideal. He was a bit slow away and a bit green but he travelled nicely and got there quite easily. There's obviously plenty of potential there and I was quite impressed - David Allan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's done really well and could be another for the Macmillan race at York. He's done all his racing on soft or heavy, because there was nothing else around, but I think he'll be better on good ground. 23-04-24

runners.name: Federal Envoy
runners.owner: Lets Be Lucky Racing 37 & David Carroll
runners.comment: Record of 3-5 at Southwell but was only sixth there last time and he needs more progress
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-5 on Tapeta at Southwell but he faded into sixth of 12 in his bid for a 7f double there in March; still unexposed on turf but has mixed record in this sphere and he probably needs more progress to defy this mark; others preferred.

runners.name: The Good Biscuit
runners.comment: Both wins were at 6f in July 2023 and he needs to find more at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Both wins were over 6f in July 2023, with first in a seller and latest in a novice; two respectable efforts for new yard at Ripon this season but he needs to find more here and not sure this step up to 7f will suit.

quotes.race: In Memory Of Sir Ian Pamphilon Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Band D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Good Biscuit has backed up quite well. He was fresh and well on Monday morning so we thought this looked like a race we could win. He's got a good constitution so it was a straightforward decision after he ate up. One of his main rivals was taken out, but he still did it well. He went unsold so we brought him home, and he's probably had to run to about the same as he did last time, but when we go into nurseries it'll be tougher - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Smooth Breakfast With Gareth Evans Selling Stakes (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Good Biscuit had every right to go and do that and he did it well. We've always thought he was a nice two-year-old and these sellers have unbelievable prize-money, so it was a no-brainer for us to go there. It was a nice, easy race and he'll have a handicap mark now so we can go into nurseries and hopefully have a lot of fun with him. He's a horse who should improve. Nothing went right for him the first day at Carlisle, and his second start was pretty much like his first run. He was drawn on the wrong side in stall five, but Charlie gave him a nice ride and he finished well - Jack Channon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came here from the sales in late autumn and it's quite possible the change of scenery and routine here at Mowbray will revitalise him. I'm still finding out about him, but I sense he could shape into a decent sprinter. He makes his debut for us at Redcar on April 17. 09-04-25

runners.name: D Flawless
runners.comment: Has found it tough going in handicaps and was in rear on stable debut at Wetherby
runners.spotlight: Emphatic win in a Chelmsford maiden (1m, AW) for the Gosdens last May but she's found it tough going in handicaps and was ninth of 11 on stable debut at Wetherby (7f, good to firm) last month; may have needed that run but others are more convincing.

runners.name: Arecibo
runners.comment: His last win was in 2021 and he's untried at this trip; opposable
runners.spotlight: Veteran who was a smart sprinter in his prime but last win was four years ago and he's finished down the field in three runs this season; dropped another 3lb but he has lots to prove on this first run at 7f; visor removed.

quotes.race: WSG Sports Signage Handicap
quotes.quote: Arecibo loved the ground and he was down in class so he was entitled to win like that - Frankie Dettori, jockey.

runners.name: Reidh
runners.comment: On workable mark but he needs to rediscover his spark on this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (good to firm) last June before going on to win a handicap at the Galway festival (7f, good); well treated on that form but he's finished down the field in last six runs and needs to rediscover his spark on this drop back in trip.

2:10.race_name: Josh Mullins Rules Supreme Handicap (Div I)
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
2:10.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Squealer
runners.comment: Not at best in Bahrain this winter; returns to Britain off a dangerous mark as a result
runners.spotlight: He wasn't in the same form in Bahrain this winter as he had been 12 months earlier; the upside of that is that he returns to Britain off a dangerous mark and the drop into a Class 4 could help revive his fortunes.

quotes.race: Custom Chairs By KC Sofas Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't quite think Squealer would pick up like he did, he hit a little bit of a flat spot then he picked up very well in the end. He's got an electric turn of foot when you can get him to switch off in the first half of the race. He wants top-of-the-ground. He's been a bit unlucky a few times but now he's got his head in front I think he'll grow in confidence. He's a nice sprinter going forward - Rowan Scott, jockey.

quotes.race: Ire Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Squealer is a lovely colt who has done little wrong in his career so far. It was a good place to win today. He'll go to the Cornwallis Stakes next as there aren't many other races left this season for horses like him - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

runners.name: Brazen Bolt
runners.comment: Lost the plot last summer but starts out for new yard off lowly mark as a consequence
runners.spotlight: Useful for the Quinns in his pomp and has often run well at this track; in good form in Bahrain in late 2023/early 2024 but the wheels fell off on his return to Britain, barely beating a rival in five starts; begins life with Ruth Carr (same owner) off a much-reduced mark and he's an interesting contender.

quotes.race: Great Prices On bresbet.com Handicap
quotes.quote: It was fairly easy, I just jumped out of the stalls and sat with him. Brazen Bolt was happy there and we didn't complicate it. He's an older horse and knows what he's doing - Gianluca Sanna, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's another new addition who could be exciting if I can find the key to him. He spent many years with John Quinn but, just before he came here, he spent a few months in Bahrain, so he's well travelled. We're good at sweetening up newcomers here. He's going to have all the time he needs and is a long-term project. 09-04-25

runners.name: Master Of My Fate
runners.owner: Ms Janelle Cao, Ross Harmon & Partner
runners.comment: Fine AW campaign, winning four times; needs to leave latest C&D sixth behind him
runners.spotlight: Four 5f handicap wins on AW this winter but up in the weights and he has been comfortably held on his last three runs, the latest over C&D two weeks ago; needs to find more.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate jumped really well and the more he's racing the more he's improving. I'd like to think when he gets back on turf he will do the same - Jason Hart, jockey.

quotes.race: Trevor Woods Memorial British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C & D) Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate been training well at home. I'm very pleased with how he did it. You can only beat what's put in front of you, but we've always liked him and I was delighted to see him win - John Quinn, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He beat very little when winning at Pontefract on his debut but he beat them very well and also ran well in a novice at Lingfield, even though he wasn't in love with that track. Then it didn't look like he stayed 6f at Newcastle. I'd imagine we'll drop him back to 5f and he could be one for decent sprint handicaps. He's been gelded and I think that will help him. 20-03-24

runners.name: Pop Star
runners.comment: Did well last year but looks high in the weights and may need more of a test than this
runners.spotlight: Three wins (5f-6f on a variety of ground) in 2024; clobbered by the handicapper for the last of them (Bath; 5.5f, soft) and found things happening too quickly for him off this mark on his reappearance six weeks ago; others look better treated.
