quotes.race: Simonstown Maiden
quotes.quote: Pop Star got a setback and has missed a lot of time. He was quite green late on but I was more than happy with him. He is quick, if he gets seven he is definitely stakes class - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Alligator Alley
runners.owner: R J H Limited And Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Two C&D wins to his name; promise on AW on penultimate start and excuses latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; promising effort at Southwell last month but unable to sustain his effort over C&D two weeks ago having raced prominently in a strongly run affair; better than that and not ruled out; stable also run Brazen Bolt.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: It was very easy. I think five furlongs is going to be the key to him, I don't think he stays six really. We've bounced and done things right. I'm not sure if it was much of a maiden but he gave me a nice feel today. He was behind some proper horses in maidens. Even though he wasn't getting near to them it was proper, nearly top-class, form in the book - Donnacha O'Brien, rider

stable_tour.quote: Won a couple of times last year including at the Racing League. He wants five furlongs in fast conditions and there's a nice race for him at York in May before the Epsom Dash in June. He's capable of popping up in those types of races. 19-04-24

He had a long career with David O'Meara before coming here and I'm pleased to have him because he's a lovely looking sort. He had his first race for us at Newcastle last month, running without any headgear and coming fourth of eight. Headgear will be an option next time he runs. 09-04-25

runners.name: Emeralds Pride
runners.comment: Good run from a wide stall at Beverley 12 days ago but has work to do with Frank The Spark
runners.spotlight: Course winner (6f); last season's two wins came at Beverley and she ran well at that track on her recent return to action given she had a wide stall; work to do to reverse those placings with Frank The Spark though.

quotes.race: betting.sites.ltd Promotional Sign Up Offers Restricted Maiden Stakes (Horses In Bands C&D) (GBB)
quotes.quote: The further Emeralds Pride went, the better she got. She could go that extra furlong and it might just be a little bit smoother for her over the seven furlongs. Connor Beasley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She won again at Beverley on Sunday, landing her second race there this season over 5f. She did it very well, having broken better than in previous races. She's in good form but we'll see what the handicapper does. 28-08-24

runners.name: Equity Law
runners.comment: Two encouraging runs for this yard; handicapped to win soon
runners.spotlight: Good form when winning at Sandown last April for Andrew Balding (5f, good) but he went the wrong way afterwards; two promising efforts for new yard, finishing in midfield over C&D two weeks ago having been on the sharp end of a strong pace; handicapped to win soon.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Equity Law was quick out of the stalls from his wide draw which was helpful and it was an easy race to ride on paper. He's obviously improved for his comeback run on soft ground at Bath - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Kodiac Thriller
runners.comment: Shaped nicely on stable debut last month (6f, good); drop in trip may help; interesting
runners.spotlight: Just one win for Charles Hills but last summer's best form came off higher marks than this; pleasing return to action/stable debut at Pontefract 17 days ago and being dropped 1lb helps; untried at 5f but he's not short of pace and he's another interesting contender.

runners.name: Frank The Spark
runners.comment: Running well in defeat this year; still feasibly treated; yard won 4 of last 7 runnings
runners.spotlight: On the up last summer and better than ever in defeat this year, finishing with a flourish for second at Beverley 12 days ago; should get a good pace to run at here and there still looks to be mileage in his mark; stable has won four of the last seven renewals of this race; plenty of appeal.

stable_tour.quote: He won for the first time at Bath on his most recent outing. We've had a few out of Frank's family; they're all late-maturing horses and he's exactly the same. He's just big and raw but the glimpses were there last year for everyone to see. The time before Bath he finished fifth at Beverley. Would he have won if he hadn't got stopped? I don't think he would but he would have been second to Yazaman. It looked like it would be proper soft ground at Bath but there wasn't as murain as was forecast, so it wasn't an excuse not to run him. We learned a lot from Bath. He was pretty raw, the track didn't suit, but he was well on top at the finish. The handicapper has put him up 11lb, whiI wasn't best pleased with, but it is what it is. I definitely wouldn't run him on fast ground and we'll mind him a bit this year, but he'll progress into a decent horse eventually. 28-06-24

3:20.race_name: Sky Bet Super Weekend Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
3:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
3:20.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Raulin
runners.comment: Emphatic win on handicap debut at Redcar and he's open to more progress upped to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Mixed form in novice/maiden events but he made a big impact upped to 1m2f on handicap debut when making all at Redcar (good to firm) two weeks ago; up 7lb but that was an emphatic success and he's open to more progress on this step up to 1m4f; key player.

runners.name: Edge Ofthe Unknown
runners.comment: Still early days but he needs improvement with headgear added at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Newcastle (1m, AW) in November but he's not really gone on from that and was only fourth of six on handicap debut at Beverley (1m2f, good; first run since gelded) last month; still early days but he needs improvement with headgear added at this new trip.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Edge Of The Unknown improved quite a lot recently. He was still very green through the early stages of the race and he's going to strengthen up with time. He's still very much a frame of an animal. He did well to win. His work had been encouraging but like all of ours it wasn't about today. His pedigree lends itself to a three-year-old career and a sound surface is what he needs. We'll look forward to him over the winter - George Boughey, trainer.

runners.name: Hallelujah U
runners.comment: Still has potential but he needs to raise his game on this step up to 1m4f; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Won a Southwell novice (1m, AW) in November but he's beaten beaten around 4l in two Newmarket handicaps (1m2f) this spring; still has potential after only five starts but he needs to raise his game on this step up to 1m4f; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Atlantic Sunset
runners.comment: Runner-up in two of his four qualifying runs; needs watching in market on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Best of the rest behind an easy winner at Kempton (1m3f) in January and it was more of the same at Southwell (1m4f) next time; disappointing in a Wolverhampton novice in March but he's still unexposed and needs watching in market on handicap/turf debut.

runners.name: Arkinthestars
runners.comment: Easy win in Ripon maiden last month and she's respected upped to 1m4f on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt when making all for 8l win in Ripon maiden (1m2f, good) last month; this is a tougher test on handicap debut but her mark hasn't changed and her confidence should be boosted after that runaway success; respected upped in trip.

runners.name: West Tyrone
runners.comment: Looks worth a try at this new trip but he needs to kick on again to make an impact
runners.spotlight: Made it second-time lucky in handicaps when scoring at Southwell (1m, AW) in March but he's been well held in both runs since; looks worth a try at this new trip but he was 4l behind Raulin at Redcar last time and has work to do to turn the tables with that rival.

runners.name: Paratrooper
runners.comment: No progress in three runs so far but he's a possible improver now switched to a handicap
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt who is a half-brother to a middle-distance winner; no progress in three novice/maiden events this year but it's still early days and he's a possible improver now upped to 1m4f on handicap debut; stablemate of Arkinthestars.

1:35.race_name: Marion Gibson Brown Memorial - Irish EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
1:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
1:35.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Cotai Belle
runners.comment: Always outpaced when eleventh of 15 at Leicester on debut; much more needed
runners.spotlight: Always outpaced when eleventh of 15 at Leicester (5f, good; 20-1) on debut; much more needed but should have benefited from the experience.

runners.name: Dance Hello
runners.comment: Half-sister to French Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner; her leading stable runs two
runners.spotlight: 27,000euros yearling; half-sister to French Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Ma Noire (RPR 89); dam unplaced 7f-8.5f, half-sister to 7f Listed winner Valima (dam of French Oaks winner Valyra); needs monitoring in the market with her leading stable running two.

runners.name: Dazzling Haze
runners.comment: Bred to be sharp and represents a yard with a fine record with juveniles; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: £130,000 yearling; A'Ali half-sister to winners Clarendon House (5f/5.7f including Listed; RPR 116) and Dinamic War (Italian 6.7f/7.5f); dam 6f AW 2yo winner (61), half-sister to useful 5f winner Wise Words; bred to be sharp and represents a yard with a fine record with juveniles; shortlisted.

runners.name: Desert Jungle
runners.comment: Has the right sort of pedigree and her stable is already off the mark with its 2yos
runners.spotlight: 90,000euros yearling; sister to 5f winner Funchal (RPR 94), half-sister to three winners including Devonshire (7f-1m1f including 2yo/Group 2; 110) and Hurryupharriet (5f 2yo including Listed; 98); dam multiple 5f winner (including 2yo; 88); has the right sort of pedigree and her stable is already off the mark with its 2yos.

runners.name: Duskaura
runners.comment: Twilight Son half-sister to three winners; recent breeze-up purchase; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: £62,000 breeze-up 2yo; Twilight Son half-sister to winners Compliant (1m2f/1m3f AW; RPR 85), Royal Appointment (UAE 5f dirt; 80) and Sealed Offer (7f AW 2yo; 76); dam 7f winner (101), sister to Breeders' Cup Filly & Mare Turf winner Queen's Trust; worth a market check.

runners.name: Lam Yai
runners.comment: Has a useful pedigree and one of two runners for Karl Burke whose juveniles are flying
runners.spotlight: 135,000euros yearling; closely related to 7f winner Where's Freddy (RPR 85), half-sister to winners One For Bobby (9.4f/1m2f including Group 3; 112) and Tough Spirit (7f; 76); dam 7f (Listed) and 1m winner (104); has a useful pedigree and one of two runners for Karl Burke whose juveniles are flying.

runners.name: Revival Power
runners.comment: Sister to the same connections' Nunthorpe hero Winter Power and has to be respected
runners.spotlight: 125,000euros yearling; sister to the same connections' Nunthorpe hero Winter Power (RPR 119), half-sister to four winners including Hay Chewed (5f including 2yo/Listed; 102); dam 6f 2yo winner (79); has to be respected with local yard's 2yos already in winning form.

runners.name: Sand Lily
runners.comment: Faded after leading when fourth at Beverley; probably the pick of the pair to have run
runners.spotlight: Faded after leading early when fourth of 12 at Beverley (5f, good; 12-1) last month; likely to last longer this time and probably the pick of the pair to have run.

runners.name: With Glory
runners.comment: £40,000 yearling by Cotai Glory; other newcomers appeal more on paper
runners.spotlight: £40,000 yearling; Cotai Glory half-sister to KSA 6f dirt 2yo winner Mekhled; dam sprint maiden (RPR 60), half-sister to 1m Listed winner Van Der Neer; other newcomers appeal more on paper.

5:05.race_name: Sky Bet, For The Fans Handicap
5:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
5:05.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Capital Guarantee
runners.comment: Back after wind surgery with win at Catterick but was disappointing next time
runners.spotlight: Returned after wind surgery with a comfortable win at Catterick (7f, good to firm) last month but was disappointing under a penalty at Musselburgh next time; that may have come too soon but he's not easy to predict and others are preferred.

runners.name: Boy Douglas
runners.comment: Well treated on best form last season but he needs to rediscover his spark
runners.spotlight: Well treated on his best form last season, including when runner-up in this race, but he ended last year on a low note and was well held again on his reappearance at Redcar (1m, good to firm) last month; has something to prove and he needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Tele Red
runners.comment: Versatile sort who is on a workable mark and needs watching in market on his return
runners.spotlight: His last win was in October 2023 but that was off 2lb higher and this versatile sort ran well on several occasions last season; this drop back in trip is no problem and he needs watching in market back from 204 days off.

runners.name: Infinity Blue
runners.comment: Back on the Flat with rallying third at Musselburgh and has claims if he can build on that
runners.spotlight: His hurdling career for David Pipe was quickly aborted after he pulled hard at Taunton in December but he returned to the Flat with a rallying third at Musselburgh (7f, good) two weeks ago; has claims if he can build on that and he looks worth a try at this new trip.

runners.name: Orbaan

prev_owners.owner: J C G Chua & C K Ong

runners.comment: Runner-up at Epsom latest and could be a big factor if he gets a good pace and some luck
runners.spotlight: Just one win since 2022 but that was off a higher mark in the Carlisle Bell last summer and he ran well to finish second at Epsom (8.5f, good) last month; usually comes from off the pace and could be a big factor if he gets the breaks on this drop back in grade; cheekpieces reapplied.

quotes.race: Stablemate By AGMA Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Orbaan is nine years old now and dropping in class, and deserves to win a race like this - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Full Of Surprises Classified Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I checked with the track and they said they put a lot of water on and that the ground wasn't too fast. It was perfect for Orbaan and I wouldn't risk him on quick ground. He's better on softer ground and could go to York for the Ebor meeting - Jimmy Chua, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: It's been a long time since Orbaan last won. The last time he won he did it like a Group horse in a handicap and hasn't won since. He's dropped down a bit but he got a good run through and the longer this horse travels, the better. He got the draw and it was the type of race that would suit him - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a revelation last year, winning the Golden Mile at Goodwood and at the Shergar Cup. He really seemed to enjoy his racing again. He ran over the sharp seven at Haydock last weekend, but the Victoria Cup will suit him better. His season will be built around the heritage handicaps, particularly Goodwood. 04-05-23

runners.name: Bass Player
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two AW wins and he may have needed his reappearance run; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Useful 3yo who found his level again late last year when winning a couple of Wolverhampton handicaps (8.6f); made a low-key return at Yarmouth two weeks ago but he may have needed that run and he now drops back in grade; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Bass Player retains plenty of ability but has his quirks. We had sweetened him up a little and my daughter Lauren rode him in some amateur races. I'm hopeful there could be a bit more to come - he has the ability to travel well through a race which does help on the all-weather - Kevin Frost, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A really lovely horse who ran well last year without winning before undergoing a wind operation over Christmas. He has had three runs since and there were some very positive signs on his penultimate run at Goodwood. When everything falls into place I feel he can pick up a good race. 06-07-23

runners.name: Vibrato
runners.comment: Triple AW winner but he's lost his way and needs a major revival after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on Tapeta and latest was at Southwell (1m) in December; well treated on that form and is still lightly raced on turf but he's lost his way and needs a major revival after wind surgery.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his last two. He'll be entered on December 12 at Newcastle in a 0-78 and also on December 14 at Southwell n a 0-78 over a mile. I don't think he's stopped winning as he's been successful with a bit more up his sleeve. He's definitely one to follow for the all-weather. 05-12-24

runners.name: Siam Fox
runners.comment: One of two runners for the yard and he needs checking in market back from a break
runners.spotlight: Won at Windsor (1m, good to firm) last June but he's been a bit up and down since and was beaten 11l at Southwell in his final run last year; hard to know what to expect on his return but he's on a dangerous mark back on turf and needs checking in market; stablemate of Bass Player.

quotes.race: MansionBet #Betstival Handicap
quotes.quote: I wouldn't say Siam Fox liked the track on this ground as he hit every undulation, but he got away with it. I didn't want to take any chances as I think a mile is as short as he wants to go. I think a different track and further will bring out more improvement - Silvestre de Sousa, rider.

runners.name: Yaajooz
runners.comment: His win was over C&D and he reappeared with a fair third at Pontefract; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Just one win from ten starts but that was over C&D (good to firm) last summer and he returned from a break with fair third at Pontefract last month; should benefit from that run and he's in the mix back at this track; hood worn last time is removed.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new arrival this year and we ran him twice quickly at the end of last month, when he was second at Wolverhampton and then fourth when favourite at Southwell. He's still a maiden but I'm sure we can get him winning. 04-04-24

runners.name: Carnival Zain
runners.comment: On long losing run but he ran well over C&D on his recent return; possibilities
runners.spotlight: On long losing run but he's well treated on his old form and was fourth of 15 over C&D (good) on his recent return; that was a big run from a wide draw and he wasn't far behind Visibility and Mount King in that race; shortlisted.

quotes.race: #allintherace Ascot Lady Amateur Riders' Trophy (A Class 3 Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's great. I struggled for a few years to even get a ride in this race. We had Carnival Zain entered last year and the ground was a little bit quicker than it was today and we took him out. I wish we hadn't. He's a better horse this year, he's grown up this season and he's a big strong horse. He loves his racing and he's taken to it very well, which is credit to Micky and the team. Micky has done a great job with him, he's not easy to deal with and is a little bit quirky, he's quite similar in character to his trainer. It's a dream for me, to win a race at Ascot for us is massive - Becky Smith, rider.

runners.name: Temper Trap
runners.comment: Good fifth over C&D two weeks ago but his last five wins have been in the mud
runners.spotlight: 14-time turf winner who won twice last autumn and was a creditable fifth of 15 over C&D (good) two weeks ago; ties in with a few of today's rivals on that form but his last five wins have been in the mud and this return to quicker ground is not ideal; yard also runs Mount King.

runners.name: Electric Avenue
runners.comment: Won on stable debut in December but she's not gone on from that and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Made a successful stable debut at Newcastle (1m, AW) in December but she's not gone on from that and was only fourth of six at Wolverhampton 18 days ago; others preferred.

runners.name: Mount King
runners.comment: Had near-miss behind Visibility over C&D two weeks ago and he should make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Both wins were in 2023 but one of those was over C&D and he's finished runner-up here in his two starts this season; up 2lb but that latest second was a near-miss behind Visibility and he should make another bold bid.

quotes.race: Leslie Burton (Fisher) Handicap
quotes.quote: We bought Mount King second hand at the Horses In Training Sale from Joseph O'Brien and he's been a lovely horse for the owners - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Visibility
runners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
runners.comment: Swooped late to beat Mount King over C&D 14 days ago and a 3lb rise looks fair; respected
runners.spotlight: Prolific AW winner who recorded his third win on turf when swooping late to beat Mount King over C&D (good) two weeks ago; up 3lb but he remains feasibly treated and could be a major force again.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Handicap
quotes.quote: We always knew Visibility had a lot of ability, he can be a bit hard to catch right but everything worked out well today. I never doubted he'd be as effective on turf - Scott Dixon, trainer

5:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
5:40.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Happier
runners.comment: Below par this year but now down in grade; interesting in different headgear combination
runners.spotlight: Hasn't landed a blow so far this year but she wasn't disgraced in a higher grade last time and she's only 2lb higher than when scoring at Southwell (5f, AW) last autumn; she handles quick ground on turf and now tries a different combination of headgear; might be the answer.

runners.name: Kodi Red
runners.comment: Yet to find best form this season and needs to be revived by a return to turf
runners.spotlight: None too consistent in 2024 but did win two handicaps; yet to find best form this season and needs to be revived by a return to turf.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Race
quotes.quote: He is an improving horse and has improved from every run. Seamie said he never had a moment's worry and was a winner all the way. Kodi Red is a lovely horse, we're not sure where we go next but he is for sale - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Kodi Red showed us plenty early on but he was just very green in his races, but every time he ran he showed more and today was the first time he looked really professional. He has always looked like a nice horse - Adrian Murray, trainer

runners.name: Captain Vallo
runners.comment: Won over this trip at Newcastle in January and has remained in form; in the mix once more
runners.spotlight: Won over this trip at Newcastle in January and has remained in form, beaten 1l at Doncaster two weeks ago; has run creditably here and should be in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Ribble Radiant
runners.comment: 0-10 since debut win over 7.4f; David Allan jumps ship; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-10 since debut win over 7.4f in June 2023; only eighth of 13 here (7f) last month and now runs in a sprint for the first time; David Allan jumps ship; others preferred.

runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.comment: Suited by drop to 6f when scoring at Leicester; may be capable of better yet; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Not an instant success for Dylan Cunha this year but evidently well suited by drop to a stiff 6f when scoring at Leicester (good) three weeks ago; this will be a sharper test but he's in form and may be capable of better still; shortlisted.

runners.name: Gis A Sub
runners.comment: Went close on reappearance at Wolverhampton and was hampered early next time; respected
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on a summer win at Ripon last year, but he went close on reappearance at Wolverhampton (6f) and was then hampered at an early stage at Doncaster last time; respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Goodwood was a cock-up, and it was my fault, but Gis A Sub has run a great race today. He has a huge stride and I told Kevin to let him use it. He did everything right and showed he's a very good horse. We've already had a board meeting and decided to wait until October and the Criterium de Maisons-Laffitte, a race we've won before - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Spindrifter Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gis A Sub is still a bit babyish and was half pulling up in front. He'll be a better horse when getting a lead in a better race. I think there's an awful lot to come from him and races like the Gimcrack would definitely be on the agenda - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very talented two-year-old who then found it hard when he was set some big tasks last year. He's grown and strengthened again over the winter and is back down to a very workable mark now. It would be good to see him in the big Saturday handicaps. 03-05-23

This fellow has plenty of ability as he showed last year when second in the Gimcrack Stakes, but unfortunately he tends to hold a lot back for himself. He has been a bit disappointing this season but has an entry in the Commonwealth Cup and I think we will fit him with cheekpieces to try to encourage him to put his best foot forward. 15-06-22

runners.name: So Grateful
runners.owner: The Mick & David Easterby Racing Group
runners.comment: Didn't give his running after awkward start last time but no surprise if he bounces back
runners.spotlight: Didn't give his running after an awkward start last time but he was in decent form on the AW through the winter and he has a win on quick turf too; no surprise if he bounces back.

quotes.race: Napoleons Casino Bradford Handicap
quotes.quote: Good ride wasn't it? It's alright having the idea but you've got to follow it through and Shane (Gray) didn't go too fast. When you go out on a limb it's easy to get the fractions wrong and he didn't do that. I think the only reason So Grateful won is because of the tactics we took on, so the handicapper should drop us for that! - David Easterby, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Calafrio
runners.comment: Strong-traveller who often goes close, placed over C&D two starts ago; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Strong-traveller who often goes close, placed over C&D and at Nottingham (both good to firm) on last two starts; likely to be delivered late and high on the list.

runners.name: Heroism
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: 0-17 since debut win in August 2022; seems out of form and difficult to recommend
runners.spotlight: 0-17 since debut win in August 2022; seems out of form (has beaten just one rival on last two starts) and difficult to recommend.

stable_tour.quote: He's another one who physically has done very well over the winter and, while he wasn't quite up to the task in Group company last year, I'm hopeful he can grow in confidence in handicaps to start with this season. He definitely needs a firmer surface. 02-05-23

runners.name: Better

prev_owners.owner: D Mann, Mrs C Hopper & G Shields

runners.comment: Best efforts have come on Tapeta and his turf record (eight races) is not persuasive
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have come on Tapeta and his turf record (eight races) is not persuasive; yard has more obvious contender in Gis A Sub.

runners.name: Juryman
runners.comment: Long time since he showed his form but had excuse on reappearance and can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on 2023 form (won over 7f); unable to get competitive during truncated campaign last year and met trouble on reappearance (40-1); carries obvious risks and may not have enough speed for this drop back to 6f, but he has tumbled in the weights and can't be ruled out entirely.

runners.name: Hurstwood
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing
runners.comment: Hard to predict on AW this winter, below par last two starts; record at Thirsk is poor
runners.spotlight: Hard to predict on AW this winter, below par last two starts; tends to pop up every now and then on turf, but his record at Thirsk is poor.

quotes.race: Brittains Beverages British EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Hurstwood is very hardy and genuine. On his next run we're going to step him up to six furlongs and see how he gets on - David Armstrong, owner.

runners.name: Flavius Titus
runners.comment: Veteran who was last of 11 at Newcastle on belated reappearance; others appeal more.
runners.spotlight: Veteran who was last of 11 at Newcastle (28-1) on belated reappearance; others appeal more.

quotes.race: RWS/Strawberry Fields Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Flavius Titus tries very hard and seems to be improving. He loves the Newmarket tracks - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys TBA Handicap
quotes.quote: Flavius Titus is a fun horse to have around. He likes fast ground and 6f and we might come back for a race at the Guineas meeting - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red Casino/EBFstallions.com Novice Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Flavius Titus and he's got better with every run. It rode like a good maiden, they went a decent gallop, there were a few fancied horses, but he's got a great manner, he's done everything right and he's just improved. Hopefully there's more to come - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.name: John Kirkup
runners.comment: 10yo; arrives here after two respectable runs at Redcar; each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is without a win since October 2023; however, he arrives here after two respectable runs at Redcar (6f/5f); each-way possibilities.

quotes.race: Sam Hall Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup was due a win as he's been unlucky all season. He got his ground and he always shows his best - David Thompson, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit goracinginyorkshire.com Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup loves these conditions and it was a good idea to drop him back to five furlongs on this stiff track. He travelled into it well and got the splits at the right time - Connor Beasley, rider.

quotes.race: Tomrods Steel Stockholders Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup could be one for the Two-Year-Old Trophy at Redcar and he's likely to run in another nursery before then. He can go over five or six furlongs but wants give in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Edmundson Cabletech Carlisle Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup got shuffled back and to finish like he has is a fair effort particularly with his penalty. He won't run without a bit of cut in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In HD Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup ran with the choke out first time at Ayr and we've brought him back to a stiff five furlongs and got him behind horses and he's dropped his head. He's quite a nice horse and has done it nicely on ground he has enjoyed - Michael Dods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another old warrior with a decent wins to runs ratio and he goes particularly well for Connor Beasley. The thing with John is that you can not have the ground soft enough for him. We took a gamble running him at Ayr last month as the rains were forecast, thankfully it arrived and he won for the eighth time. However, last time out at Thirsk it was good ground which is too quick for him. 10-08-21

runners.name: Miss Rainbow
runners.comment: 0-19 and exposed but showed up well long way on reappearance; could make the frame
runners.spotlight: 0-19 and thoroughly exposed but she showed up well for long way on reappearance at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last month; could make the frame.

stable_tour.quote: She looked good as a two-year-old and she ran brilliantly on her final start last season when second behind the now 74-rated Moyola. However, I think we just bottomed her a bit by running her on heavy going on her first turf race of the season at Catterick in April when she was third behind Shelbourne. Although she ran really well, she's never run the same race since, but now she has chances off 46. She could go to Redcar on Saturday. 22-08-24

2:45.race_name: Josh Mullins Rules Supreme Handicap (Div II)
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 10.8)
2:45.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Muker
runners.comment: Narrow winner of a C&D handicap 2 weeks ago, suited by the fast pace; respected up 2lb
runners.spotlight: He had made a slow start to this campaign but he showed he retained a good chunk of ability when picking up the pieces in a strongly-run C&D handicap two weeks ago; 2lb rise manageable and there shouldn't be a shortage of pace for him to run at this time either.

quotes.race: Download The ITV App British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Muker's form has worked out well and he'll go for the Molecomb in three weeks. He's all speed - but for a horse with so much speed he has a great mind. - Paul Mulrennan, rider

quotes.race: Betway / British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: Muker was supposed to go to Doncaster, he was ready to go the first day and Phil's done a good job to keep him ticking along nicely until now. He's been really good at home, we've done plenty with him and we make sure they know their job, which he did today. He's been really professional and he couldn't have done it nicer. The owner will be absolutely thrilled to go to Ascot, if he won or ran well today that was the plan. - Sammy Jo Bell, partner of winning trainer Philip Makin

runners.name: Changeofmind
runners.comment: Could yet fulfil early promise but fast ground is a query and he's been off for 199 days
runners.spotlight: Looked a classy prospect early in his career but things haven't gone smoothly in recent seasons; last summer's Hamilton second (5f, heavy) came off a 6lb higher mark though and his subsequent defeats were in good company; drops in class for his reappearance but suspicion he could do with rain.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Changeofmind is very exciting and one we rate a lot at home. He has lots of ability and natural talent. He'll go for the Westow Stakes next month at the Dante meeting. We'll take it one step at a time and keep our feet on the ground - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Curious Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Promising return to action but failed to back it up last time; career best needed
runners.spotlight: All wins on good or slower but effective on good to firm; ran well at Musselburgh on his seasonal return but couldn't back it up returned to that track two weeks ago; likely a career best will be needed.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Glorious Gallop Gala Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: William (Pyle) said Curious River took him there and did it easily. He's won a couple of races now and seems to be getting quicker - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Dave Watson Memorial/EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Curious Rover is a nice horse. He didn't show as much speed as that when we first got him so we started him off over a bit further but he's probably a right sprinter. He's learned his job nicely and progressed each time so it's perfect. We'll probably look for something under a penalty now, he's going to get a stiff enough mark - Katie Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very fast gelding who won twice as a two-year-old and this season ran an absolute cracker when fifth in the 3YO Dash at Epsom on Derby day behind Blue Storm, proving that he has trained on. He was just a bit lost for a few seconds in the dip and lost momentum. Without that he could have been third, but it was still a huge run and he now goes to Chester at the end of the month - he'll take some stopping provided he gets a good draw. 14-06-24

runners.name: Burning Cash
runners.owner: C Priestley, M Hammond & D Flynn
runners.comment: Won this race last year off 3lb higher; shaping up for something better in 2 runs in 2025
runners.spotlight: Won the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 3lb higher mark (good to firm); not beaten many home but hasn't run that badly in either start this year; no surprise to see him in the thick of it.

stable_tour.quote: He was a really good two-year-old, but because that the handicapper got hold of him. He had nearly a year off and then last season, like some of the others, he wasn't quite 100 per cent. But he's come back and run some solid races this time - his second at Newcastle in February behind a horse of Godolphin's was an excellent run. He's been a little bit in and out but I thought he did well to win at Thirsk last month. In the good sprint there last time he missed the start a little bit but ran on and hit the line strongly to finish fifth, so you can mark that run up. He can win off his current rating and hopefully he'll pay his way again. He might go to Newcastle on Friday, but I'm not sure he'll get in. If he doesn't go there, he'll go to Beverley or somewhere like that in the near future. 28-06-24

runners.name: Ready Freddie Go

prev_owners.owner: Ownaracehorse Ltd, K West & O Pears

runners.comment: Conditions to suit, on a good mark and blinkers return; a big run looks on the cards
runners.spotlight: Easy to back and finished well beaten here two weeks ago but that race was set up for the closers; blinkers back on today and this multiple C&D winner needs serious consideration.

runners.name: Castan
runners.comment: Three AW wins this year; good third on turf latest; in the mix with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Did well on AW when the cheekpieces first went on, winning at Southwell in January and following that with two Newcastle successes; bounced back from a couple of lesser efforts when finishing third at Beverley 12 days ago (5f, good to firm; runner-up Frank The Spark runs in the 2.10); repeat would see him in the shake up.

quotes.race: Josh Mullins Rules Supreme Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I couldn't believe his price. Castan kept going out and I thought I must have got something wrong. He's tough and he loves his racing - Bryan Smart, trainer.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Castan has always had loads of speed, but as a two-year-old he was the biggest hooligan I've had in my life! He just took a long time to get mentally right after a break. As soon as you touch the blindfold he comes out of the stalls like a greyhound. They all came at him and he fought back. Hopefully he can give us a big payout someday - Bryan Smart, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Start Racing TV Free Trial Now Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Castan did it nicely and Kevin never hit him. He said all day long that Castan would win these types of races and I'm delighted for the owners - Bryan Smart, trainer.

runners.name: Stash The Cash
runners.owner: Hp Racing Stash The Cash & Ptr
runners.comment: Three wins last year on slower than good; promising return last month; ground a query
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year (5f, heavy-good to soft) and reappeared with fair fifth of 14 at Musselburgh (5f, good) five weeks ago; could build on that and be in the mix if the forecast fast ground isn't an issue.

stable_tour.quote: He had a few little issues and was very hard to train last year, and he got himself handicapped because of that. But we've been really pleased with him this year and he won well at Catterick first time. 23-04-24

runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Had a wide draw when down the field at Beverley latest; better expected today
runners.spotlight: Poor draw at Beverley last month and that isn't the run to judge him on; has run well over C&D in the past and he's handicapped to go well.

quotes.race: Book Tickets For Ladies Night @hamilton-park.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Ruth (Carr) just said to me, "I can't get Digital any better than he is, he's in real good form." - jockey Paul Mulrennan, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I've always held him in high regard. He jumped a little keen at Newbury and taking him back was probably the wrong thing to do. He hit the line well when third over six furlongs at Southwell so we have the option of that trip but he'll probably stay over five for now. He goes to York this week. 10-05-22

He came from Karl Burke at about this time last year and has won twice for us, both times at Hamilton, a course he likes. I was pleased with his run at Wolverhampton last week, even though he was only fifth of nine. He wants either a stiff 5f or an easy 6f. 09-04-25

runners.name: Albegone
runners.owner: D B & Mrs C Lamplough & Partner
runners.comment: Closely matched with Muker on recent C&D form; slower ground optimal though
runners.spotlight: Just behind Muker when third over C&D two weeks ago, picking up strongly against the stands' rail; has form on good to firm but all his wins have come on good or slower.

7:01.race_name: Chemique Adhesives 40th Anniversary Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Minella Rescue
runners.comment: 50-1 second in Grade 1 novice in April but soundly beaten in Listed race since
runners.spotlight: Excelled himself when coming from a long way off the pace to take second in Grade 1 at last month's Aintree festival (3m, good) but may have been flattered by the way that race panned out and was soundly beaten in Perth Listed race three weeks later; could be vulnerable under top weight on handicap return.

quotes.race: Oddschecker Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Rescue was a little unlucky last time. We came here thinking that if everything went well for us, he may be top six. We thought 100/1 was a bit embarrassing, so the owners helped themselves to a bit of that. He wants good ground. Now it's out in the open - everyone knows about him. He's got three weeks left as a novice, so it's very tempting to go in a 0-120 novice, but Sean [Bowen] said he had a hard race today, so if he's ok, we'll run him again, and if he isn't, he'll have to wait and run in a handicap. We've got a little race mapped out for him at Galway, at the festival. His jumping's a bit sloppy to go chasing so that might be a bit of a slow burner. He's got a big engine, and that normally counts for most things - Gary Hanmer, trainer.

quotes.race: Grace & Dotty Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Rescue looks exceptional. He was recommended to me by some good scouts and Terence was also very complimentary. I think he's everything they've said he'd be. I've got my eye on the bumper at Aintree but we'll take it day by day so we'll see. We've schooled him and he jumps well but I don't want to run over hurdles until we've exhausted the bumper route. It's very exciting - Gary Hanmer, trainer.

runners.name: Secret Trix
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; not at best when last seen in autumn; still on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Gained two of his six hurdling wins over C&D and will be suited by today's good ground; not at best when last seen in the autumn, though, and is still on a fairly tough mark.

quotes.race: New Racing TV App Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It felt like Secret Trix benefited from a break, he jumped well and travelled well - Sean Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Drywall Contracts National Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Secret Trix keeps progressing with age and time, and hopefully his winning run isn't over yet. He jumped well on the whole and won with a bit up his sleeve - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Buckos Boy
runners.comment: In very good form last spring/summer (including after a layoff); could have a say
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with comfortable win at Worcester (2m7f, good) last June and made the frame on his next three outings (twice over C&D); returns from latest absence on career-high mark but good 3lb claimer Joe Anderson is enlisted; no surprise if he features.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bucko's Boy has run consistently well since and I think the wind operation has had improvement. He won very nicely at Newton Abbot, but probably by too far as he took a big rise in the handicaps - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has won a bumper, a novice hurdle and this summer a handicap hurdle by 18 lengths at Newton Abbot. He's very consistent, having been in the first four in his last six races. He'll have a break over the winter when the ground turns and we'll mix and match over hurdles and fences in the spring. 05-10-22

runners.name: West To The Bridge
runners.comment: Didn't run badly over 2m4f here this month but all ten wins were on soft or heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Veteran who responded well to refitted cheekpieces when scoring at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February, his tenth hurdling success; didn't run badly when fourth of seven here (2m4f, good) a fortnight ago and will be fine over today's trip but would appeal much more on slower ground.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: West To The Bridge has loads of ability and settled nicely today - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Lindop Toyota Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was quite impressed with that. I've been wanting to front-run with West To The Bridge for a while but we've always been in a race where there's too much pace. If he can go and do that again we might think about something more fancy - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Heed Your Hunch Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I've been the beneficiary of what's happened - it was a messy race with a lot going on - and we've come out the right side of it. West To The Bridge is very keen and is his own worst enemy. When he learns to settle, he'll be all right - Harry Skelton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very consistent old boy and I'd love to win one more with him, which would take him into double figures. I don't know where that will be but he'd need soft ground. He may be getting on in years but he still absolutely loves his job. 12-11-24

runners.name: Farnoge
runners.comment: Promising novice hurdler in 2023-24 season; disappointed in both chases last term
runners.spotlight: Disappointed in both chases during very light campaign last season but looked very promising as a novice hurdler (including on good ground) during the 2023-24 campaign and it will be interesting to see whether he can get his career back on track now back over hurdles after a break.

quotes.race: Bet With Ascot Donation Box Scheme Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure how well I was going because I didn't know how good Farnoge was. I gave him a squeeze turning in and it felt like he shot clear of the rest and just idled in front after the second-last and I had to get going again. It's a fair performance with a 5lb penalty, he's obviously a very good horse. It's probably a bold statement but I could see him being a Graded horse. I'll have to get home and chat to the boss and see what he thinks, but he's very smart. It's exciting - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Elite Each-Way Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Farnoge was very professional and held a strong stride all the way to the line. You couldn't ask for anything more than that on his first time on the racecourse. He's a lovely young horse - Bryony Frost, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit disappointing on his chasing debut at Wetherby on Friday. I could see after they'd jumped two fences that the ground was a bit too quick for him and he wasn't enjoying it. Last season he quickly developed into a very useful novice hurdler. The wheels came off in the Challow, when he failed to act on the heavy ground, and I felt he was struggling with his wind when again pulled up at Musselburgh next time, so he had a breathing operation over the summer. We'll wait for a drop of rain before trying again. 04-11-24

runners.name: Wa Wa
runners.comment: Stayed on well to score at Perth last month, his third start for Olly Murphy; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 10yo who came good for Olly Murphy at third attempt, staying on to score from off the pace at Perth (3m2f, good to soft; first run after wind op) last month; should be fine on the faster ground here; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Home Builders Supporting St. Mary's GAA Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Wa Wa stays well, the further he went the better. He liked the ground and kept going, he will go further going forward and is going the right way - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer

runners.name: Mackenberg
runners.comment: Multiple winner at up to 2m5f but none since 2022 and the last year or so hasn't gone well
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner at up to 2m5f but none since 2022 and the last year or so hasn't gone well; this belated step up to 3m (having run over 2m last time) is perhaps more in hope than expectation.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mackenberg is a nice horse, I was very happy with that. But he's still very raw and we won't rush him - Donald McCain, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was an impressive winner on his hurdles debut at Carlisle this month, pulling well clear up the hill. He won his bumper there last season and then got stuck in the mud at Bangor. We'll probably find another hurdle with a penalty and then there's a Listed race at Haydock next month. 09-11-20

He is a horse I have a lot of time for he always gives so much in his races - in fact he has won nine of his 18 starts with a couple of seconds and thirds. Clearly he is useful having won five of his six chases, but he did actually struggle to jump fences when he started, but he has had a lot of practice since and has done tremendously well. His most recent run, when fifth at Doncaster, was far and away the most competitive race he has run in but I think now he is better over 2m4f and on good ground they went very fast last time, although I was very encouraged with how strongly he ran on from the back of the last. He wants soft ground over 2m4f and this talented individual has more improvement to come. 09-02-23

runners.name: Champagnesuperover
runners.comment: Hereford winner off 6lb lower; beaten in a claimer latest when up against it at weights
runners.spotlight: Exploited his reduced mark to justify favouritism at Hereford (3m1f, soft) in February and faced no easy task when beaten in a match last time (2m5f claiming chase); only 6lb higher than for that recent win which was fairly authoritative.

quotes.race: Star Sports Veterans' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought Champagnesuperover would win the last day and he unseated. He's not the force of old but he'd come back down to a mark where he could be competitive and he's still genuine and still has an appetite for racing, when plenty of older horses don't. He's come back down to a grade where he can be competitive and I wasn't surprised to see him win. He had a tendon injury which put him out for 18 months and a lot of horses don't come back the same from that - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He really got back on track over his last two runs and seems in very good form. It took a while to work out his trip but he's a real staying type. He pulled two front shoes off last time and it was a race to just put a line through, but he'll target some nice handicap chases over two miles and six furlongs or thereabouts. 27-10-22

runners.name: Tiger Orchid
runners.comment: Off last summer's winning mark and respectable effort back from a break at Bangor
runners.spotlight: Five of seven wins at Worcester; respectable effort back from a break at Bangor (3m, soft; fine on good) and he's off last summer's winning mark.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing HD Virgin 535 Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward. Dr Newland was quite keen to keep it simple, there was no pace so Tiger Orchid could go forward and do it himself - thankfully he's kept his head in front - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.name: Earth Cry
runners.comment: Three-time hurdle winner; close third on chase debut after a lengthy break
runners.spotlight: The winner of two bumpers and three hurdles; likes good ground; jumped well on recent chase debut at Ffos Las (3m, good to soft) and was beaten just over 3l; that was after 202 days away, so there is good reason to believe he can improve again.

stable_tour.quote: I bought him from Jim Ryan, a good friend of mine in Ireland, and I think we have acquired a nice one. He was bred to be a Flat horse and has shown plenty of ability in his two bumpers, winning each time, including the last day at Market Rasen when defying his penalty when staying on strongly. I know this might sound funny with a two from two record, but I have never had him properly right. We discovered he had issues with ulcers and worms and thankfully is looking as healthy now as I have ever had him. He could be nice, and the plan is to go for a bumper at Cheltenham later this month. 13-10-22

runners.name: Enjoy Dallen
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.comment: Winless since 2021 and finished well beaten over hurdles on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Nothing like as good as he was and was sold out of Ciaran Murphy's yard for 6,500gns in February; winless since 2021 and finished well beaten over hurdles on stable debut.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Enjoy D'Allen has the makings of a lovely horse, we've known that. He improved from the last day, confidence-wise more than anything. He really galloped to the line today. He impressed me. He hits a flat spot, maybe at the third or fourth last, but with more racing that won't happen. He'll be some horse at the end of the year. He seems to go on any ground. We'll keep him going as a novice - Ciaran Murphy, trainer

runners.name: Muskoka
runners.comment: Continued to run well since winning by clear daylight at Hereford in December
runners.spotlight: 1-5 over fences and continued to run well since winning by clear daylight at Hereford in December (3m1f, good to soft); jumping was a bit scratchy in a small field on his return from wind surgery and now tries cheekpieces; in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't right last season but he came out and travelled like a nice horse on his debut over hurdles at Hereford. He's going to need further than two miles but I think he's got a chance of winning a novice and his fair share of races. 22-11-23

He wants nicer ground. It was a good run at Wincanton last week, from what we could see in the fog, but it was tacky ground there and he'd won well at Hereford, where the ground was nicer. He has a good mindset and will keep improving. He's learning and, as the ground gets better, so will he. 29-01-25

runners.name: Imperial Alex
runners.comment: Not in the best of form winter just gone and shown a preference for slow ground
runners.spotlight: Three successive wins last year included one over C&D but was below par the winter just gone (latest second was remote) and he's shown a preference for slow ground.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed Daily At Vickers.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The race at Chepstow fell apart and Tom (Lacey, trainer) has done the right thing because Imperial Alex was due to go up 12lb in the handicap - Stan Sheppard, jockey.

quotes.race: Capital Windscreens Supports Autism Charity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The tempo of the race suited Imperial Alex as he's always been a bit keen, but they went a nice gallop and he settled lovely and jumped brilliantly the whole way; he didn't miss a beat. I'd say the race slightly fell apart but he's done it really well in the end. Some of his form is really good and he's fallen in today, it was about his turn - Stan Sheppard, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: De Tellers Fortune
runners.comment: All his best form is on good ground, which he's not had in two of last three races
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden hurdle on good ground and had the same conditions when making a successful chase debut at Taunton (2m7f) and when second of three at Wetherby in March; his pull-ups on either side of that were in the mud; back on this surface he should have a part to play.

stable_tour.quote: He's a point-to-point winner who got off the mark over hurdles at Ffos Las in May. He's undoubtedly a chaser in the making, but I'm not sure when we do that. He does want better ground and I expect he'll stay further than two and a half miles, although that would be the optimum at the moment. 22-10-24

runners.name: Heroique De Maulde
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulde
runners.comment: Pushed up 8lb for winning at Kelso (2m7f, good) but he was well on top
runners.spotlight: Pushed up 8lb for winning at Kelso (2m7f, good) but he was well on top and won off a higher mark for his previous yard; good chance.

5:55.race_name: Ant Stanway Final Furlong Stag Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Walk On High
runners.comment: Back to his best for Newton Abbot win latest (2m3f, heavy); very different ground here.
runners.spotlight: Easy Newton Abbot maiden winner in the returning hood latest (2m3f, heavy), running back up to his previous best form level; more on under a penalty, but player assuming good ground is coped with.

runners.name: At Mangan Bridge
runners.comment: Not really built on Irish point second (3m, good) over here subsequently; rules debut.
runners.spotlight: Brother of Miss Goldfire (races in the 5:20); hasn't really been seeing out 3m as well in his most recent British pointing outings as he had in Ireland last December (good), shorter trip probably the way to go for now, but passed over on rules debut nevertheless.

runners.name: Ilestdancingspirit
runners.comment: Almost defied a 22-month absence at Market Rasen latest; return to good ground seems fine.
runners.spotlight: Didn't want for fitness on March's return from 22 months out at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft), only just missing out in a protracted duel, and coped fine with good ground before his layoff; chance.

runners.name: Jumper Watt
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Raoult
runners.comment: 2m4f Alnwick maiden point winner 475 days ago (soft); realistic reintroduction here.
runners.spotlight: From the family of Edelweis Du Moulin; absent since pretty impressive 12l winner of a 2m4f Alnwick maiden point (soft) for Kelly Morgan in January 2024, but reappearing at a realistic level if all's well with him.

runners.name: Knightsbridge
runners.comment: Present optimum may take more than a run to determine; tongue-tie fitted on debut.
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros 3yo nephew of bumper/AQPS, Flat and 2m-2m6f jumps winners; no surprise if his present optimum needs aren't immediately clear, and possibly a concern the tongue-tie goes on right away, but market can help place his chance relative to stablemate Ilestdancingspirit.

runners.name: Luwdvig
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.comment: Better with practice in bumpers; 40l sixth on hurdle bow; non-runner on good ground since.
runners.spotlight: Better RPRs with each successive bumper start offers hope of similar uplift on March's hurdles debut 40l sixth (2m3f, good to soft); missed this month's intended first run since on good ground deemed unsuitable.

7:31.race_name: Falcon Scaffold Midlands Optimum Handicap Chase

runners.name: Isholo Du Vivien
runners.comment: In the mix judged on Cartmel win and Stratford second; possibilities if fit after absence
runners.spotlight: Off for over eight months but comes into the reckoning on his Cartmel win (2m5f, good) last June and his second at Stratford (2m6f, good) in September; still could be unexposed as a chaser.

runners.name: Shadows In The Sky

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.comment: Out of sorts when last seen for Chris Grant but stable switch could spark a return to form
runners.spotlight: Form-figures of PPP hardly inspire confidence but he's only 1lb higher than when scoring in clearcut style at Hexham (2m4f, good) last autumn for Chris Grant; if a stable switch since his last run sparks a return to form, he should go very close under optimum conditions.

runners.name: Special Dragon
runners.comment: Badly hampered when third at Haydock; youngest in line-up and commands major respect
runners.spotlight: Sole win over hurdles came with similar trip and ground, and she showed she'll be just as effective over fences when third of seven at Haydock (kept on again after being badly hampered) four weeks ago; the youngest in the line-up and commands major respect.

runners.name: Rock On Rita
runners.comment: Turned things round with ready Fakenham win but soundly beaten twice since
runners.spotlight: Turned things round with ready win in small field at Fakenham (2m5f, good to soft) in March but ran badly at Bangor (2-1 favourite) next time; safely held after racing too freely at Fontwell on Thursday; hard to predict.

runners.name: Kings Justice
runners.comment: Mostly running respectably this year but held by Special Dragon on recent Haydock form
runners.spotlight: Mostly running respectably this year but looks held by Special Dragon on Haydock form four weeks ago and others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.name: Orion Daubrelle
runners.comment: Veteran; no show for current yard; has tumbled in weights but others are safer
runners.spotlight: Useful for Willie Mullins in Ireland but lightly raced and generally disappointing since; has tumbled in the weights and market support would be significant (big odds and out of the frame on both starts for current yard) but others are safer.

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Paul found himself in a pocket the whole race as he thought they were going to go much faster but they didn't go a good gallop. When he switched out the horse seemed to find another gear. He's improved and hopefully can go on from here and win a few more chases. He's got a lovely pedigree - Willie Mullins, trainer

runners.name: Even Break
runners.comment: Doesn't have much worthwhile form and pulled up on chasing debut; difficult to recommend
runners.spotlight: Doesn't have much worthwhile form and was pulled up on chasing debut last autumn; difficult to recommend.

runners.name: Higgs
runners.comment: Dual 3m chase winner last spring; hit and miss since, comfortably held last two starts
runners.spotlight: Dual 3m chase winner this time last year; hit and miss since, and although third on his last two starts he's been comfortably held at the line.

quotes.race: Double Delight Hat-Trick Heaven At totesport.com Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Higgs is still learning and should improve again. I did not think he might handle this sticky ground, but he has done well and we will keep him going for another run or two before he has a summer break - Sarah-Jayne Davies, trainer.

5:20.race_name: Pump House 25th Anniversary Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Miss Goldfire
runners.owner: Harry Fry Racing Syndicate Miss Goldfire
runners.comment: Confidence-boosting Fontwell mares' novice win latest (2m5f); longer trip is no issue.
runners.spotlight: Fontwell mares' novice win last time under Ciaran O'Shea (2m6f, good) was no improvement on her previous best, but didn't need to be; returns to handicaps with nothing in hand of her mark, but entitled to have derived a confidence boost from that win; this trip is proven within range.

stable_tour.quote: She won on her debut at Wetherby and showed a really good attitude. She could run in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham in November as she's only four and she'd have to run under a penalty in a normal bumper. We could look at all those black-type bumpers this season and I'm not in a hurry to go over hurdles with her. She seems to have progressed over the summer. 04-10-23

runners.name: Chatshow Host
runners.comment: Back to form with last month's Bangor third; quicker ground not a plus in the past.
runners.spotlight: Went with renewed vim fitted with cheekpieces at Bangor last month (retained here), that additionally representing her best effort yet on good to soft under rules; replication of previous efforts on this even quicker going won't suffice.

runners.name: Hardy Buck

prev_owners.owner: Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate/W G Hanly
Global Bird In The Hand Syndicate

runners.comment: Doesn't always finish strongly; have to hope visor helps him tease out resources longer.
runners.spotlight: Compromised more than once since the autumn by problems with sustaining an effort to the line, and a drop right back to 2m latest didn't prove the answer; have to hope visor helps him tease out resources longer.

runners.name: Stylia
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Croix Sonnet Et Al
runners.comment: Better for the return to this sort on handicap debut latest, but mark still on high side.
runners.spotlight: Immediately better for the return to a stayers' trip and good ground when third on last month's Plumpton handicap debut, albeit looking as if in need of greater respite than the 1lb drop she's received; blinkers added.

runners.name: Leader Wing
runners.comment: Fourth in slowly run 3m2f affair latest; consistent granted good ground at the moment.
runners.spotlight: Consistency has returned with the good ground, this month's half-length fourth at Kelso another sterling effort if not irrefutable proof he gets a stayers' trip (moderately run affair); more to like than some.

runners.name: Tis But A Scratch
runners.comment: Neck second in this race last year from further out of the weights; chance on that basis.
runners.spotlight: Pulled up behind Hardy Buck at Fakenham around Christmas, but a solid recent first outing since took his C&D record to 323, including a neck second in this race last year from further out of the weights.

runners.name: Whispering Royal
runners.comment: Further 5lb drop gives mark a realistic look at last; step up to 2m4f looks worth a go.
runners.spotlight: Beaten over 16l at Kempton latest and yet to fire for this yard, although mark now looks much more realistic following a further 5lb drop; step up to 2m4f looks worth a go for one who stayed 1m6f on the Flat.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whispering Royal got an easy lead and put his experience from Wincanton to good use. I'm not sure how much depth there was to the race, we'll find out in a few weeks' time, but he didn't do anything wrong - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running with promise on the Flat and I was keen to get him started over hurdles earlier this month at Chepstow until all the rain came. Soft ground will be fine but I didn't want to start him on heavy. He's a straightforward horse and we should have a lot of fun with him. He may make his hurdling debut at Wincanton on Sunday. 25-10-23
I hope we'll have some fun with him over hurdles as he's shown promise on the Flat, and he started by finishing third at Wincanton last month. That experience will bring him on plenty. 10-11-23

runners.name: Present Fair
runners.comment: Jumped left and didn't settle, but still won at Bangor latest; quicker conditions await.
runners.spotlight: Cashed in a career-low mark at Bangor latest (2m4f, good to soft) despite jumping left and not settling; remains winless on this good ground, albeit from limited opportunities.

runners.name: Red Windsor
runners.comment: Laid down fair marker on return and remains on a career-low mark; among the likeliest.
runners.spotlight: Big chance on his peak 2022-23 efforts win or lose, and laid down a fair marker on return last month (2m3f, good) despite a wide route; no certainty to back that up, but remains on a career-low mark.

runners.name: Liloo Dores
runners.breeder: S C E A Des Terrains D'Avilly Saint Leon
runners.comment: Possibly bounced last time, and was previously consistent over tonight's sort of trip.
runners.spotlight: Hitherto consistent level of form at this sort of trip, so perhaps best forgiven last month's Perth struggles (may have bounced on second run after a huge layoff); mark unchanged, but drier ground won't concern.

runners.name: Penna Rossa

prev_owners.owner: R Allen, Blythe Hill Racing2, The Crowd

runners.comment: Not yet a copper-bottomed stayer of 2m4f, and has his quirks; stable debut today.
runners.spotlight: Twice held by 1l or less for Keiran Burke last season, but can always throw in a bad one and has the odd quirk; unseen since not quite proving his stamina for 2m4f at Ffos Las in January; stable debut today.

quotes.race: Pinsent Masons Introductory Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We followed Penna Rossa on the Flat because he was Jeff Kidder's half-brother. We took note and got him for 5,000GBP. We always knew he'd be a changed horse over hurdles and he jumped superbly. I was satisfied with his run at Fontwell and decided to come here, not far from home - Camilla Poulton, trainer.

runners.name: Montana Golden
runners.comment: Didn't stay 3m1f on good latest, and intermediate trips may suit better; all is not lost.
runners.spotlight: Couldn't justify favouritism upped to 3m1f at Huntingdon latest, palpably not staying; this intermediate trip may suit better on good (wouldn't settle on last attempt at trip/ground combination), and he could be on a rather higher mark on last summer's bumper form.

runners.name: Cher Monsieur
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Again beaten a long way out on last month's handicap debut (2m, soft); hood now goes on.
runners.spotlight: Placed on both Irish pointing completions but finding hurdling a less rewarding experience thus far, again beaten a long way out on last month's handicap debut (2m, soft); plenty of work for the hood to do.

runners.name: Rock On Tommy
runners.comment: Flopped latest, but still on a good mark and his three most recent successes came here.
runners.spotlight: Winless beyond 2m but so nearly put that right over Southwell's 2m4.5f in March (good) off 2lb lower; Warwick flop since to forgive, but usually worth a second look around this scene of his past three successes.

runners.name: Highway One O Five
runners.comment: Follow-up last time came over this C&D (good); may well be able to defy an 8lb hike.
runners.spotlight: Confidence never higher following wins in two tactical affairs of late, beating Granny B about 7l over C&D latest (good); 8lb higher in a better race, but plenty in his favour again otherwise.

stable_tour.quote: He's very good at home. If I worked him with our good two-milers like Our Champ and Aucunrisque, he'd have them. But when he's on the track he curls up. Sometimes it's infuriating. He's running off 94 and should be in the 130s. He's such a lovely, genuine horse at home and if we could just get him to put it in he'd be very well handicapped. With horses it's not just about ability - you want them to be sound, have a strong constitution and have the will to want to do it. 26-02-25

runners.name: Maple
runners.owner: R Whitelock, L Clemitson & R Jefferson
runners.comment: Back up 2lb for last time's near-2l Perth second; could do with settling better again.
runners.spotlight: In the frame on all seven hurdles completions without a win (one nose second), and going back up  2lb following Perth second last time is no help; limited margin for error, so could do with learning how to settle better.

runners.name: Portcammon
runners.comment: Seen doing best work late on at Chepstow last time; player on level of Irish bumper form.
runners.spotlight: 8l behind Blackijo Dagrostis at Chepstow latest (2m, good), but actually doing the better late work after being hampered; would prove mightily well handicapped if able to replicate his bumper form for Willie Mullins over hurdles from here on, so of definite interest; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Off To Alabama
runners.comment: Well treated next to the RPR for his bumper debut win, but going wrong way over hurdles.
runners.spotlight: Regressive profile in novice/maiden hurdles; goes handicapping off a really tempting mark judged on the RPR for his big-price bumper debut success, but a bit to take on trust just now.

runners.name: Blackijo Dagrostis
runners.comment: Needs to finish races more strongly; might be able to do that here if settling better.
runners.spotlight: Mostly a weak finisher in maiden points for Nicky Sheppard over the winter; similar story since sent hurdling (2m-2m3f), though definite sense of late that he has a small event in him if settling better.

runners.name: Granny B
runners.comment: Weighted to reverse last time's near-7l C&D third with Highway One O Five; races freely.
runners.spotlight: Revived up to a point with this month's near-7l C&D third to Highway One O Five (good), again racing too freely but keeping on, which isn't a given with her; big swing with that rival but no certainty to capitalise.

quotes.race: Celebrating The Life Of Eric Armstrong Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Granny B would run well. She's a bit sensitive to noise so I put the hood on and it seemed to do the trick. I've had her for about a month, I claimed her at Wolverhampton and she only cost 5,000GBP. She's a nice filly and she's got a bit more maturing to do. We'll have a bit of fun with her - Michael Mullineaux, trainer.

1:30.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Dialin For Dollars
runners.comment: Remote third behind Ballydoyle-trained hotpot on debut at Naas (6f) a week ago
runners.spotlight: Bred to be smart; finished remote third behind Ballydoyle-trained hotpot on debut at Naas (6f) a week ago; will need to step up significantly on that to play a part here.

runners.name: Gstaad
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Cost 450,000gns; half-brother to five winners inc' Vandeek; respected on debut
runners.spotlight: Cost 450,000gns; half-brother to five winners inc' Vandeek (6f 2yo inc Group 1 Prix Morny and Middle Park; RPR 117); dam half-sister to smart 7f winner Sirocco Breeze; respected on debut.

runners.name: Invincible Will
runners.comment: Half-brother to Group-placed Coralillo; yard's sole 2yo runner this year won
runners.spotlight: Cost 16,000euros; half-brother to Group-placed 6f 2yo winner Coralillo (RPR 98); dam out of sister to 1m4f Listed winner Royal Devotion; stable's sole 2yo runner this year won; monitor the betting.

runners.name: Namiid
runners.comment: Acclamation colt fetched 80,000euros as yearling; stable second string on jockey bookings
runners.spotlight: Acclamation colt fetched 80,000euros as a yearling; half-brother to five winners inc Family One (French/HK 4.5f-6f inc 2yo Group 2; RPR 111) and Englemere (5f 2yo inc Listed; 92); dam 5f-7f winner (inc 2yo Listed; 103); stable second string on jockey bookings.

runners.name: Venetian Star
runners.comment: Ran green when 7th at the Curragh on debut; Ben Coen prefers to stablemate Namiid
runners.spotlight: Starman colt an 80,000euros yearling; ran green when seventh of 10 over this trip at the Curragh last month on debut (sent off 7-1); improvement likely and Ben Coen prefers to stablemate Namiid.

runners.name: Wind Spirit
runners.comment: Son of Kingman cost 50,000gns as a yearling; dam 5f winner; stable's 2yos always respected
runners.spotlight: Son of Kingman cost 50,000gns as a yearling; closely related to Listed-placed 5f/5.5f winner Air Force Jet (inc 2yo/US dirt; RPR 104), half-brother to three winners; dam 5f winner; stable's 2yos always respected.

runners.name: Dakota Dancer
runners.comment: 15,000euros yearling doesn't have the most enticing profile but Colin Keane is booked
runners.spotlight: Sioux Nation filly cost 15,000euros as a yearling; half-sister to several low-rated winners; dam Listed-placed 6f/7f 2yo winner (97); doesn't have the most enticing profile but Colin Keane is booked.

runners.name: Havana Anna
runners.comment: Havana Grey filly fetched 65,000euros as a yearling; stable can ready one; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Havana Grey filly fetched 65,000euros as a yearling; half-sister to five winners inc' Muscika (prolific 5f-6f inc AW; RPR 98); dam 8.6f AW winner (67), out of 1m2f Listed winner; stable can ready one; shortlisted.

runners.name: Heart And A Half
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs T Stack
runners.comment: Weak in the betting when tailed off at the Curragh (6f) 12 days ago; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Weak in the betting when tailed off at the Curragh (6f) 12 days ago; difficult to recommend on that evidence.

runners.name: Padel Addict
runners.comment: Half-sister to several winners at trips ranging from 1m-15.5f; might find this trip sharp
runners.spotlight: Cost 27,000euros as a foal; 11,000euros yearling; half-sister to several winners at trips ranging from 1m-15.5f; dam 7f (2yo) and 1m4f (Listed) winner (99), half-sister to Group-placed 7f 2yo winner Kirinda; might find this trip on the sharp side.

runners.name: True Love
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Second in 5f Listed contest at the Curragh on debut; bred to get further; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Has no fancy entries but ran an excellent race on debut when second in Listed company at the Curragh (5f, good) 12 days ago when weak in the betting, no match for odds-on favourite Lady Iman late on; she's bred to get further and rates as the one to beat.

2:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Devils Angel

prev_owners.owner: One In A Million Syndicate/B Sheerin/G O'Brien/K Coleman

runners.comment: Eight-time winner who has done a lot of racing since last win in 2022; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner who has done a lot of racing since his last win in 2022; consistent enough on the AW since last October but poor on turf of late; headgear left off this time.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: We couldn't believe the price he was for a horse that won two starts ago. I know Devil's Angel is a bit hit and miss because of his minor issue with the stalls, but he was still a huge price.
