He loves Sandown (won both starts there) and we'll look at a choice of races at the Saturday and Sunday meeting there in two weeks' time - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Score At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good bit of placing. There wasn't much pace on paper so I sat close and Devil's Angel gave me an easy ride. It was the right track to experiment going five and maybe he will stay at that trip now - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Thank You Dr Jerry Hill Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Callum Shepherd has given Devil's Angel a lovely ride as he lugs left when he hits the front. He's the right colour, so the plan is come back for the grey horse handicap next month - Chris Vallice, syndicate spokesman.

runners.name: Platino Bianco
runners.comment: 15-race maiden barely beat a rival on return & always in rear when down the field at Naas
runners.spotlight: This 15-race maiden barely beat a rival on return and always in rear when down the field at Naas last week; probably wants softer ground.

runners.name: Shes Smart

prev_owners.owner: John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans
John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans

runners.comment: 2nd here over 5f (soft) last month; backwards step in two starts since but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Best efforts for this yard have been over 5f at Down Royal but excellent runner-up of 20 here over 5f (soft) last month; backwards step in two starts since but she's not ruled out.

runners.name: Yaxchilan
runners.comment: Drop in trip should suit but he may need more respite from the handicapper
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in maidens for Dermot Weld last year; mild promise on second start for this yard in 7f Curragh handicap on latest; drop in trip should suit but he may need more respite from the handicapper.

runners.name: Zaragoza
runners.comment: Needed the run over an inadequate 5f on return at Naas last week; can improve
runners.spotlight: Won at the Curragh (6.5f, good) off 58 on last season's return and ran well in defeat in big-field handicaps since; probably needed the run over an inadequate 5f on return at Naas last week; can improve.

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate; rattled home well when beaten 0.5l at Naas last week; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-44 and 0-20 on turf; best turf form on slower ground; good fifth of 20 here over 5f last month; didn't get clear run when rattling home well when beaten 0.5l at Naas last week; in the mix again.

runners.name: Lismacbryan Hill
runners.comment: Excellent third of 27 at the Curragh (6f) on latest; this stiffer track might not suit
runners.spotlight: Improved off lowly mark this term, second at Bellewstown before a disappointing fourth over C&D when sent off favourite; excellent third of 27 at the Curragh (6f) on latest; this stiffer track might not suit.

runners.name: Hasiyna
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Best runs came on softer ground that this; stable holds better claims with Stanhope
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; dual AW winner is 0-11 on turf; finished just behind Lismacbryan Hill over C&D last month (Stanhope second); best runs came on softer ground that this; stable holds better claims with Stanhope.

runners.name: Little Mi Mi
runners.comment: Second here last year; Sligo run can be forgiven as she got caught wide; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Is 0-8 on turf; best effort a 1.5l second here (5f, good) last September off 54; now 3lb lower and shaped nicely on seasonal reappearance over C&D; run at Sligo can be forgiven as she got caught wide; each-way chance.

runners.name: Stanhope
runners.comment: Is 4lb higher than last year's win but second over C&D on return with some of these behind
runners.spotlight: Likeable veteran loves it here, as is evidenced by his four course wins, including this race last year off 47; now 4lb higher but finished second over C&D on return with some of these rivals behind; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope is a real stalwart. He was back down to a mark that he could win off. That's his second win, he likes it here and he likes that extended five. We'll have a chat about whether we take it into next year - John McConnell, trainer

quotes.race: Beauparc Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope was in good nick when I got him. He was a bit unlucky in the Rockingham when he was a bit ring-rusty and I was happy he was going to run a big race today - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Indaver Ireland Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope got an absolute peach of a ride. He's in great order. I've never run him beyond six but we might run him at Galway over seven and maybe come back to six for a premier handicap on Champions Weekend - Damian English, trainer.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope looks like he might be a really nice sprinter for up here over the winter. I thought he would need the run but he dug deep - Damian English, trainer.

quotes.race: 188Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope was so unlucky last year and he deserved that. He enjoyed the dig in the ground and the blinkers have helped him concentrate - Micky Quinn, trainer.

runners.name: Times In Oz
runners.comment: Slowly away at Sligo on latest (6f), plugging on late to finish eighth of 14; more needed
runners.spotlight: Is 0-6 on turf; good third in Tipperary maiden for former yard (5f, soft); pulled up in Clonmel maiden hurdle in March; slowly away at Sligo on latest (6f), plugging on late to finish eighth of 14; much more needed.

runners.name: Annie Lavinia
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced behind some good types on sole turf start here (5f) last August; chance
runners.spotlight: Wasn't disgraced behind some good types on sole turf start here (5f) last August; has improved without winning for switch to handicaps on the AW; headgear combination now tried back on turf; respected.

runners.name: Breath Of You
runners.comment: Down the field in two handicaps for current yard; cheekpieces now reached for down in trip
runners.spotlight: Was 0-3 in France, tailed off over 6.5f twice before creditable effort over 8.5f; down the field in two handicaps for current yard; cheekpieces now reached for back down in trip.

runners.name: Micasso
runners.comment: Better run in Dundalk maiden latest; market will reveal expectations on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in three hot turf maidens last year; slightly better in Dundalk maiden but still beaten 10l; market will reveal expectations on handicap debut.

runners.name: Whatswrongnow
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced at Sligo (6f) on latest, beaten 4.5l when caught wide from a high draw
runners.spotlight: No impact in three AW maidens last year for former yard; similar story in three handicaps for this yard, but wasn't disgraced at Sligo (6f) on latest, beaten 4.5l when caught wide from a high draw.

runners.name: Hezahunk

prev_owners.owner: Nigel O'Hare & Philip Smith & Mark Devlin

runners.comment: Big run from tough draw at Sligo when beaten 0.75l in third; big chance with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner is 0-5 on turf; shock 50-1 win under enterprising ride at Dundalk last month before good third there off 4lb higher; got across from wide draw to race prominently at Sligo 13 days ago when beaten 0.75l into third; big chance with a repeat from 1lb higher.

runners.name: Finito Bonito
runners.comment: 12-race maiden was never a factor at Gowran on return; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden's form petered out on the AW at the tail end of last year; best effort a 1.75l fifth at Cork (6f, good to yielding) off 48 in October; never a factor at Gowran on return; others appeal more.

runners.name: James The Second
runners.comment: Fine runs at Gowran of late over further but ground a slight concern as is drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have come on softer ground, notably when second at Gowran (7f, heavy) under this rider on his penultimate run; respectable fourth there on good (1m) on latest (awkward from stalls); contender if the drop in trip isn't an inconvenience.

runners.name: American In Paris
runners.comment: 1-13 on the AW and 2-21 on turf; well handicapped on pick of turf form & can go well fresh
runners.spotlight: 1-13 on the AW and 2-21 on turf; only 2l behind Hasiyna on return at Dundalk after a break in December; poor run there next start; well handicapped on pick of turf form and can go well fresh.

stable_tour.quote: She was extraordinarily green on her debut at Bath when running one of the most eyecatching races of the season. She was slowly away and last at halfway before really picking up in the last quarter-mile. To my eye she made up fully 12 lengths to go down by a short head. If ever the cliché “a winner without a penalty” applied to a horse, it's her. You should watch the video and you won't believe the ground she made up. If she learned anything at Bath her turn will come very soon. 06-07-22

runners.name: Elegant Grand
runners.comment: Below debut promise at Sligo recently; the blinkers tried then are removed

runners.spotlight: Both starts over this trip; not a bad debut effort when beaten 3.75l at Cork but a lesser run when 8.75l behind at Tipperary (keen); tongue-tie on; Colin Keane prefers Lil' Angel.

runners.name: Sci Fi
runners.comment: Beaten approx' 8l both starts; seems the yard first string but improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Beaten 8l in a 7f Dundalk conditions race on debut and a similar distance behind at Sligo over approximately 6f recently; seems the yard first string but improvement needed.

3:15.race_name: Best of Luck On Your Retirement Joey Martin Handicap
3:15.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: The Highway Rat
runners.comment: Failed to see out 6f at Naas last time; back to 5f suits and a squeak if back to form
runners.spotlight: Useful type; five of his six wins have come on AW and is rated 8lb lower on turf; not a bad return at the Curragh but failed to see out 6f at Naas since; back to 5f suits and a squeak if back to form.

quotes.race: Rathkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: The Highway Rat was entitled to win a race like this on his AW form and he did. The second horse came to me and I had to keep him up to his work but I was always comfortable - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Pat Smullen Mercury Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The Highway Rat is only a three-year-old and sprinters tend to improve. He's thriving so well at the moment and is a horse to look forward to. We still have to make our mind up whether we travel over the winter but he is certainly a horse we'll look forward to next year - Andy Oliver, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably come back for the Bold Lad Sprint Handicap on Sunday week at the Curragh. He hasn't run since May as he came out of Naas a bit jarred, which was unusual and disappointing. He's had his break since and is fresh and well. He looks to be fully himself. It's his first run back but he normally runs well fresh. We were going to run him this weekend at Navan but we decided we'd go straight for the Curragh. 11-09-24

runners.name: Merlin The Wizard
runners.comment: Makes debut for a new yard with a hood added; this trip looks a bit sharp
runners.spotlight: Won three times in Britain from 7f-1m in 2023; not as good in three starts last year and makes debut for a new yard with a hood added; this trip looks a bit sharp.

runners.name: Bold Optimist
runners.comment: Was 2.25l behind Cuban Grey at the Curragh on return; should have improved from that
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner ran a fine race on seasonal debut when 2.25l behind Cuban Grey at the Curragh over this trip; should have improved from that and get much closer today.

runners.name: Moral Turpitude
runners.comment: Returns after nearly 11 months away but has attracted a notable rider booking; noted
runners.spotlight: Won a Dundalk 2yo maiden over this trip and two decent runs after, including on turf; returns after nearly 11 months away but has attracted a notable rider booking; blinkers replace cheekpieces; noted.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Moral Turpitude was so unlucky last week but she jumped really well today and it was all the difference. We'll keep her to five - Danny Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Pineapple Island
runners.comment: Last seen in April 2023 and can only be watched back after such an absence
runners.spotlight: Won a Cork maiden over this trip in 2023 and ran a cracker in a Listed race next time, both on testing ground; can only be watched back after such an absence.

runners.name: Emerald Harmony
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Beat Cuban Grey a head at Bellewstown but was 1.5l behind him at the Curragh since
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort beat Cuban Grey a head at Bellewstown but was 1.5l behind him at the Curragh since; up another 1lb today and has to squeeze out a bit more.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Emerald Harmony is improving and learning to sprint. The ground was probably as quick as she wanted it but she is going the right way - Ben Coen, rider

runners.name: Mickey The Steel
runners.comment: Not bad efforts both starts this season but is most effective on easier ground
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner including twice over C&D; not bad efforts both starts this season but is most effective on easier ground so others appeal more.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Handicap
quotes.quote: Mickey The Steel loves that ground and he was just keeping going and going. He did it well - Wesley Joyce, rider

runners.name: Harrys Hill
runners.comment: Form tailed off at the end of last season; lacks a run this term so might just need this
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner including over C&D as a 2yo; his form tailed off at the end of last season and he lacks a run this term so might just come on for this.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Rockingham Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill was disappointing in Tipperary and he was dropped 3lb, we didn't think he would get in. As the week went on we got more positive. We'll see, we might come back next month for the Scurrys - Martin Hassett, trainer

quotes.race: AK Bets "Compare Our Prices To Your Current Bookmaker" Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill was absolutely buzzing and we had to run despite the ground He had been working with Secret Magician. I'm hoping he'll be okay in the morning - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Tipperaryraces On Facebook Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: It's all about the ground with him Harry's Hill. He's won on soft and we've been running him on fast ground. I knew coming here we'd be some way safe. At this level you have to tick all the boxes. The draw didn't help us but he's tough and genuine - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Find Us On Facebook @dundalkstadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry's Hill is a five furlong horse and probably wants soft ground, we thought he would run well. Today was the day - Martin Hassett, trainer

runners.name: Cuban Grey
runners.comment: Improved this year; not as good over 6f at Naas last time but back to 5f suits better
runners.spotlight: Much-improved this year, winning at Dundalk and the Curragh over this trip, in between runner-up to Emerald Harmony at Bellewstown; not as good over 6f at Naas last time but back to 5f suits better and is a player.

quotes.race: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We were delighted to get down here, the Jeep broke down. Cuban Grey was well bought (5,000gns last year out of Murphy/Keady yard) and has now won three for us. He has been consistent of late and hopefully keep improving. I wouldn't mind going for a better race off a light weight - Pat McKenna, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Only Spoofing

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H Mannion, B Carter & F Durbin

runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh last month but not as good there six days later; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Veteran of 96 races with 14 wins; not as good as when at his best but still capable of decent form; won at Musselburgh last month but not as good there six days later; could bounce back.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: We had this planned a long way out and we had the best jockey in the north of Britain on - he doesn't panic. We were going to retire Only Spoofing last year but he's not one for that just yet. He's a tough nut and doesn't think he's 11 - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Bellinter Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing loves this track and trip. He cut out at Naas last day and back to five today suited him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Neptune Investment Management Supports Child Bereavement UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing is improving and came here in good form. He was great today and I think he could win a big one before the end of the year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He can be very buzzy and went to the start early. Sean (Davis) had ridden him before and gave him a very brave ride. He's great value for his 7lb claim and you'd never think he was a claimer watching that ride. I'd imagine Only Spoofing will be coming back to Ireland before the end of the season - Tim Hogg, assistant to Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer of Only Spoofing.

3:50.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Yeats Stakes (Listed Race)
3:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Carmers
runners.comment: Ran out an easy winner in 1m5f Ballinrobe maiden; stable in red-hot form; big chance
runners.spotlight: Wooton Bassett colt's dam is a half-sister to three Group 1 winners at trips ranging from 1m-1m4f; blinkered for belated debut, made a great impression when running out an easy winner in Ballinrobe maiden (1m5f, good) eight days ago; stable in red-hot form; looks sure to go well.

runners.name: Delta
runners.comment: Good run up in trip when beaten a head by Roosevelt at Leopardstown; chance
runners.spotlight: Closely related to Lancashire Oaks winner Queen Of The Pride; dam won the St Leger; never counted on Galway debut last August; better at the Curragh next time; improved tongue-tied up in trip when beaten a head by Irish Derby-entered Roosevelt at Leopardstown (1m4f, good) six days ago; chance.

runners.name: Whats Your Game
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Needs to raise his game to trouble these; ground has to be a worry; Keane prefers Umala
runners.spotlight: One of two for the yard; promise in maidens at Dundalk; improved on handicap debut on second turf start when winning off 75 under Colin Keane at Cork (1m4f, soft) four weeks ago; needs to raise his game to trouble some of these; ground has to be a worry; Keane prefers Umala.

runners.name: Bonnie Moon
runners.comment: Oaks entry; slowly away on debut at Gowran (9.5f) but stayed on nicely for third; improver
runners.spotlight: Proper staying pedigree and looked in need of further when third in a fillies' maiden at Gowran (9.5f, yielding) on debut last month, sluggish out of the stalls but staying on nicely in the closing stages; this is much tougher but she's entitled to improve; holds an Oaks entry.

runners.name: Butterfly Wings
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Much-improved when readily winning 1m2f fillies' maiden at Leopardstown; can improve again
runners.spotlight: Justify filly is out of a half-sister to Giant's Causeway; rather disappointing on her first three starts, including when a beaten favourite at Salisbury and Leopardstown; much-improved when readily winning fillies' maiden at Leopardstown (1m2f, good) six days ago; has scope to improve again up in trip.

quotes.race: It's Family Day At Leopardstown Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Butterfly Wings had run in a couple of very good maidens, and we thought she might have won by now. Hopefully that win will give her the confidence to send her to the next level. Wayne [Lordan, jockey] felt she was grand at that trip, but the best would probably be when she goes up to a mile and a half which gives plenty of options. It's great to get the maiden win and we'll see where she fits in with the other fillies and try to get some black type - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Medici Venus
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Wasn't far back when 4th in Naas Listed (10.5f, good) last week; Lordan prefers stablemate
runners.spotlight: Second runner for the yard; got off the mark in Listowel rated race (1m, yielding) last autumn; ran creditably in Navan Group 3 over 1m2f on return; wasn't too far back when fourth in Naas Listed (10.5f, good) last week but Wayne Lordan prefers Butterfly Wings.

runners.name: Umala

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Nice winner from the front at Dundalk last time out; Colin Keane maintains partnership
runners.spotlight: Cost 120,000euros as a yearling; finished third in 1m Dundalk maiden on debut (form franked) in January, finishing from well off the pace; different tactics employed when a ready winner from the front there (10.5f) last month under this rider; respected.

4:25.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Red Secret
runners.comment: Two AW wins in Britain; ran no race at Listowel when last seen; can go well fresh
runners.spotlight: Long time since his two AW wins in Britain but put in three good shifts after returning from a lay-off late last year; ran no race at Listowel when last seen 236 days ago; can go well fresh.

runners.name: A Mere Bagatelle

prev_owners.owner: D F O'Rourke & Ms Diane O'Rourke

runners.comment: Handles a sound surface & Billy Lee is a top booking for yard that is ticking over nicely
runners.spotlight: Is 4-41 over jumps and 0-4 on the Flat; won 2m2f handicap hurdle at Downpatrick in March; handles a sound surface and Billy Lee is a top booking for yard that is ticking over nicely.

quotes.quote: A Mere Bagatelle won nicely, jumped well apart from a few minor mistakes and I tried to keep it simple. Once I got to the front I wasn't going to take him back on a sharp track like this - Shane Fenelon, rider.

quotes.quote: A Mere Bagatelle jumped brilliant. I have no plans but we'll see what happens, I have the Galway Blazers in the back of my mind because he will gallop all day - John Joseph Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: Makaiah

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Lynne Lyons & Sean Jones & David Spratt

runners.comment: In fine form, second at Sligo on latest when doing best work at the finish; up 3lb; player
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden but has run fine races in defeat on the Flat this year, short of room when runner-up here last month and filling the same spot at Sligo on latest when doing best work at the finish; up 3lb; player.

runners.name: Obama Army
runners.comment: Hasn't won since British wins in 2023; market watch advised on first start for McGuinness
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf in Britain in 2023 and some big runs in defeat on the AW since; below his best at Dundalk in December; has absence to overcome; market watch advised on first start for Ado McGuinness.

runners.name: Fine Print
runners.comment: 6lb higher mark to contend with now after two Wolverhampton wins and he's 0-12 on turf
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 19th attempt at Wolverhampton (1m6f) last month before following up there (16.5f) three weeks ago; 6lb higher mark to contend with now and he's 0-12 on turf.

runners.name: Burvea
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner pulled up at Fairyhouse last month & is 0-7 on the Flat; tongue-tied

runners.name: Cleopatras Needle
runners.comment: In fine form over hurdles with runner-up finishes at Fairyhouse & Bellewstown; big player
runners.spotlight: Flat winner at this course (1m2f, yielding) on return around this time last year; won over hurdles at Fairyhouse last October; in fine form over hurdles last month with runner-up finishes at Fairyhouse and Bellewstown; big player back on the level.

quotes.race: Frank Lynch & Co Chartered Certified Accountants Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was Cleopatra's Needle's first run in a handicap and Sean was very good on her. He put her to sleep and was the last one to get into it. She's not a bad filly and she likes jumping. She showed a bit early on on the Flat and she was unlucky not to win three in a row. Then things just went wrong with her, she's a hard mare to keep right - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Your Navan Summer BBQ Packages Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Cleopatra's Needle worked very well last week but she always did work well and is a well-bred mare. She loves top of the ground and she's going jumping as she has schooled over hurdles. Robbie Power had her for a while, schooling her, and said she had plenty of scope - Harry Rogers, trainer.

runners.name: Waystar
runners.comment: 0-5 on turf; lesser effort on the AW on latest but trip and ground fine; considered
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 1-10 on the AW and 0-5 on turf; won at Dundalk in March (1m4f) before solid third at Bellewstown (1m4f, good) off 54; lesser effort on the AW on latest but trip and ground fine; considered.

runners.name: Bright Start
runners.comment: Closely matched with Makaiah on Dundalk fourth in March but has been regressive on turf
runners.spotlight: Only win came on dirt at Meydan in 2021; closely matched with Makaiah on Dundalk fourth in March but has been hugely regressive on turf in recent years; others preferred.

runners.name: Highland Bells

runners.name: Maxwell Smart

runners.spotlight: Modest Flat performer is 0-13 under rules but best efforts have been at this track, notably when third here last August off 49 over 1m6f; pulled up on hurdles debut on latest.

runners.name: Sunny Dude
runners.comment: Ran respectably in defeat at Dundalk a few times but well below that level since
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in defeat at Dundalk a few times but well below that level since; absence to overcome; passed over; cheekpieces.

5:00.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Kibris
runners.breeder: Hussain Alabbas Lootah&lope De Vega Synd
runners.comment: Disappointing twice this term; questions, especially on quick ground; tongue-tie goes on

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden at the Curragh on his only start last year and had a lovely run on his reappearance in the Ballysax. He was below par at Cork last weekend, but we're hoping he can get back on track next time. 24-04-25

runners.name: Dakota Blue

runners.name: Dignam

quotes.quote: Dignam is a grand, solid horse. He has a good turn of foot and has a bit of quality about him - Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Light As Air
runners.owner: P Smith,Mrs J Magnier,M Tabor,D Smith

prev_owners.owner: P Smith,Mrs J Magnier,M Tabor,D Smith

runners.name: Dahlia Noir
runners.comment: Just over 3l behind Light As Air in a Leopardstown handicap; 1m Gowran maiden winner since

runners.name: Sunriseontheboyne

runners.name: Heishybrid

runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Leopardstown maiden last summer but hasn't been as good since; however, might not have stayed 1m4f at Leopardstown on return and this trip can suit better.

runners.name: Blackjack Hills
runners.comment: Well beaten in two maidens including over C&D on debut; handicaps will suit better
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two maidens including over C&D on debut; handicaps will suit better in time.
