quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Mares Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland not winning out of turn and has been to every rodeo this year. Over hurdles, she always seems to bump into a wicked, well-handicapped one. We saw this race coming up a few months ago and when the handicapper dropped her one pound, she was in on rock bottom and I said 'lovely'. She's not the easiest to ride and can be wicked keen, but Richie [Deegan] is the most underrated rider in the country - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

quotes.race: Well Done To Our Irish Cheltenham Winners Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lilian Bland got the ground she wanted. It's been bottomless wherever we have gone but she likes that sort of heavy ground. It's loose. We'll tip away for as long as we can and see what happens - Niall Hennessy, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Lia
runners.comment: Won a mares' maiden at Tramore, has come up short in h'caps, needs more; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won a 21.5f mares' maiden hurdle at Tramore (gd-yld) in August; has come up short in handicaps since; beaten 19l when eighth of 9 at Ballinrobe (21.5f, good); down 3lb but she needs more in first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Majestic Hotel Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miss Lia is a big four-year-old, and getting the allowances today were important. She looked last day as though the step up in trip would suit well. She will get a break now and she is one to look forward to - Philip Rothwell, trainer

runners.name: Backfromtheraces
runners.comment: 0-8 over timber, ran well here over shorter in October, not sure this trip will suit
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles; placed in back to back races in October-December, including a 5l second here on soft ground over 16.5f; weakened over that distance here on latest so not sure this step back up in trip will suit (well beaten sole previous try at 2m4f); others preferred.

runners.name: The Derry Girl
runners.comment: 2m Worcester maiden winner, poor form for current yard, hard to fancy; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m Worcester maiden hurdle on good ground for Fergal O'Brien in August 2023; poor efforts in first three handicaps at 16.5f-19.5f for current yard; beaten 23l on latest at Kilbeggan; 3lb lower but hard to fancy in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Ar Nos Na Gaoithe

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Kathy Kenna

runners.comment: Clonmel win in February, ran better than result latest, place chance back at 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Won a Clonmel handicap (2m3f, soft) in February off 73; went close off revised mark at Down Royal in March; ran better than result suggests off this mark latest at Kilbeggan (2m2f, gd-yld); place claims stepped back up in trip.

quotes.race: Kilmolash (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ar Nos Na Gaoithe is just a small, summery mare and one that will give her owners tremendous fun. I told them we will keep trying and we will have our day - Philip Rothwell, trainer

runners.name: Wendells Lass
runners.comment: Decent run at Fairyhouse in December, hasn't built on that, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-10 over hurdles; ran okay at Fairyhouse (16.5f, yielding) in December off 88; hasn't repeated that in two runs since, including over this trip at Leopardstown on latest; others appeal more.

runners.name: Rose Boum
runners.breeder: Mme Catherine Savare & M Daniel Timmers
runners.comment: Best effort on latest at Ballinrobe, this shorter trip will suit, yard won this last year
runners.spotlight: Locally trained mare is 0-6 over hurdles; best effort yet a 4.75l fifth of 15 in first-time blinkers (retained) at Ballinrobe (21.5f, good) last month; this shorter trip will suit her on that evidence; yard won this last year; should go well again off the same mark.

runners.name: Native Song
runners.comment: Point winner, modest form, beaten 22l latest, cheekpieces on, others preferred, 3lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Dual point-to-point winner; hasn't shown a lot in six starts over hurdles; beaten 22l on latest at Clonmel (2m3f, soft) in February; down 2lb and cheekpieces now tried but good ground is a concern; 3lb wrong and others preferred.

runners.name: Perfectway
runners.comment: 0-9, showed a bit of promise over this trip at Gowran, lacks a recent run, best watched
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 0-9 over hurdles; best run a 15.5l fifth of 15 at Gowran (2m4f, yielding) in November when would have finished closer but for late mistake; off since poor run at Thurles (2m, good) later that month; 8lb wrong here and best watched.

3:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Swelltime
runners.comment: Won off this mark at Killarney last August, out of form since, this trip may be too sharp
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; three time winner over hurdles; last won off 100 at Killarney (2m4f, good) in August; raised 8lb and out of form since but is now back to that last winning mark, though he'd probably prefer further than this.

quotes.race: Racing Next At Navan On Saturday September 3rd Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought Swelltime was my best ride of the day. He's developed and matured into doing his bit, so it's nice that owners can give them a bit of time to strengthen. When they age, if they have ability they will thrive. He ran very well at Tramore last time - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

quotes.race: Connolly's Red Mills Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He might head to Galway for a 1m6f handicap on the Flat. He's a nice horse who obviously stays well. Possibly something like the Lartigue Hurdle could suit him. You can make plenty of use of him over two miles - Joe Murphy jnr, assistant to Joe Murphy, trainer of Swelltime

quotes.race: La Bucca Restaurants Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We fancied him a little, although not as much as it might seem. He's very one paced but he stays going well, and I'd say he'll jump a hurdle in time. We decided to make use of his strength which was going to be staying and he kept on well - Joe Murphy jnr, assistant and son of Joe Murphy, trainer

runners.name: Kaikoura
runners.breeder: M Philippe Thiriet, S A R L Charel Bloodstock & M Vincent Le
runners.comment: 0-4 over hurdles, moderate efforts in beginners' chases last twice, watch on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over timber; best effort a 12l second of 14 at Limerick in November; has returned from a break with two moderate efforts in beginners' chases; best watched on handicap debut with the hood reapplied.

runners.name: Cregane Ned
runners.comment: Without a win since 2021, off the track 427 days, entitled to need this, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Veteran is 1-11 over hurdles but that win was in 2021; best form on testing ground and has been off the track for 427 days; entitled to need this on his return; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cregane Ned has loads of ability but he just needs to relax a bit. He works really well at home, but the main thing is getting him settled. Hopefully he can pick up another one - Paul O'Flynn, trainer

runners.name: Jerrari
runners.comment: Mild promise in maiden hurdle latest, well beaten in sole h'cap start, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Just mild promise in maiden hurdles, his best effort an 8.75l fourth of 7 at Bellewstown last month; beaten 23l on handicap debut at Naas (2m, gd-yld) previously and just 2lb lower here; cheekpieces worn that day return; in good hands may need more time.

runners.name: Phoenix Cowboy
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner, 0-18 over hurdles, needs the first-time tongue tie to eke out more
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; three-time Flat winner is 0-18 over timber; running okay without threatening to win recently, beaten 7.25l on latest at Limerick (2m, good); down 1lb but needs the first-time tongue tie to eke out more.

quotes.race: McEnery Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Phoenix Cowboy is a horse that we thought wanted plenty of cut but he loved that ground. He will get further and hopefully get into a premier handicap now - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: A Nod To Getaway
runners.comment: Won this last year on soft off 12lb lower, in form but quicker ground here is a concern
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in this contest last year on soft ground off 83 and is 12lb higher now; running well in defeat recently, including a 4.25l second of 18 at Cork last month (2m, yielding); will be primed for this but good ground a worry.

runners.name: Baron Blake
runners.comment: Mild promise in maidens, can jump right, off 237 days, watch on h'cap debut unless backed
runners.spotlight: Offered something to work with in his first two maiden hurdles at 2m1f; not as good the last twice and now makes his handicap debut after a 237 day break; tendency to jump right a worry; best watched unless the market speaks.

runners.name: Lough Nigara
runners.comment: Best efforts for former yard on testing ground over further, best watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles for Matthew Daly but has shown ability; best efforts in handicaps on testing ground at Punchestown and Thurles over 2m7f; shorter trip and quicker ground concerns on debut for new yard; watch.

runners.name: Splendid Choice
runners.comment: 0-12 over timber, promise at Limerick latest, effectively 6lb lower now, chance
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over hurdles; signs of progress when a 4.5l fourth of 12 at Limerick (2m, good) off 90 last month; effectively 6lb lower here with rider's claim, good ground fine and place chance at least with a repeat of that latest effort.

runners.name: Set The Tone
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles, went close in a 2m Gowran maiden, no impact in h'caps, needs more
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles; went close in a 2m Gowran maiden (good) last October; hasn't threatened since tackling handicaps, beaten 70l latest in first-time cheekpieces (discarded); down 1lb but needs more.

runners.name: Newport
runners.comment: Promise on h'cap debut, below par three runs since, cheekpieces return, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-8 over hurdles; ran on well for a 6.25l fourth of 18 on handicap debut at Thurles (2m, good) off 90 and 3lb lower now; blinkers worn when pulled up latest are replaced by cheekpieces (wore them at Thurles); not discounted down in trip.

runners.name: Like A Bumblebee
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles, yet to finish closer than 32l to the winner, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 0-7 over hurdles; long odds for all four starts in maidens and first three handicaps and yet to finish closer than 32l to the winner; hard to make a case for on form.

runners.name: Boston Bongo
runners.comment: Best effort for former yard on heavy, tongue tie and cheekpieces on for stable bow, watch
runners.spotlight: Best effort for Barry Fitzgerald a 0.5l second at Limerick (2m, heavy) in April 2024 off 86; nowhere near that form in four runs since; tongue tie and cheekpieces on for stable debut; unproven on good ground and can only be watched.

runners.name: Im For Home
runners.comment: 0-13, didn't get home over 2m6f latest, drops in trip, place chance off the same mark
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles; not a bad effort on latest when a 12.5l third of 11 at Downpatrick (2m6f, good), not quite getting home under a positive ride; drops back in trip; place chance off the same mark.

runners.name: Knockraha Eagle
runners.comment: Not much promise in maidens, cheekpieces on for h'cap debut, best watched; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; not many positives to take from four maiden hurdle runs; cheekpieces added to tongue tie for handicap debut; not obviously well treated; best watched.

runners.name: Diamond Dollar
runners.comment: 0-9, best effort on heavy, beaten 37l after break latest, hood on, check market; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 0-9 over hurdles; best effort to date a 10.5l seventh of 15 on heavy at Limerick; beaten 37l on latest at Down Royal (2m1f, gd-yld) after a 248 day break; worth a market check if getting a run in first-time hood for shrewd yard.

runners.name: Ricky Langford
runners.comment: C&D winner off 10lb lower, never won off mark this high, place chance; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 4-37 over hurdles, including a win over C&D in July 2023 off 10lb lower; respectable efforts last three starts but has never won off a mark this high over timber; likes it here though and each way shout if gets a run.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ricky Langford wants good ground. He has a similar mark over fences and he could go for a handicap chase before the summer is out - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

4:10.race_name: Support The Irish Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap Hurdle
4:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Birmingham Alabama
runners.comment: Early faller at Punchestown festival; drops in grade and top-weight respected
runners.spotlight: Progressive staying handicapper recorded wins this past season at Punchestown and when career-best over this trip at Leopardstown in March (yielding); below best in C&D novice afterwards and early faller back in handicap company at Punchestown festival; drops in grade and top-weight respected.

runners.name: Heliko Conti
runners.comment: Back from chasing, probably wants easier ground
runners.spotlight: Only 1-17 over hurdles (win was two seasons ago in 2m novice here); standout run this past season when second in 3m Gowran handicap in testing conditions and also ran well in 3m2f beginners chase here; tame effort at Kilbeggan latest and now reverts to hurdles.

runners.name: Tranquil Sea
runners.comment: Blunder ended his chances at Fairyhouse on return; entitled to improve so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: 2m maiden winner at Cork on soft to heavy last March and proved his stamina when a clear second in 3m Clonmel handicap later in year (good); this headgear combination tried on last month's return, running okay until blunder two out put paid to his chances at Fairyhouse; entitled to come on for that and not one to rule out.

quotes.race: Dermot Casey Tree Care Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tranquil Sea was careful over those rubber hurdles but he got the job done and Sean said he had loads of horse going to the line. In time over a trip he could win a decent handicap - James Nolan, assistant trainer

runners.name: Potters Party
runners.comment: Lost action when pulled up at Fairyhouse latest; first run over hurdles in over 2 years
runners.spotlight: Fairyhouse beginners' chase winner in late 2023, having previously been placed in brief hurdling campaign; couple of good runs in handicap chases this past season, reportedly lost action when pulled up at Fairyhouse latest; first run over hurdles in over two years and races off 12lb lower mark than fences.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Potters Party seems to be better over fences and jumped well apart from the last two, he was probably very tired on the ground. He was crying out for a test of stamina and hopefully he can build on that - Robbie Power, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd improve for a step up in trip at Fairyhouse and that's exactly what happened. He kept going in tough conditions. Stamina looks his strong suit. We might go back to Fairyhouse for the Porterstown Handicap Chase in early December or a three-mile handicap chase back on the inside track there in a few weeks' time. 20-11-23

runners.name: Ballyglass Beauty
runners.comment: Lifeless comeback run over fences last month; back hurdling with trip/ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins have all been at 3m+ on both good and soft, including at Listowel festival in 2023; first run in 197 days when pulled up after lifeless run over fences at Down Royal last month and reverts to hurdles.

quotes.race: Devon Inn Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We said we'd take a chance of getting in the bottom of a handicap off a light weight with Ballyglass Beauty. It was a classy-looking race but the horses coming out helped. I said to Charlie to get him settled, creep away and ride him to get a bit of money and it worked out lovely. He's a Westerner and most of them handle heavy. He's a small, light type, so we thought we'd get away with soft. He stays and is consistent - Liam Cusack, trainer.

quotes.race: Celebrating The Life Of Sean Daly Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballyglass Beauty had a lovely run here the last day and the extra distance helped him today. He was quite keen when he came and was a bit of a runaway. He might go to Listowel - Liam Cusack, trainer.

runners.name: Duke Silver
runners.comment: First attempt at 3m here and 5yo could still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f handicap here in October (yielding-to-soft) off 97 but took a 9lb hit for that and just fair form since; just beginning his challenge when a faller three out at Thurles on latest (favourite); first attempt at 3m here and 5yo could still have more to offer.

runners.name: Cullig
runners.owner: Miss Patricia Coghlan & Diana Edwina Oakes & Guy Culliford
runners.comment: Much improved stayer of late; goes on the ground, major player again
runners.spotlight: Progressive staying handicapper this past season, runaway winner over this trip at Cork (good) and second off much higher mark afterwards at both Naas and back at Cork (soft); ground-versatile and continues to improve (up 20lb since her win) so major respect.

runners.name: Custers Mistake

prev_owners.owner: Mrs David Nagle & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Better for recent chase comeback run, trip-ground to suit back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Belated first win under rules in today's headgear combination in 2m7f Downpatrick handicap over a year ago (good) off 98; off for a year until well held over shorter trip over fences at Bangor last month; better for that comeback run and trip-ground to suit back hurdling.

runners.name: Our Soldier
runners.comment: Recent Bellewstown handicap debut second makes him a player with likely more to offer
runners.spotlight: Placed on three of four attempts hurdling, notably handicap debut last month at Bellewstown when upped to today's trip, finishing a clear second to a warm favourite (good); up 4lb but definite contender with likely more to offer.

runners.name: Juniper Hill
runners.comment: Tipperary soft-ground winner has regressed since; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Sprang a surprise when winning over this trip at Tipperary in November (soft) but hasn't backed that up, pulled up on two of three outings including latest at Leopardstown (behind Birmingham Alabama) after forcing it; hard to fancy, especially on this quicker ground.

runners.name: To The Wire
runners.comment: Mildly encouraging handicap debut last month; potential for more now upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point last year but modest enough form in 2m maiden hurdles, mildly encouraging handicap debut run on last month's return at Fairyhouse over 2m4f; potential for more now upped further in trip.

runners.name: Mickey Cohen
runners.comment: Down Royal handicap debut okay; stamina concerns at this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden with limited hurdling experience, most recently decent enough handicap debut third at Down Royal (2m4f, good) last month; not sure if flat-bred gelding is a likely improver at this longer trip.

runners.name: Kinturk Maggie
runners.comment: Little appeal unless step up in trip and quicker ground brings major improvement
runners.spotlight: A hint of ability in three maiden hurdles but well beaten opening two handicaps; upped in trip here and encounters much quicker ground than she has so far raced on.

runners.name: Southgate Avenue
runners.comment: Will need to find major improvement for this step up in trip to feature; 2lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Yet to impose himself in handicaps over shorter trips; will need to find major improvement for this step up in trip to feature; 2lb wrong.

4:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Aspire Tower

prev_owners.owner: North Yorkshire B'Stock And B McNeill

runners.comment: Classy hurdler a bit of a slow learner over fences but this looks his for the taking
runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 2 hurdles winner in his pomp back in 2020/21; missed two full seasons before returning in October 2023 and hasn't looked the same horse, though he has won twice this season, including decent C&D beginners' chase last month (yielding); okay handicap debut run in competitive Punchestown contest since, this looks much easier despite the weight concession.

quotes.race: William Hill Committed To Top Prices Hurdle
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower obviously missed a bit of time and came back and it's great to see him go do that. He likes a nice gallop and he picked up from the bend when I got stuck into him. He jumped well and enjoyed himself. I was happy with the way he lengthened away coming to the last and he'll definitely come on for it - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: WKD Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: He was so good at Christmas last year and I just felt after that his form just didn't look as good. He's a big four-year-old and he had only just come off the flat and maybe everything caught up with him a little bit as the season went on. Rachael [Blackmore] was brilliant on him, he is tough out and he did it the hard way on his first run since March. I'm delighted with Jason (The Militant) as well, he ran really well and Paul (Townend) thought he would come on from that - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Aspire Tower

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower was a bit free early on but it was his jumping that let him down. He still ran well, though - Rachael Blackmore, jockey

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I thought he did it really impressively. He went a really good gallop and jumped great. The Grade 1 back here in February is an obvious race to go for, but we'll talk to the owners and see what they want to do. He had the profile of one on the Flat that you would like to go hurdling with. I'd imagine good jumping ground would be alright for him as he's run on faster ground on the Flat - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Aspire Tower

quotes.race: Download The BETDAQ App 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower wasn't helped by the other horse but fair play to Rachael for getting him around. He ticked a lot of boxes coming to us and it's nice to see him go and do it. Leopardstown at Christmas is a race we'll definitely look at - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: Tuckergardner Lettings Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I rode Aspire Tower to be second on heavy ground at Goodwood so I knew he would handle this fine. The longer trip has suited him and he's a nice prospect for next year. - Harry Bentley, jockey

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with him when he won over hurdles at Punchestown last month, which was his first win since 2020 as he had a long layoff and then did well without winning over fences last season. We probably got it wrong at Wincanton the other day as the ground was quick on a sharp track and at a sharp trip, so he never looked comfortable. He might mix it between hurdles and fences, maybe leaning more towards hurdling. There are plenty of options for him. 18-11-24

He's another youngster who is progressing with each run. Last season he won a Grade 2 before finishing a fine second in the JCB Triumph Hurdle. This season he came out at Down Royal and won the Grade 2 WKD Hurdle from Abacadabras before putting up a career-best when second to Sharjah in the Grade 1 Matheson Hurdle over Christmas. Despite that great effort last time, he actually let himself down with poor jumps at the third-last and penultimate flights. However, as ever, he toughed it out up the straight. He's highly likely to go straight to Cheltenham now for the Champion Hurdle. 03-02-21

runners.name: Arctic Skua
runners.comment: Brought down halfway in Killarney handicap on Monday; up against it here
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-5 chasing, twice highly tried in graded company and most recently brought down halfway in Killarney handicap on Monday; up against it here.

runners.name: Foxy Girl
runners.comment: Capable back up for Aspire Tower here although really wants it softer
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner on testing ground  and easily the pick of three chase efforts last season when clear second in 2m4f Naas beginners (soft); looked a bit onepaced back at 2m at Cork latest; capable back up for Aspire Tower here although really wants it softer.

quotes.race: Signsplus Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Foxy Girl has a fair bit of scope. She jumps quickly and put her head down. It's early days yet but she had good placed form and is one to look forward to - Mike O'Connor, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She runs very well fresh and can then disappoint, so we've tried a few changes with her. She's very well and will start off in a beginners' chase when we can get some ease in the ground. 18-11-24

She's a lovely mare who came to us from France having finished second on her only run at Auteuil. She was runner-up again on her debut for us at Thurles in early December but really came on for that run and won at Limerick in good style over Christmas. The runner-up, In Excess, franked that form with a good win next time out. Foxy Girl is in good order and the plan is for her to go for the Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle. 01-03-23

runners.name: Rockstown Girl
runners.comment: Chase debut and good bit to find with a couple of these on hurdles rating
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and 2-9 over hurdles, latest win in 2m4f novice at Chepstow in October; keen, well beaten on handicap debut at Newbury in March; chase debut and good bit to find with a couple of these on hurdles rating.

quotes.race: Capital Windscreens In Memory Of Aaron Jones EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices Hurdle (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Rockstown Girl was suited by the step up in trip. She had some smart bumper form and we might look to see if there is something for her at Cheltenham's November meeting - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Ta Na La

prev_owners.owner: John Clarke & Brian McBride & Neal Clarke

runners.comment: 109-rated hurdler faces a stiff task on chase debut and first run since October
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner over an extended 2m4f on good ground at Bellewstown last summer and showed liking for decent ground when second in 2m Tramore handicap later; absent since October and stiff task on chase debut.

5:15.race_name: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap Chase
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Vaureal
runners.comment: First attempt at this extended trip and tongue-tie fitted; ideally wants easier ground
runners.spotlight: Long-priced winner of 2m4f Roscommon maiden hurdle last August and similar level over fences, acquitting himself well in 2m5f Fairyhouse handicaps, most recently clear second last month, having raced up with pace in lady riders' contest on soft; first attempt at this extended trip and tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Pipers Boreen
runners.comment: Tramore maiden winner up 3lb now back in handicap; ground likely on the quick side for her
runners.spotlight: 3m hurdles winner and off the mark chasing at sixth attempt in 2m6f Tramore beginners last month, appreciating easier fences; back in handicap company off 3lb higher so needs to improve and this ground could be lively enough for her.

quotes.race: SBK Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pipers Boreen showed a good attitude and is great to jump. The jump at the last probably sealed it for her - Shane Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: The Dabbler
runners.comment: Needs to improve on recent efforts but trip/ground ideal
runners.spotlight: Veteran won his third race when winning a handicap hurdle over 3m2f at Sligo in June; fair third over fences at Punchestown since but let down by jumping at Fairyhouse latest; trip/ground ideal but more needed.

quotes.race: Ballinrobe Water Towers Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: The Dabbler was a bit unlucky here in the Mayo National and had a bit of a look when he hit the front. He could have done with it being a bit slower (ground) - Liam Cusack, trainer.

runners.name: Shantou Princess
runners.comment: Chase form so far on much softer ground; potential improver on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won 3m Punchestown handicap hurdle in December (good-to-yielding) but hasn't impressed in three attempts chasing since on much worse ground; back from a break and potential improver back on better ground in first handicap.

runners.name: Pebble Bleu
runners.comment: Front-runner with place claims at least back chasing
runners.spotlight: Front-runner won 2m7f Punchestown handicap last season on good-to-yielding and decent run over same trip at Clonmel; unable to exploit lower hurdles mark at Bellewstown last time and more needed back chasing off this mark.

runners.name: Riggs
runners.owner: Paul M Butler & James Patrick Byrne
runners.comment: Recent Downpatrick winner up 7lb so needs to find more but ground remains in his favour
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark chasing eight days ago in 3m Downpatrick handicap on good ground (first two clear of Jimli's Cave and Cullenwaine); 7lb rise so needs to find more but ground remains in his favour.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Aintree and for quite a while I've had the £100,000 long-distance hurdle in mind for him at Haydock on Saturday. The time has come to go up in trip to 3m. He was second in the EBF Final at Sandown last season and that's always a good race. 16-11-21

runners.name: Old Soul
runners.breeder: Mme Elza Petit, Mme Hannah Petit & M Benoit De Seissan De Ma
runners.comment: Good bit to find with Vaureal on recent Fairyhouse run and probably wants easier ground
runners.spotlight: Hurdle/chase wins have been on easier ground; good bit to find with Vaureal on recent Fairyhouse run.

quotes.race: The Old House, Kill Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Old Soul was entitled to do that. Sean pulled him up quickly the last day which was good. He's not quick, he will probably go over fences quite soon - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Lets Do This
runners.comment: Absent since September, straight into handicap company for chase debut
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler but only touched off in 3m2f Sligo handicap in 2023 and good effort when last seen, finishing third of 20 in 2m7f Galway handicap hurdle in September; tongue-tie replaces usual hood for chase debut.

runners.name: Redzy Rocco
runners.comment: 0-6 hurdling, safely held in handicaps of late; of limited appeal here on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 0-6 hurdling, safely held in handicaps of late; of limited appeal here on chase debut.

runners.name: Western Model
runners.comment: Chase form underwhelming but age on his side and 9lb lower than over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Won 3m Punchestown handicap hurdle last May and couple of decent runs here over shorter; four chase efforts have been underwhelming, never counting on handicap debut last time; hard to fancy but has age on his side and stays.

runners.name: Jimlis Cave
runners.comment: Creditable chase debut 3rd to Riggs at Downpatrick recently; place claims
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over hurdles in 2m6f Downpatrick handicap, having previously finished second here over 3m; some merit on recent chase debut at former venue when staying on third behind Riggs (3m, good) and place claims on favoured ground.

runners.name: Cullenwaine
runners.comment: Recent Downpatrick fourth leaves him with a bit to find with both Riggs and Jimli's Cave
runners.spotlight: Likes a stamina test, winning over 3m1f at Thurles in December off a lowly 76; recent Downpatrick fourth leaves him with a bit to find with both Riggs and Jimli's Cave.

runners.name: Free Parking
runners.comment: 1lb wrong here on chase debut and hard to see him making an impact
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo returned from over a year's absence when tailed off at Naas in November and after further breaks well beaten twice more over hurdles; 1lb wrong here on chase debut and hard to see him making an impact.

runners.name: Kiln Time
runners.comment: Good form recently over hurdles; 2lb wrong on only second chase start but respected
runners.spotlight: Back to form for third hurdles win in 3m Naas handicap last month, getting up late on ground plenty quick (good to yielding); solid Cork effort a week ago off 5lb higher and interesting now reverting to fences on only second attempt (never featured in 2m4f handicap here in March); 2lb wrong.

runners.name: Thehairyfella
runners.comment: Low-grade maiden back with Gordon Ellliott; 2lb wong and lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Regressive in handicap chases for this yard and having run well on yard debut last summer for D J Barry, showed little afterwards; back with original trainer now and 2lb wrong here.

5:45.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
5:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Another Girl
runners.comment: Entitled to improve from Fairyhouse debut midfield finish and gets better ground here
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam Westerner Lady won a bumper and very useful hurdler/chaser for Willie Mullins; 33-1, never counted in midfield on Fairyhouse debut last month; entitled to improve and gets better ground here.

runners.name: Backwithyourown
runners.comment: Kilbeggan fourth; more likely needed here but has to be considered
runners.spotlight: Some promise in four bumpers, notably latest when making much of running in finishing fourth (Apple Jane third) at Kilbeggan last month; more likely needed here but has to be considered.

runners.name: Early Bird
runners.comment: Twice beaten favourite but Leopardstown fourth makes her a genuine contender
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite in both bumpers last season, much the best effort on second occasion on better ground at Leopardstown in March, beaten only 2l into fourth (Hello Jean third) after running prominently throughout; contender.

runners.name: Evelyn
runners.comment: Steady improvement in 3 bumpers but bit to find with Backwithyourown on Kilbeggan run
runners.spotlight: Steady improvement in three bumpers although has a bit to find with both Apples Jane and Backwithyourown on recent Kilbeggan effort.

runners.name: Foleville
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Casamento mare tongue-tied for debut and likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Casamento mare is half-sister to French 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner Shannon Falls; dam unraced sister to 10.5f Flat and 2m1f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Shannondore; tongue-tied for debut and likely best watched.

runners.name: Hello Jean
runners.comment: Outstayed over 2m4f at Fairyhouse; one to beat now back in trip if handling quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Sister to 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Indie Belle; dam useful 2m4f-2m5f hurdler; good debut effort when staying on for third (Early Bird fourth) in 2m Leopardstown bumper in March and following month just outstayed by a 2l winner over 2m4f at Fairyhouse, having travelled well; probably the one to beat now back in trip providing she handles quicker ground.

runners.name: Howyasox
runners.comment: Newcomer worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Mount Nelson mare is second foal of an unraced sister to 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Lady McCabe, from family of Champion Hurdle winner Binocular; newcomer worth a market check.

runners.name: Jetaway Nana
runners.comment: Jet Away mare, from family of Cousin Vinny; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Jet Away mare cost 10,000Euros as a 3yo; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to 2m4f-2m6f chase winner Newsworthy, from family of Champion Bumper winner and smart 2m-2m2f hurdler Cousin Vinny; market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Miss Blanco
runners.comment: Closely related to useful 2m hurdler Asian Master; interesting jockey booking on debut
runners.spotlight: Getaway mare is closely related to useful 2m hurdle winner Asian Master, half-sister to 2m hurdle winner Asian Star; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Cup Final; interesting jockey booking for debutante.

runners.name: My Doyen
runners.comment: Down Royal promise not built on at Limerick; tongue-tie now tried
runners.spotlight: Outran odds of 33-1 on debut when good fourth at Down Royal in March but didn't back that up at Limerick month later under a positive ride; tongue-tie now tried.

runners.name: Sophia Rose
runners.comment: Keen when a bit disappointing favourite on Limerick debut; more expected of here
runners.spotlight: Sister to bumper winner and 2m hurdle winner Captain Butler, half-sister to two bumper winners; dam 1m6f Flat and useful 2m-2m4f hurdle winner; favourite on Limerick debut last month, keen and a bit green when only fifth of 14; more expected of here.

runners.name: Apples Jane
runners.comment: Fair form; needs to improve to play a leading role, not sure this ground will suit
runners.spotlight: Out of the brilliant racemare Apple's Jade; went close on debut at Naas in February (soft) but hasn't built on that run twice since, latest when looking a bit onepaced when third at Kilbeggan last month on good-to-yielding; needs to improve to play a leading role, not sure this ground will suit.

runners.name: Faliraki
runners.comment: Flat-bred probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Gustav Klimt half-sister to German 1m/1m1f winner El Faras; dam unraced sister to 7f/1m winner King Pin, closely related to 5f-7f winner Time To Reason, half-sister to 1m4f Listed winner Birch Grove; flat-bred probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Freeway
runners.comment: Jet Away filly best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Jet Away filly is second foal of an unraced sister to 2m/2m3f hurdle winner A Doll In Milan, out of bumper winning half-sister to smart 2m6f-3m4f hurdle/chase winner Frantic Tan; best watched on debut.

3:25.race_name: Racing TV Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)

runners.name: Monmiral
runners.breeder: S A R L Carion Emm
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason J Hales & L Hales
runners.comment: Sole win in over four years came in 2024 Pertemps Final; may find one or two too good
runners.spotlight: Last year's Pertemps Final winner, that his only win in over four years; shaped as though retaining all ability last season and respectable effort in the Grade 1 Liverpool Hurdle but looks more a place prospect than a win-only one.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Final Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral has loads of ability. We have been trying to make a chaser out of a hurdler, but he didn't like it. I thought I would qualify him at Chepstow two weeks ago, and he actually needed the run that day as he hadn't really finished a race for a long time. Freddie [Gingell] rode him the other day and said that he thought he might have won at two out but he blew up. He said to try him in blinkers and I listened to what he said. Whether they have made a difference I don't know, but he has obviously come back to himself a little bit. I said to Harry, 'Give him plenty of daylight as he doesn't need to be boxed in', and he gave him a beautiful ride. The horse has always wanted a trip. He has had small problems which hasn't helped us, but he has been a real head-scratcher. It is great for his owners and the whole of my team to get a winner here - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Highflyer Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're thrilled with that, Monmiral had a nice clear round and jumped well. He'll improve for that and we'll probably head off to Sandown next for the Henry VIII Novices' Chase. It's a different day and a different track, so I'd say he'll come on a lot for that on his next run. He came in a bit later and I was a bit concerned with how he might jump today but Harry (Cobden) was thrilled with his jumping - he said he'd come on tonnes for the run so I'm thrilled. The winner was really good and is favourite for the Arkle on the back of it, but we've a long way to go between now and then. He's a very smart horse without a shadow of a doubt and will be very hard to beat but we were always going to come here and then go to Sandown and I'd suspect we still will. Hopefully the ground will be a bit more testing there, but I was very pleased - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Anniversary 4-Y-O Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral is a proper Grade 1 horse and the best juvenile I've sat on. I'd rather see him jump a fence (next season). He travels well and jumps great. He's probably beaten the best English juvenile; he's top class - Harry Cobden, rider. He's just kept on improving and getting stronger as the season has gone on and today I thought was the best he's looked. It's just hard for the novice chasers at five (years old) these days. They don't get much weight allowance in the spring and taking on the older horses in the spring is quite hard. If he had another year over hurdles it wouldn't do him any harm and then he could go novice chasing five into six. It might be nice to start him in something like the Fighting Fifth on a galloping track and then we'd know where we were going. It's something to think about over the summer - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Summit Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral is a lovely type and I like him a lot. He probably got there a bit too soon because he was travelling and winging hurdles and he'll be better with a lead for longer. He was just looking around in front [at the second last] and then I got after him and he winged the last - Sean Bowen, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He gave us all a great day when winning the Pertemps last season and has two options next month ? I'll make a decision closer to the time. He's consistent and would have to carry a big weight in the Pertemps or we step him back up to Grade 1 level. I'm not saying he'd win the Stayers' if he lines up in that, but he could run into a place. 9-2-25

runners.name: Heloy Delabarriere
runners.comment: Respectable effort in Grade 1 here in November but below that level since over fences
runners.spotlight: Closely matched with Losange Bleu on 3m hurdle form here in November but below that level over fences since and arrives here off the back of a fall at Compeigne; best watched returned to hurdles.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I couldn't have had a better ride off Hewick. He travelled great but it probably took him a circuit to figure out the fences and on the second circuit I got a much better ride from him. He'd figured them out and was clever. I was getting excited after the Canal Turn. I thought I could get the job done and it was just conserve, conserve. I thought we might relive that moment in the King George and just outgrind them, but I kind of knew my fate going to the third-last and it wasn't to be. He's come back safe and sound though and just needed a sprinkle of water - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

quotes.race: Jimmy Neville Memorial Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hewick was brilliant. He'll go for the National now and this was a lovely set-up for it. Every time I asked him he was there for me and he travelled great. Hopefully he'll go to Aintree with a great chance - Paddy Hanlon, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing TV Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Hewick jumped well, did everything and a better horse beat us. I know we're better over fences but that shows what I have, he's a great horse - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Turning out of the back I said we will still be in the first three. It was some ride. I thought the game was up, but Hewick has such a heart. He is a small horse. Probably the race for him in the future is the Grand National, but now when you are here you have to go for a Gold Cup. I said he was getting one run (before the Gold Cup) and he was coming here for that. Cheltenham will suit this horse a lot better as it is a tougher three and a quarter miles there. There was a lot of the other horses that had problems, and we came here fresh and we had a great man on board and that was it - Shark Hanlon, trainer.  Put it this way - if it wasn't the King George I probably would have pulled up! I knew that he stays and stays and I just wasn't able to get going. There are only so many questions you can ask them and if they are not responding you can't ask. Shark said before I got on him he is  is the smallest horse here but he has got the biggest heart and that perfectly sums him up - Gavin Sheehan, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: bet365 Oaksey Chase (Grade 2) (For The Menorah Challenge Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to go for the Bet365, but with the fall Hewick got at Cheltenham I thought it was the right thing to do for the horse to give him a confidence boost. His season's only just starting because he's a summer horse. I just wanted him to get around safe and Rachael's ridden him beautifully, as she always does. I have something planned but I'm not going to say it yet. You'll see it in time, but I have a plan for him in six weeks' time and it won't be in England or Ireland. He'll also go back to America, but we might go somewhere else with him, have horse, will travel - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's been a dream run with Hewick - this is unreal. We bought him for just 800euros.  Jordan gave him a super ride and knows the horse well. In the closing stages I was nearly afraid to look because the loose horses were doing harm. Everyone told me during the week he wasn't fast enough for this. At Sandown they were going a strong pace from the first furlong, and I knew they wouldn't be going that pace here. I knew he'd have the pace for this race. You need to be ridden prominently here because you stay out of trouble. I knew he'd stay all day. I told Jordan that if he was four lengths behind them at the dip he'd win by five [lengths] - John 'Shark' Hanlon, trainer

quotes.race: Vickers Independent Family Run Bookmaker Durham National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hewick stays the trip and was very good. This opens up a lot of doors and he'll probably go on a break now as he's a good ground horse. Next year, there's a lot of Nationals for him and we'll be spending a lot of time over here. He's only a young horse at six and I think he'll keep improving - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Devon Inn Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hewick is very consistent and I was disappointed he didn't get into the Kerry National. I also had him entered in this race so we said we'd come here. He loves the trip, and the ground dried up which is a big help. He loves good ground  - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Camida Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Hewick is a lovely horse and needs that fast ground. He's a summer horse and maybe we will go for a winners somewhere. He likes that trip and that ground.

stable_tour.quote: He's back in and did his first piece of work last week. There are a few different races we have in our mind for him, one coming up at Thurles, but his main aim is most definitely the Gold Cup. We can't wait to have another crack at it. We ran him here, there and everywhere last season, and he picked up a huge amount of prize-money, but we will be more selective this season. Jordan [Gainford] thought he was about to get his second wind in the Gold Cup when he came down. We're looking forward to getting back there again. 27-11-23

runners.name: Jeu De Thaix
runners.owner: Mme Patrick Papot & Mme Daniela Mele

quotes.race: Racing TV Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I try not to miss an objective but all I can do is try and work in the right way. We had a virus in the yard which is why we didn't run Losange Bleu in the final prep race and we've only had a month to get back from that. I didn't have much doubt he would stay and we decided not to hold him up, but to step up from 3,900 metres to 5,100 metres in a Grade 1 is not something every horse could manage - Dominique Bressou, trainer.

runners.name: Imbatable Du Seuil
runners.owner: Andrew Peake, Mme Marc Boudot Et Al
runners.comment: Respectable effort in Grade 3 last time but considerably more needed if he's to win this
runners.spotlight: Hurdle and chase winner who ran respectably in Grade 3 over 2m5.5f last time; however, needs to better all hurdle form by some way if he's to figure on these unfavourable terms.

runners.name: Nyiri
runners.owner: Christian Trecco, Mme P Cottin & F Dezzutto
runners.comment: Respectable efforts of late but needs to raise game by some way if he's to win this
runners.spotlight: Beat El Clavel in Listed event here in March and ran to similar level in Grade 2 last time; however, hard to envisage him reversing placings with runner-up Losange Bleu on unfavourable terms.

runners.name: Kentucky Wood
runners.breeder: Scea Bertwood Stables & N De Lageneste
runners.comment: Listed hurdle winner who won a Grade 2 chase last April; improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Listed winner over hurdles who won a Grade 2 chase here just over a year ago; mainly creditable efforts since but work to do returned to this sphere at these weights.

runners.name: El Clavel
runners.breeder: Haras D'Haspel & Terrains D'Avilly St Leonard
runners.comment: Capable hurdler but behind Losange Bleu last time and now worse off at the weights
runners.spotlight: Respectable effort behind Losange Bleu over 2m5.5f here last time but worse off at the weights with that rival; yet to tackle this trip and a surprise if placiings are reversed.

runners.name: Benou
runners.breeder: J-P Garcon, G Garcon & Mlle C Garcon
runners.owner: Phoenix Eventing Sarl & Earl Haras De Lhotellerie

runners.name: Jachar
runners.owner: Jean-Marie Callier, Henry Messer-Bennetts Et Al

runners.name: Echo De Champdoux
runners.owner: Mme Marie-Helene Cassier, Philippe Peltier & Daniel Beaunee

runners.name: Iceberg Du Large
runners.owner: Mme M-C De Saint-Seine, Comte G De Saint-Seine Et Al

runners.name: Kalibre
runners.breeder: Mme S Cozenot & Haras De Saint-Voir
runners.owner: Herve Cozenot, S Dehez Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Des Dragons & Mme Natalie Carter

runners.name: I Can Do It Sir
runners.breeder: E Clayeux, Earl Patrick Joubert & Sc Ecurie Couderc
runners.owner: Ecurie Patrick Joubert, E Clayeux & Sc Ecurie Couderc

runners.name: Karnaval Point
runners.owner: Renato Bruni, Normandy Bloodstock Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Michael Gonzalez, Charles Murphy Et Al

stable_tour.quote: Off for a year, he was too fresh at the Grand National meeting but came on for that to win at Warwick next time, although the heatwave prevented another run. I'm pleased with how he's going. 24-10-22

runners.name: Goal Oriented
runners.breeder: Runnymede Farm Llc & Cwc Investment 2 Llc
runners.owner: Sf Racing Llc, Starlight Racing Et Al
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and holds leading claims.
runners.spotlight: Landed a narrow success in an allowance optional claimer at Churchill Downs (sloppy track) two weeks ago upped to 1m 1/2 f; on a hat-trick after last win and nicely bred (by Not This Time); stable is ticking along nicely; should have every chance on first attempt at a big race.

runners.name: Journalism
runners.owner: Bridlewood Farm, Don Alberto Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Should not be far away; second in the Kentucky Derby 14 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Won a Grade 2 in December and took the Santa Anita Derby 42 days ago; ahead of Sandman and American Promise when runner-up (beaten 1 1/2 l, sloppy track) in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs two weeks ago; he's an attractive contender.

quotes.race: Kentucky Derby presented by Woodford Reserve (Grade 1) (3yo) (Main Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I had a beautiful trip. I had the trip I wanted and saved ground into the first turn. On the backside, I had a lot of horses in front of me that didn't appear to have a chance. So, I knew I had enough horse still and waited for the right time. Past the half-mile pole Journalism started running for me. I was smoothly getting him into a rhythm. I wanted to turn for home with just a couple of horses ahead of me. That's what happened but Sovereignty was the best today - Umberto Rispoli, jockey.Journalism broke well. But at the eighth pole the first time by he got shuffled by a horse just to our outside over toward the rail. But Umberto [Rispoli] got him in the clear and he was in a good spot all the way through the backside. He made a nice middle move, then on the turn for home he opened up but I saw the blue silks coming at us and I knew that was the one we were going to have to be concerned about. He ran on the best he could and he ran a very good race. But the winner ran a better race - Michael McCarthy, trainer.

runners.name: American Promise
runners.comment: This is competitive and unlikely to do better than a supporting role.
runners.spotlight: Problems at the start (bumped, Churchill Downs, sloppy track) behind two of these when tailed off in the Kentucky Derby 14 days ago; won a Grade 3 in March; has chalked up two wins from his last five; passed over with a number of his rivals in good nick.

runners.name: Heart Of Honor
runners.comment: Nose second in Group 2 UAE Derby on the Dirt at Meyden;  place claims.
runners.spotlight: Has in fantatsic form on the Dirt in UAE this winter winning two conditions races over 1m before finishing second three times in Listed and Pattern company most recently when a nose second to Admire Daytona in the Group 2 UAE Derby (1m1f110y) picking up plenty of prize-money in the process; interesting to see where that form stands in this field but unlike many GB raiders is proven on Dirt.

quotes.race: UAE Derby Sponsored By Jumeirah (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Heart Of Honor has put up a lifetime best and you always have to be pleased when that happens. But this is a tough one to swallow - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

quotes.race: UAE 2000 Guineas Presented By Longines (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It had a mile and a quarter written all over it. There was a lot of traffic and Heart Of Honor doesn't have the gate speed of some of the others. Clearly, he's long in stamina. We've got four weeks until the Al Bastakiya and that's where we'll go. The extra couple of furlongs looks like being the key - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Maritime City (DMC) (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Heart Of Honor had a few quicker horses around him this time and they came across him and he got a bit of kickback. He didn't learn much last time as we were three or four wide and he didn't face any kickback. He still had a good old look when he hit the front, so I think there's a bit more in the tank. We mustn't forget that he was giving away 5lb too, probably to a good horse, so it was a tough performance - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

quotes.race: Arabian Radio Network (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Jim and Claire came here last year with Many A Star, who wasn't good enough, and this year we wanted to do things differently so thankfully they backed me in buying dirt horses. It was also my brief to give Claire a winner two days before her birthday, and it's not often a plan comes off! - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

runners.name: Pay Billy
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and can't be considered.
runners.spotlight: Going for a hat-trick; narrow success in a stakes (Laurel Park) four weeks ago; couldn't be confident about him on first attempt at a big race.

runners.name: River Thames
runners.owner: Winstar Farm Llc, Chc Inc Et Al
runners.comment: Likely to be in contention; not beaten far five weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Third but only beaten less than a length five weeks ago (Keeneland) in a Grade 1; has made an impressive start to his career with two wins from four starts; has to be respected.

runners.name: Sandman
runners.owner: Dj Stable Llc, St Elias Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Should not be far away; successful three times in his last seven starts.
runners.spotlight: Managed three wins in his last seven outings; well held in the Kentucky Derby (Churchill Downs, sloppy track) 14 days ago; is a player.

quotes.race: Kentucky Derby presented by Woodford Reserve (Grade 1) (3yo) (Main Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Sandman was traveling well despite being the first time on the sloppy track. I felt like on the backside I was following the right horses and I saw Junior (Alvarado on Sovereignty) and Journalism in front of me. I wish I was more patient and sat there a little longer and cut the corner. He was very steady, gave me a good effort but disappointed with the result - Jose Ortiz, jockey.

runners.name: Clever Again
runners.owner: Winchell Thoroughbreds Llc, Mrs John Magnier Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier, Michael B Tabor Et Al

runners.comment: Ought to be competitive; has won two of his three career runs.
runners.spotlight: Has won two of his three career runs; got the job done by 4l at Oaklawn Park over 1m (stakes) 48 days ago; has to be considered.

runners.name: Gosger
runners.breeder: Harvey A Clarke Racing Stable LLC
runners.owner: Harvey A Clarke Racing Stables Llc
runners.comment: Despite that Keeneland success, may have to settle for supporting role at best.
runners.spotlight: Winner of two of his three runs to date and related to Grade 1 winner Harvey's Lil Goil; last seen landing the Lexington Stakes (Keeneland) last month; despite that Keeneland success, not hard to turn elsewhere.

runners.name: Towering Vision
runners.breeder: Qiji Nz Thoroughbred Club Ltd & W O Yue
runners.owner: Te Akau Look Smart Racing Partnership

runners.name: Toretto
runners.owner: Johno Benner, Simon Barber Et Al

runners.name: Do You Just
runners.owner: T Doyle, Forest Partnership Et Al

runners.name: Rufus
runners.breeder: Mrs C A Hewson, G M Hewson Et Al
runners.owner: Mrs C A Hewson, G M Hewson Et Al
